Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever...”
Reviews.Author: JanMAustin
Reviews.Content: LOVED it ...We spend 4 days at this hotel and was not disappointed. The service we received was 5 stars. From the time we stepped in the lobby till we left we were treated as royalty. The piano music was so refreshing. We will spend all our visits to New Orleans at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Will do again.”
Reviews.Author: easttexas43
Reviews.Content: We were 3 members of 1 family & needed a room with 2 double beds & with a balcony. No problem. Lovely room, comfortable beds, great view from the balcony. Hotel parking garage was expensive & we were worried about the safety of our car & it's contents. Personnel assured us not to worry. They were correct. One morning we asked our favorite Doorman, Sean, to bring us some stuff from our car & he was at our door in the blink of an eye. He was always polite & helpful during our visit. Excellent breakfast in the dining room for $10.00 that can easily feed 2 people. All hotel personnel friendly & competent. Excellent location for walking tour of the French Quarter. Walk to Cafe Du Mond for Beignets-required!

Reviews.Title: “So much fun”
Reviews.Author: Peke47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn on Bourbon for a long weekend. Being in the 'over 60' crowd, we wondered what we might be getting ourselves into. Great. The hotel is awesome, the staff is very friendly and willing to do whatever they could to help out. The breakfasts were great, the room was very, very clean, and we will go back someday. It's a great location and within walking distance of River Walk, Cafe Du Monte.. a must for everyone, no matter how long the line is! We recommend the Inn on Bourbon for everyone. It's great!!

Reviews.Title: “Before cruise stay was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tazdeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights pre-cruise with 4 adults and 4 kids in connecting rooms. The hotel was wonderful, clean rooms, plesant staff and a locatioin to die for. Since our kids are aged from 15 to 8 yrs old we requested and recieved a interior room. We never heard a peep from Bourbon street. At night a room key is needed at the door to enter the hotel so we felt safe leaving the older kids alone to babysit while we hit the bars. The hotel is located half way down Bourbon, just around 3 blocks to Jackson square and all the tourist attractions. The kids used the pool and said it was nice although the water was cold. The hotel did not have any parking/ shuttles to the cruise port, but getting a cab was easy and the fare was only $12. Would stay hear again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Bachlorette Party”
Reviews.Author: traveling20
Reviews.Content: What an awesome hotel. We had 5 rooms and one balcony suite for a bachlorette party. What a way to experience Bourbon Street. It was St. Patty's weekend. We had the bachlorette lingerie shower on the balcony. It was awesome. The hotel was very clean and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Jack P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last summer and loved it. Room was well kept and more than adequate considering we were not there to spend much time in the room. That said, we chose an interior room overlooking the courtyard and the view was great and it was surprisingly quiet given all of the activity in the area. Can't beat the location for the price. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great off-season deal”
Reviews.Author: WileyPost
Reviews.Content: We had always wanted to stay at this hotel and noticed that they were running a special. We jumped on it and were glad that we did. We had a room facing Bourbon St. that was huge. Loved the bed and the amenities. It is right in the heart of Bourbon and was a bit noisy. Didn't bother us at all - we were exhausted from having fun. Special note: on Wednesdays, a couple times a month, they host really good free entertainment. It was impressive.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location on bourbon st.”
Reviews.Author: hopPortlandMi
Reviews.Content: great hotel we went the week after mardi gras and our room was facing the courtyard which was beautiful didn't use the pool but looked very clean and nice. It was quiet where we were at but we weren't facing the street. You could hear the noise from the hallways but wasn't too big of an issue. Room very clean bathroom was small but nice.. Staff very friendly. Location was perfect. It is right in the middle of everything. It was great to walk around bourbon st at night and then just walk right to your room plus close to attractions during the day. Had a great experience and would definatley go back. also they had balconies facing the courtyard and was nice to sit out and enjoy the sun!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Week Before Halloween - great location”
Reviews.Author: kov57
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Bourbon St. 3rd floor balcony noise is constant till 4am but recommend 2nd floor balcony if your wanting a closer street view. Had a great time be prepared to $$$ for the location and view.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of the nightlife on Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: kimothy393
Reviews.Content: Loved the view. We loved that we could hear the music and festivities from Bourbon Street but if you are looking for a quiet room request the courtyard view. The rooms are really nice and the beds are super comfortable. You can't beat the location and the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Em4112
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Inn on Bourbon. Our room was clean and tastefully decorated, and the location was perfect. The service was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and rooms were really nice”
Reviews.Author: philakamila
Reviews.Content: To start off me and a friend drove from Florida to New Orleans and were gonna get there around 12 noon and kept calling to see if we can get an early check in since we've been up all night driving... We ended up getting in the hotel around 2pm instead of the usual check at 4 which was great! Our bell man Sean Walton was awesome! He told us everything about New Orleans, where to go, what to see and even where to eat. His knowledge of the city and his just general knowledge was like I was talking to a hotel concierge. We basically didn't even have to google anything because he gave us exact directions where to go for dinner and what to do after and where to go the following day. This hotel was great. The location, the service and the room. Definitely would spend another night here if I ever came back.

Reviews.Title: “Nola for NY”
Reviews.Author: patty2011_50
Reviews.Content: Best location for the French Quarter! We have stayed at a few hotels in New Orleans for New years. The two before this year we stayed at the Aston Crown Plaza on Canal. This is a really nice hotel but the Inn on Bourbon has the best location. Right in the center of the action!! We had an upgraded room with a balcony overlooking the pool. Nice view but the room and the balcony were very small.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, best concierge ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sacha_HM
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just stayed for 2 nights at this hotel and I would definitely recommend it to everyone. Spending about 60 nights a year travelling for work, I sleep in quite a lot of hotels and this simply is a good hotel. Apart from one of the staff at check out everyone was extremely friendly, the room was lovely and the hotel is beautiful. If you don't want to be in the middle of everything you shouldn't stay on Bourbon Street so people really shouldn't complain about that. More than anything praise goes to Ann, the 'concierge'. She knows everything about where to go and what to do and takes time telling you about it. We were two girls by ourselves and felt looked after and taken care off as she made sure to tell us where it was safe. I will most certainly return to this hotel and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: BeckStar79
Reviews.Content: Perfect location right on Bourbon street, old world luxury, comfortable rooms, we had a room overlooking the pool on the second floor with a balcony which was a nice surpirse for the price (we found the room at a great discount on the day with hotels.com).

Reviews.Title: “Location and charm!”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia83
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel with a few friends while in town for a wedding (which happened to coincide with a Saints game AND the BCS championship so it was quite a busy weekend in NOLA!). The location is stellar...you really are right on Bourbon! I've found that sometimes you compromise quality for location, but that definitely wasn't the case with the Inn on Bourbon! The hotel rooms were really nice, the building is historic (used to be an opera house), and the breakfast area was lovely. I'm not sure if this is normal all the time (or just due to the fact that they are renovating their restaurant) but we got a free continental breakfast in the lovely breakfast area in the lobby that has huge picture windows that look out onto Bourbon Street. It wasn't anything fancy, just some bagels, cereal, juice, and coffee, but the sitting area felt very regal. I didn't have a chance to check out the pool but the pool area looked really nice! The one main caveat: noise. Not terrible (we faced the back of the building and not Bourbon so we heard no street noise), but keep in mind that bars stay open very very late and you will undoubtedly hear drunk people finding their way back to their rooms. I'd say this is a great place to stay with a group of friends or even a significant other (as long as you aren't looking for a super quiet romantic stay) but not necessarily a place for people with young kids. Overall I had a great stay and will absolutely look forward to coming back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, quiet if you choose the right rooms”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLikestotravel
Reviews.Content: A party of 11 of us stayed here between Christmas and New Year, two families of 4, and some friends. Several of us paid extra to have a balcony overlooking the pool and courtyard and thought it was worth the extra money, for our kids we didn't spend the extra but did stipulate courtyard rooms. One person in our group did not do this and had a room overlooking the street and was totally unable to sleep for the wild revelry on Bourbon at night, the hotel did accommodate her and move her the next day. Location is great, right in the heart of the French quarter, a quick walk to Cafe du Monde, Canal Street and the St Charles streetcar line and to St Louis Cemetery No. 1. Rooms very nicely appointed, flat screen TV's and free internet, though it was a bit spotty. Restaurant was being remodeled but no shortage of great places to eat all around. Would definitely return if we could get courtyard rooms again.

Reviews.Title: “NO: Morning coffee, Newspaper, Room service”
Reviews.Author: alwaysabeginner
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been under construction since June 2011 according to the elevator placard. (we were there for New Years 2012) the placard also displays the lobby Cont'l Breckfast, but not that it is free. We called for Room Service, None available. We went down to the lobby for coffee, the self serve coffee urn was out. Staff Says" Drink Decaf" Welcome to the Inn on Bourbon. I stayed 5 nights, complained that I couldn't get a complimentary "USA Today" and the front desk had one delivered to my room on Friday. YEA!. I found a camera in my room the first morning and turned it in to the front desk, guess the cleaners missed it.The desk keeps ear plugs for street noise, YEA! Room had a stained carpeting and the halls were smelly. The staff was good & not good,overall too many excuses. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great price & location”
Reviews.Author: betsifur
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days, to celebrate our 20th annivesary. The room was wonderful and all the staff were very friendly. We were on the 4th floor, so no balcony, but I wasn't willing to pay extra for that, so it was OK. There was definitely noise from Bourbon Street, but it didn't stop us from sleeping, and it's to be expected in that location.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: sweetpeatibbie
Reviews.Content: Stayed on my honeymoon we loved everything about This hotel. Are staying here again for new years eve. Going back here for our first annivary .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: chelsd06
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect! We got it at a great price for the location and even upgraded to a balcony room on Bourbon! We went as a group for the Saints game and had an amazing time! The location is perfect! The beds were comfy and the room was so clean! My only complaint is that we didn't stay longer!!! We will definitely choose this hotel for our next trip! PS- Yes, it was loud staying on Bourbon.... But it's Bourbon Street!!!!! What do you expect?!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: donnaWashPa
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing,so close to it all.Everybody treated us so good.Would stay here again and I do intend to stay again soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jenny W
Reviews.Content: Perfect but bring earplugs for sleep, or get a room in the back, away from Bourbon. I was fine on second floor balcony, with hear-o's earplugs, and again in room on the back with no earplugs. Loved the people too, everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: xlix
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the location. We picked this hotel based on recommendations found on TA. Although we had booked one balcony room and one standard room, the front desk agent was kind enough to upgrade the standard room to a balcony room at no additional cost. The front desk agent also made some excellent recommendations for a late night dinner. If you anticipate spending the bulk of your time on Bourbon St., look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Dwaynev
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a convention I had in New Orleans. When I first got here I was a bit concerned about location. I was surprised how well I slept, and I could not hear anything transpiring on the street outside. This hotel is clean and well maintained. The pool is located in the courtyard, and is also kept very clean and is well maintained. If you are looking for a New Orleans Experience, then I think you should stay here

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: badidea223
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Thanksgiving week and it was a nice hotel with friendly staff. The parking: Valet which is nice. The staff: all where friendly and helpful...gave us dinner and breakfast recomendations that were awesome The room: Since I read the reviews about it being loud...I asked for a room on the court yard side...it was quiet and nice. (The only issue I had was the people next to us where drunk and loud. I slipped a note under thier door letting them know we could hear every word and they quickly quited down) :) Over all, I would stay there again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: Diane B
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly, helpful and very good at what they do. the hotel was clean and well maintained and right in the middle of all the action on Bourbon Street. If you are looking for quiet, this isn't the place, but if you don't mind hearing music and revelry from your room it's just fine. We had a balcony on Toulouse. Book early if you want to have one on Bourbon Street. Overall, a great experience and I couldn't ask for a nicer hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “clean , friendly , great location”
Reviews.Author: JDBell
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were treated with great respect. The rooms and the hotel itself are very clean. The staff was both helpful and friendly. The only thing I would avoid are the rooms overlooking Bourbon St. Ours was overlooking Bourbon (not a balcony) and noise didn't stop until about 4:45 am both nights. So if you are a light sleeper , get a room facing the pool or courtyard. Great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but a mixed bag.”
Reviews.Author: paulforkfly
Reviews.Content: We just left the hotel this morning. While we generally found the hotel pleasant there were a few negatives worth noting. 1) Noise. We decided to stay off of the Bourbon St side of the hotel. This was a wise move. Nonetheless, noise we really a problem on occasion. There are some very easy fixes that the hotel should look into. First, the patio doors have a massive gap all the way around them. They don't close well. Simple weatherstrippiing may help. 2) Cleanliness. The rooms were ok, but the 4th floor of the hotel had an unpleasant smell during the entire stay. Also, we noticed that while the linens were clean, the pillows were an absolute mess under the covers. Ugly stains, the origin of which I'd prefer not to consider. 3) Bathroom doors. You may get stuck! They are very narrow double doors that are held closed by a latch system. One of those doors required tremendous force to open. 4) Wifi. Free, but very, very slow. 5) Breakfast. Also free, but rather limited. The only major issue here is one that could be fiixed by the hotel in five minutes. Buy another toaster. Believe it or not, toasting is like a competitive sport in the breakfast lounge. 6) The remodel. This wasn't as major an issue for us as it's been for others. Noise from the remodel was a minor annoyance, and nothing more. Upside? Simple the best location. Friendly staff...once we arrived. Whoever I spoke with on the phone was incredibly rude the day we checked in. Staff friendlness seems to be a major issue here on TripAdvisor. Management should look into this.

Reviews.Title: “Something for EVERYONE”
Reviews.Author: Mysticyat
Reviews.Content: If you are headed to New Orleans, this is a great location to consider. It is located in the middle of the French Quarter, so you are walking distance to all of the great sights and restaurants. If you are into crazy nightlife and constant action - it is right outside of the hotel's front door. If you're like me and want to be close, but without all the frenzy, ask for one of the rooms at the back, away from Broubon St. My room was on the opporsite side from Bourbon, quiet with a charming French country decor and a window overlooking picturesque rooftops and hidden patios of the French Quarter. It really was the best of both worlds!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Action”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineW15
Reviews.Content: Had a room with a balcony off the quarters which made sleep easy. Rooms were nice and everyone was very friendly. Looking forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “* NEVER AGAIN * AFTER 10 YEARS”
Reviews.Author: Jody S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in Oct 18-20th. We checked in, walked down street to a seafood restaurant. Returned about 6:00pm..Our room was on Bourbon st. Husband and I sat on balcony. After a while he went inside to watch tv. As I sat on balcony, I saw a tall,black man across street looking up at me, and I could tell by his head movement he was counting rooms.And he quicly walked towards the Inn.. I felt uneasy and ran through and placed bolt on door. *BAM ** door was forced,but lock stopped him. My phone rang and I was told that he was maintenance and he was checking to see if anyone was in room. There was NO KNOCK, just force on door. I called Front Desk, and told what happened. Person said : OH YES, that was maintenance... We have stayed here every year, but never again. I teach at Texas Prison, and Inmates told me we were most likely going to be robbed..I sent Inn an email, and they ignored... BTW,,,, I LOOKED FOR THAT MAN THE NEXT FEW DAYS, AND HE WAS NO WHERE IN SITE... UNSAFE PLACE..

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: TimMicheleCamrose
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the middle of all the action. All staff were knowledgeable and helpful. Our room overlooked Bourbon street and we were on the 5th floor so no balcony. The street noise is fairly loud throughout the night but that was to be expected. If I were to go again would book a balcony room on the street or in the courtyard, if I wanted more rest,but who goes to New Orleans to sleep! AN adequate continental breakfast was included in what seemed a very welll priced room!The hotel is very well maintained and would recommend this to anyone who wants to be in the middle of all the fun!

Reviews.Title: “This Place Stinks!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler1632
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently, and it was the worst experience I have ever had in a hotel. The staff here were really rude, the hotel is really loud and construction activity woke us up at 6:30 in the morning. Also, one of the managers told us that because we booked through Expedia we could not be guaranteed our room and would not be moved to another room without paying for an upgrade (none of the electrical outlets in our bathroom worked and the hotel couldn't, or wouldn't fix the problem. Nevertheless, the manager - Alex Williams - would not let us change rooms). Here are some specifics: 1) The hotel is loud: we had a quiet room, which meant it didn't face Bourbon street. We had no illusions about perfect peace and quiet, but the doors to the hallway are not sound proof and the noise from the hallway woke us up all night. This was not just people partying either, we heard room service in the morning knocking on doors and talking in the hallways; 2) Construction Noise: the hotel has construction going on and we were twice woken up at 6:30 by drilling and hammering under our room. We called the front desk, and the hammering and drilling stopped for about fifteen minutes then started again. The front desk kept telling us they would take care of this and never did; 3) The staff is rude: not all the staff, one of the front desk employees was very nice, but he was the exception. Other employees lied to us about switching rooms, promised to fix problems with our room and didn't and were downright nasty. Alex Williams in particular, one of the hotel managers, by th way, wa particularly rude. We spoke to him about our problems and he basically threw up his hands and told us it wasn't his problem. Then be actually called our room to tell us we booked through Expedia and had no right to another room. That's right, we booked through Expedia so we have no right to a room without problems or the king bed we requested (we got two doubles). All in all this was an awful experience. We stayed for three nights and didn't get a full nights sleep during any of them. There are so many other nice hotels around this area, and I strongly suggest staying at one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience! Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bellabeanlab
Reviews.Content: We came to celebrate a birthday and had a horrible experience. Part of the hotel is under construction and loud construction noises start at 6:00am. Staff are rude. Appliances and outlets do not work in the rooms, and staff repeatedly refused to fix anything. Recommend avoiding this place and trying Omni or Loews.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDO60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Halloween weekend and had a great time. The Bourbon Street Balcony room is the only way to go if you are looking to fully enjoy the nightlife. We couldn't have asked for more and will be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: anissa96
Reviews.Content: I've been to New Orleans many many times and this is the first time I've stayed in this hotel. The room itself was perfectly lovely although we did not have a terrace. Having a terrace would have been great, but I suspect that the noise would have a been a problem. The elevator situation wasn't ideal and we ended up having to walk down the stairs with our bags to get out. Thankfully we traveled light. Didn't have dinner or drinks at the hotel so cannot speak to that. I DID appreciate the security in the lobby and the room key check for entrants.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs, expect the nightlife/noise to end at 4:30am”
Reviews.Author: ydrone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located smack right dab in the middle of Bourbon street. If you are coming to the French quarter to drink and party until way past 3am, this is the place for you. Otherwise, do not stay here. Oh, do not bring any kids under 18 ... the street has many adult-themed posters, girls, etc. You are forewarned! With that disclaimer behind us ... friends and I stayed here Sept/Oct. It was a perfect location to check out the Quarter as well as to take the streetcar to the other side of town. Go to Cafe du Monde early - really early - to eat beignets. The river is close by. Street market and Hard Rock Cafe is there as well. Onto the night life ... it's noisy and crowded, but not many drunk people stumbling around. Catcalls from adult (strip joint) entertainers, starving artists, and balcony flashers wanting beads are normal. No cover to get into the bars. The 3-for-1 happy hour special is worth the deal ... it gets expensive after it ends, so drink up. What's the first rule in real estate? Location, location, location! It was awesome to just walk back into our room after getting hammered. The interior courtyard pool is a welcome respite during the day to sober up. The only problem, we had a room facing Bourbon St., so we could not sleep until it quieted down after 4:30am. We will remember to bring earplugs next time! Cab ride for 3 people to/from hotel is $14 per person each way (say $17 with tip, so $34 round-trip per person). We tipped the bellhop upon arrival, so he was nice to us the rest of the stay. In summary, I encourage singles 21-40 to experience the French Quarter using this hotel as the base. (Single girls, do drop a note to me if you're going, lol.) If you're offended by revelry, drunkenness, alcohol, or noise past your 11pm bedtime, please do us a favor and not book a room here : )

Reviews.Title: “Hotel building is good, staff is rude.”
Reviews.Author: chris f
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a courtyard balcony room. It was the middle priced room. The room is smaller than rooms in area but had a door that led to a shared balcony. The shared balcony was small and not private. On the last night I paid to upgrade to a bourbon street balcony. The noise from the street came right into the room. During the stay I was with my wife who has a different last name. The hotel security did not want to let her in as it was about 2 am and I registered two guests. They treated me and her like she was a night walker coming home with me. If you go to bourbon street to party stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AdeTae
Reviews.Content: We got a room w balcony on toulouse. The traffic on the street was light but still entertaining since we had our kids and didn't want to be out at night. My husband and I sat out there and drank and watched passersby. The pictures I saw of the room made it look cheap and drab, but it wasn't at all! Still had a slight boutique feel. Room was very clean and it was in the heart of it all. The breakfast choices was small but who cares it saved me at least $30 a day!! I would absolutely stay again, but next time I hope to get a room on bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: shellgilardi
Reviews.Content: stayed here and had a balcony room facing Bourbon Street. While it was great for "people watching," it was definitely not the place to be if you want a good nights sleep. Loud music and people made it hard to fall asleep. I would stay here again, as the staff is wonderful and the hotel beautiful, I would just request a room not facing Bourbon Street. The balcony rooms overlooking the pool are great and I would stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: g_goodway
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the second floor had a private balcony room. You can hear the atmosphere out side till the wee hours of the morning but it is not so loud as to disturb sleep. Talked to another couple who said they were on the forth floor and heard nothing. Hotel was clean and all the staff were friendly and willing to help with anything. They also had off street parking for motorcycles as well as cars.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_J_B
Reviews.Content: I've been to New Orleans 3 times in 19 years and stayed at the Inn on Bourbon each time and have never been disappointed. It's well worth the upgrade to get a Bourbon Balcony...the sound proofing is pretty good. We'd start our evening on our balcony with a glass of wine, watching the spectacle below. Fabulous. Rooms are spacious, nicely decorated, great comfortable bed and very clean. Highly recommended, particularly if you want to be in the centre of the action in people watching heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, Center of the action”
Reviews.Author: Donna S
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty room.. With gorgeous furniture and great services. The rooms were clean. There is wonderful cleaning staff. When we go back to NOLA we will stay here again!! The staff were friendly and helpful. We spend time with the concierge to plan our time around town.. She was wonderful and helped us plan our trip so we saw everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good - highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: bc0011
Reviews.Content: Pros Excellent location on Bourbon St. Great pool area. Unfriendly staff. Surprisingly quiet. Cons Stuffy/smelly rooms. Small and awkward bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: travelnowordie
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel we were there from October 3 to the 5th. We requested an inside room because we thought that a room facing Bourbon maybe to noisy. They had a breakfast every morning which was a great way to start the day. Staff was great always trying to make your stay great. Only one down side walls in the rooms seem paper thin you can hear everything in the next room. But I would stay again.***** 5 star hotel 3 star price

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Rockabeach
Reviews.Content: I just read a few reviews of the Inn on Bourbon and had to come and post about my experience. I have stayed in this hotel about 4 or 5 times and will go back for Halloween this year. The rooms are nice, clean and well furnished. The service is good and the staff has always been friendly and helpful whenever Iâ€™ve needed anything. The biggest appeal for this hotel is the location, right in the middle of Bourbon St. near everything! If you come to New Orleans to party (is there any other reason to go to New Orleans?), this is the spot for you. If youâ€™re not coming to party, then youâ€™re missing out! Yeah, the rooms facing Bourbon St. are loud, but really, what do you expect? Definitely not a place to bring children, as the scene outside gets a bit R rated after dark. But if you want to party like a rock star in New Orleans and be in the middle of the action while keeping a nice, clean place to recharge, the Inn on Bourbon is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION & HOTEL is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Carla L
Reviews.Content: We visted NOLA and stayed at the IOB for our first wedding anniversary. I upgraded to a balcony room on the Toulouse street side so my hubby's first time to NOLA would be in the middle of all the action. Never heard the music & noise of Bourbon inside the room. Balcony rooms are the only way to expierence Bourbon Street. Requested and received a refrigerator for our room. There is a coffee pot in the room but never got any coffee added after first day. The bed is super comfy but I think the pillows need to be replaced, after a few minutes the filler would be to either side of my head and empty where my head would lay . The staff were always friendly and helpful and went out of their way to all requests. We arrived early but they stored our bags & allowed me to retrieve them to change clothes. Our room was ready and allowed access 2 hours early. It's an old hotel but I liked that! We will stay here again when we return to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: Dep-UnoFromIndy
Reviews.Content: Labor Day was our second stay here in a year. We stayed the second time because even with some some flaws the first time, it was still a great hotel in the heart of Bouron. When you arrive at the airport, there is a taxi line with a flat $33.00 fee to Bourbon. Just pay it and get on with your vacation. Once at the Inn on Bourbon, you will feel the vibe of Bourbon street. The energy outside is obvious, but the friendly, professional staff when you walk in the doors lets you know that they understand "outside" and "inside" The first time we stayed last year, we had a room on Bourbon St. We would advise against this as the bar across the street blares LOUD music until early hours. While not horrible, it definitely was an issue with one of us. This time we requested an interior room and got one. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The view was two small windows looking out over a parking lot. Nothing special, but quieter at night. Disclaimer: This time we were there for a gay event. Turned out the room next door was full of 20 something guys here for the same event. They were awake by 9, started pumping house music right away, at least 6 of them met every morning and loudly discussed the previous nights activities. Walls are thin. BUT, if you are like us and that rolls off your back or you are here on a different weekend, you should have no problems. Staff, from desk to maid service is EXTREMELY friendly. Make sure you leave a little something for them. They work hard and make the rooms fabulous every day The only cons we could say is staying in a room that faces Bourbon, but again, that might be hit or miss depending on the events that week. Look at what week you are coming and if it is going to be wild, maybe ask for an inner room, if noise is fine book a street room. Regardless, the staff is friendly, helpfull, and willing to do anything to make your stay great. We have stayed here two times and will deinitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: KRJTP
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Inn On Bourbon for the second time and was once again impressed by my entire experience. The location is wonderful, the pool is nice, and the price was right. If you are looking to party get a bourbon street balcony, its worth ever dollar. However, the courtyard rooms are less expensive and are the better choice for those who donâ€™t want to hear the bourbon street party all night long. The staff and security are courteous and will let people have fun but keep things under control.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: FootsoreLeicesterUK
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location in the heart of the french quarter. The hotel is lovely and the service is great, the staff cannot do enough to make sure you have a great stay. We had a room with a balcony over Bourbon Street, the nightlife goes on till the early hours and is loud but it all added to the party feel of NO for us. Breakfast is very nice. Free coffee from 2pm to 11pm is a nice touch. Recommend the dinner cruise on Steamboat Natchez, sip a cocktail whilst listening to the Jazz Band, very romantic! Swamp tour is great and if you have a couple of hours to spare, do the Insectarium, I never knew insects could be so interesting! Cafe Amelie on Royal St is nice for dinner, sit outside in the courtyard and dine under the stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value middle of week”
Reviews.Author: Shackejr
Reviews.Content: Stay here before first stay had a quite room on back side of hotel. This time had room over looking Bourbon St. Felt like I was sleeping in Bar across street very noisy but thats Boubon St. Stay on back of hotel and it's quite. Another thing is $30 for parking a car. What ever happen to free customer parking. Like to party and not drive this is the place, walk out front door it's party time.

Reviews.Title: “Peace on Bourbon Street, Yes!!”
Reviews.Author: TruthSeeker_123
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the inn on bourbon street during the latest tropical storm lee, it also happened to be Southern Decadence during my visit. So needless to say, Bourbon street was insane. However, I found the hotel to be a peaceful retreat from the crazy ness. They offer a complimentary continental breakfast that was the ferfect way to start the day. It was extremely convenient to all the main attractions in the french quarter. Be prepared to walk. It's a walking city, but staying here will make your walks very convenient. The room was clean and staff very professional and friendly. Overall, I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Dawnluvsace
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. You couldn't ask for a better location if you're wanting the New Orleans experience. It's within walking distance of almost everything, including the Super Dome! Even with being on Bourbon the rooms are very quiet and the security of the guest is most important. The staff is amazing, the rooms are beautiful, and I will be back. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Best place for partying during Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: delhom
Reviews.Content: If you want to really experience the party of Mardi Gras a balcony room on Bourbon Street is the way to go. The rooms are pricey and for 2012 they have increased the minimum stay and prices, but the experience cannot be beaten - the party comes to you, just bring tons of beads to throw - the hotel staff is very friendly, but the property itself is a little rundown with few amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and we will be back over and over!!!”
Reviews.Author: David N
Reviews.Content: Great location on Bourbon St., clean and GREAT staff!!!! We have stated at a different hotel the last time in the French Quarter on Decatur and it was dirty, dark and just bad. Inn on Bourbon was the same price for the same time of year and length of stay. Stay here!!! You will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “...Location...Location....Location....”
Reviews.Author: outoftheboroughs
Reviews.Content: Is this place luxury? Nope. It is a nice hotel with small rooms and a decent decor. But, the location of this hotel is truly in the heart of Bourbon Street. If you are looking to be part of the true Bourbon Street experience, you should consider staying in this hotel. And if you are reading this review I do hope you go to New Orleans the city is truly a spectacular cultural and culinary experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Liz730053
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire.com and we weren't disappointed. The room was spacious, decorated in old furniture and was super clean. We have never sleep in a better bed....so comfortable! Free wi-fi. The continental breakfast was very basic...coffee, juice, cereal, pastries, apples & oranges but was enough to get our day started. You just have to step out the main doors & you are right in the middle of Burbon Street which is an excellent location. The hotel is very attractive & clean. Will recommend this hotel to family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome southern hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: We held our organization's annual reunion here in August 2011. What a great staff. They went above and beyond to make our reunion a success. The staff was stupendous whether it was making sure we had everything we needed in our meeting rooms, to providing concierge services. Many of our attendees commented on how impressed they were with the staff. The staff's professionalism and friendliness are true testaments to southern hospitality. Our guest rooms were nice and quaint. Thanks Inn on Bourbon and staff for all you did!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: SergiMarti
Reviews.Content: Great stay! In the center of french quartier with a good service and a good breakfast included!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Saekiz
Reviews.Content: This has got to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in!! The room was wonderfull! The Staff was amazing! The location was unbelivable! We arrived very early, but was still able to get a very nice top floor room. We loved everything about our stay.. Should I come back to New Orleans, I will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: LisannaK
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of French Quarter. Pool area is very clean and rooms are big enough. Staff is very helpful and frendly.

Reviews.Title: “It looks better in the photos!!”
Reviews.Author: HampshireSally
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights here in June - I have to say that the hotels looks better in the photos than in real life, having said that it was clean and comfortable and the staff were helpful. We had a room at the back which was quiet but our son was at the front of the hotel and it was very noisy at night. The restaurant was closed for refurbishment but the complimentary breakfast was horrid!! I have no idea if the breakfast from the restaurant would have been any better. We asked the concierge to recommend an historic tour of New Orleans - I have to say that the tour we did was terrible, I feel that if the hotel are going to recommend a tour then they should send their staff on it - we were not given any historical facts at all, just stories about Brad Pitt and other stars, very dull if you wanted history!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT TIME! Thanks IOB - Ramada !”
Reviews.Author: ccircleb
Reviews.Content: Wew travelled to New Orleans and wanted to experience everything New Orlenas/Bourbon Street had to offer. We chose the Inn on Bourbon for this purpose. We stayed 3 nights (Fri thru Mon). Upon valet checkin, we were greeted by the nicest people that the Ramada had to offer! Our first hotel room, on the Toulouse side, was very nice. It was clean with plenty of storage for 4 people. The Bell Boy also offered a refrigerator for the room. We were able to take our own cooler for our own drinks. On the first night, we decided to upgrade our room to the Bourbon Street side. This offered a huge balcony and a lot more to see. Travelling with 2 boys (ages 10 and 12), this was the best decision. The front desk helped us immediately upgrade and move our things to the suite we were offered. This was a 50.00 per night upgrade. They also gave the boys a huge bag of beads to throw! It was noisy but, the earplugs offered were sufficient to sleep. The noise dies down about 3 in the morning and then it is pretty quiet until about noon. There was a religious group that parked their cross and "preached" via a bull horn from about 11 p.m. until at least 1:00 a.m. This was the worst part of the stay. Not that I have a problem with people witnessing for their cause/religion but, these people were extreme and rude. The continential breakfast was breads, danishes, fruits and cereals. They offered coffee, milk and juice. It was sufficient to start our morning. The conciege (sp) was wonderful in giving us a layout of the sights and coupons for meals. If you are going to book any tours, I recommend going thru the hotel than going thru someone off the street. The pool was great and the area very relaxing. It did rain everyday, wear durable walking shoes... I had to ditch my fancy sandals.. the stores have umbrellas if you forget. There are also street entertainers that perform in front of the hotel. That was very entertaining! Also, at night, the hotel does require you to show your key before you enter the hotel. I did appreciate that gesture. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “On Bourbon, yet tucked away”
Reviews.Author: BadermanTowson_MD
Reviews.Content: Attended a fandom convention here- sadly the dining room was being renovated so LOUD noises reverberated in daylight hours and no hot food available on site. Are you picky about Bathrooms, electrical accessibility? Please read on. They say if you wish to reuse your towels to hang them.....Ha! there is not one towel rack in the small yet efficient bathroom. The sinks have no soap dish and that makes a mess. In the heat of New Orleans there was no clothes line in the shower to hang swimsuits, etc. The beds are comfy, although they seem to be full, not queen. I wish I had seen their exercise room, there wasn't much talk about it in the welcome packet. The Meeting room had wide, obtrusive pillars splitting the view. Electrical outlets are at a premium, only access at the lamp on the desk (which my room mate claimed) or the lamp on the nightstand between the beds. IF you pulled the TV cabinet out from the wall there was an adapter that gave 6 outlets. It was heavy to slide away from the wall. The pool area is secluded and pleasant, the hotel was evidently lovingly cared for by all the employees. THEY are all friendly and helpful, especially the Bell Staff. If you desire a pleasant stay book here, bring a portable clothes dryer rack and a power strip to charge your phone, camera and computer all at once. Will definitely consider returning because this location is in the center of it all. Very short walk to Decatur or Canal (either direction).

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl1962
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the IOB with my sister and her husband. We were meet by a very fiendly staff. I had asked, prior to arrival, to have ajoining rooms or at least room on the same floor. Not only did we get that, but we were given ajoining balcony rooms at no additional cost. The employees were very friendly and we were given great information on places to eat and sites to see. The hotel is perfectly located within easy walking distance to great resturants and site seeing. You have to experience the balcony games at least once in our life. Very fun!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...Right in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: tp5970
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February. The hotel was very nice. They had a place where you could park your car during your stay, because parking in the French Quarter is pretty bad. The hotel is literally right across the street or very close walking distance from world famous Pat Obriens, Tropical Isle, Razoo's, Rick's Caberet, and the list goes on and on. I really don't have much to write on as far as the hotel. But the fact that you can park you car here, have a nice place to stay, and can walk to every famous restaraunt, bar, club, cafe, or attraction is what makes this place really a treasure. It does have a fantastic old time feel to it as it was once a French Style Opera house, so it is rich with history.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kbertsch
Reviews.Content: We booked a balcony room that overlooked Toulousse street. While we could still hear the music and noise from Bourbon street, it was not unbearable, and we were able to sit outside and enjoy the party scene from a distance. Unfortunately, the restaurant was closed for renovation which was not mentioned on the website or when we booked our room. The continental breakfast was just loaded carbohydrates, no protein, and little fruit...very disappointing. At the recommendation of the bellman, we ate at Camille's a few blocks away after the first morning. However, our biggest complaint was with the humidity in the room. The a/c unit did not function well enough to remove the humidity, so our clothes and even the bed sheets always felt damp. The carpeting near the balcony doors was wet following an afternoon thunderstorm. (We are from Houston, so we understand humidity.) We have mixed feelings about our stay at the Inn. The location and general condition of the hotel was good, but there were some concerns that may make us try another hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel though very loud on Bourbon side”
Reviews.Author: girllrig
Reviews.Content: The first night I stayed here I was in a room on the back overlooking the pool. It was nice but too quiet for me, and since I was a solo traveller I thought maybe switching to a room with a balcony overlooking Bourbon would make me feel less lonely! So I paid a $50 upgrade fee and spent the next 2 nights in a room on the 2nd floor, Bourbon side. That was a mistake. There are several bars right underneath the window that blast into all hours of the morning. It was so loud I couldn't even hear the t.v. at full volume. I suppose that is what you should expect though as this is the most touristy area of NOLA. The balcony was nice. The room was great- all amenities (except a minibar or fridge, which to be honest I did miss). The staff was very polite and helpful. The pool area was nice. I did not try the bar and the restaurant was closed for renovation. The breakfast offered in the lobby was a little disappointing so I ended up going elsewhere for that. Still, overall, I had a good stay here and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A new favorite”
Reviews.Author: nola08
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to NOLA many times over the years (usually twice a year) and usually try to avoid Bourbon Street as much as possible (just not our scene). Our stay at the Inn on Bourbon was wonderful. The staff is exceptionally good and friendly. The rooms were cheerful, clean, and comfortable. And, even the noise from the street didn't keep us awake. But, what really made our experience above and beyond is the bellman. On our last day, he stored our bags for us and when we returned from one last adventure, the bags and a taxi were waiting for us. We will stay here in the future and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, but didn't get the Southern Hospitality expected from the very surley staff on the reception desk.”
Reviews.Author: chunkiesx2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Bourbon Street that is supposed to be famous for the Jazz scene, all i can say is if you are a jazz fan as we are, this is not the street to go to, although Maison Bourbon was about the only true jazz bar. The street is full of extremly loud hip hop bars, and very sleazy adult clubs, there is scantily clad young girls on the doors trying to Entice the men in even if they are walking with their wives!! If you want a great jazz experience in New Orleans go to Frenchman Street, about a 20 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room was fair; Location was good”
Reviews.Author: HAD1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with my husband and kids. The room (2 doubles on Touluse) was small and somewhat cramped. Bathroom was very small and had no exhaust so the whole room filled with steam when one person showered. Our balcony door did not open correctly and did not lock without alot of coaxing. The balcony overlooked Toulouse street, you could not really see any of the action but you could definately hear the noise...all night until about 4am. We definately overpaid for what we got ($203/night). I would not recommend Bourbon Street to anyone taking kids. I was shocked to see the naked pics in the windows of the stores, the strippers standing in the doorway of their clubs, and the pics of "Love Acts" on display.

Reviews.Title: “Will return next time in New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: Kennethtravelling
Reviews.Content: Had a nice room facing backyard/pool. No noise from Bourbon street. Location is perferct. Everything with this stay at this hotel was really good.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC AS USUAL - BEST HOTEL ON BOURBON”
Reviews.Author: Dale_Shannon
Reviews.Content: Our Family just got back after 4 Nights at this Beautiful Historic Hotel. We always stay here because of the great location and the special treatment that you receive from the staff. We have stayed at other hotels in the French Quarter, but we always come back to the Inn on Bourbon. We had two rooms with balconies overlooking Bourbon Street. The rooms were super clean and inviting. The beds were the most comfortable that we have ever slept on. Bourbon Street is very loud at night with all the music and people partying, so if you are a light sleeper you would want to get a room here overlooking their Beautiful patio and pool. Or you can always get a pair of earplugs from the front desk. The heavy curtains do knock down the street noise some. But when you come to New Orleans you want to be in the action. The managers here go out of their way to make your stay a pleasure. We had a small problem with the air conditioning and the manager had it repaired within an hour. The in house restaurant serves a super breakfast and lunch, we were told that they are soon to start serving dinner as well. I can't say enough good things about the staff in the restaurant. Mary & Nadine will see that you are treated like Royals. The food here is absolutely delicious and very reasonably priced compared to other restaurants in the area. They have a small but very nice bar. This location originally was the home of an Opera House and we were lucky enough to be there when they were having members of the local Opera preforming in the Lobby/bar area. Can't say enough about this great Hotel. Photos of Mary & Nadine are attached.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: cmjinidaho
Reviews.Content: Great location, but overpriced for amenities. Hotel was clean, staff was friendly, but pool area is cramped and rooms are just ok. Wouldn't bring my kids to this hotel, but a good place to sleep if all you want to do is spend your time on Bourbon St.

Reviews.Title: “Right place Wrong location”
Reviews.Author: Alyssia
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to create a quick review of the Inn Exterior was nice, did not look run down. Front desk personal were friendly and helpful staff. Check in was quick and easy. Interior was decorated very nicely, not gaudy. I like the lounge area with the piano. Rooms here spacious and clean; checked for bed bugs and did not see any evident of any. The bed was comfortable â€“ had a King size bed. Staff members were also friendly and helpful. Bellman always opened the door for us when we were coming or going. The wait staff as breakfast always made sure our glasses were filled if we wanted more. We ate off the buffet once, which was decent; ate off the menu the rest of the time because we thought buffet was too much for what we wanted vs. price. Only problem I saw here is that my husband would order biscuits and gravy every time and I would just order a simple breakfast sandwich. Since the biscuits and gravy was on the buffet, they would give him his plate right away and I still had to wait for my breakfast. Normally you would think both dishes would come out at the same time. Husband was always done before I really got into my breakfast. Pool area looked nice, just never had a chance to use it. Itâ€™s nice they have an ATM next to the elevators. The only major problem we had, and its no fault to the hotel, is that the music from the surround bars was extra loud and would play until 2- 3 oâ€™clock in the morning. When I originally booked this room, I was expecting good jazz type music; we could sit from our balcony and enjoy the music. Instead of was a combination of extra loud rock music from 3 different locations, so we ended getting a headache and could not really enjoy the balcony or the views. We realize it was on Bourbon and all part of the experience, but if I had to do it all over again, I would get an interior room hoping that would allow us to get some sleep while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A nickle & dime you place to stay”
Reviews.Author: darlynnski
Reviews.Content: Great location. Stayed here for 2 nights prior to going to my high school reunion in Sunset, La. Paid $130/night not including tax. They charge $30/night + tax to park. Cant use the luggage cart yourself to go up to your room, have to use the bell hop service. Don't offer any free breakfast in am not even free coffee. I got coffee and 2 small danishes, which weren't fresh, for $7.50. They have free coffee @ night, why not am to. They did have small coffee maker in room but they always to me are so weak. They charge $3 for 1/2 liter bottle water that they have in the rooms. We stayed on the 5th floor facing the courtyard, well actually we had great view of parking lot. First night was so quiet i was amazed. 2nd night we werent so lucky due to noisy people in the hallways till about 2 am. Rooms were small but clean. Water pressure in the shower was AWFUL. No pressure to speak of. We took off the shower head in hopes it would work better but it didn't. Bed was comfortable. They did have a safe in the room. Offered free internet and HBO. ATM machine in lobby which charges $3.75 fee. We ate at Remoulades couple blocks down on Bourbon St on same side of hotel, great food. The best pizza on Bourbon, to me. Next time we go, I wouldn't mind staying closer to Royal St. Prices of hotels have definitely gone up since we were there in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overlook this property as an option”
Reviews.Author: Triplewin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott the same week for a conference, have to rate this property a BETTER value! What this property lacks in amenities it makes up in the effort of it's staff and location directly in the French Quarter. We had a room facing Bourbon St. It was loud, but the staff recommended giving us earplugs and I slept just fine. I will tell you I would definately stay at this property again. The rooms are a little worn. I appreciate the security to keep the riff raff out at night. Highly recommend this property if you perfer value over luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great room.....and did I mention the location!”
Reviews.Author: C0MAX
Reviews.Content: I called over 50 (no exageration) hotels in the week prior to our Saturday night stay with no vacancy anywhere. We were visiting for my birthday to walk through the French Market during the day and have some drinks on Bourbon at night without having to drive the 45 min. drive home. (Mini-vacay) Finally, on Friday morning before the trip I called this wonderful hotel, although I had never heard of it before. I was greeted by a pleasant voice who was more than happy to accomodate. After reading reviews, I decided to give it a chance. I was more than pleased, the conveniece of the valet parking, and location of the hotel was perfect!!! We loved everything about our accommodations, the room was clean, the staff was friendly, the food was delicious. If I really wanted to be nit picky, the only bad thing that I could possibly say about the hotel would be that the elevators were slow, but come on America, we are considered overweight by other countries, so no better time to take the stairs. However.......my husband and I chose to wait patiently for the elevators. (Oh, and the noise was really not an issue as I had read in previous posts. Unless you are going to bed at 8:00 at night and your room is closest to Bourbon, but can I ask a question? What the heck are you doing going to bed at 8:00 on Bourbon street anyways?) Enjoy your stay, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you sleep during the day”
Reviews.Author: Napafoodie
Reviews.Content: Noisy, noisy, noisy!!!! No insulation around the doors/windows, so if you are on Bourbon Street, or even close, it is loud. Loud music until 4 am. Then loud drunks as the police chase people away. Even with earplugs we couldn't sleep. We checked out at 4 am the 2nd night to find some sleep. Small rooms, good location as far as central to everything, except for the noise. Then on top if it all, they double billed us for parking. At $33.60 at day with tax it adds up. Not recommended unless you are hearing impaired, or don't go to sleep until 6 am.

Reviews.Title: “Did not honor our reservation”
Reviews.Author: KMKNj
Reviews.Content: This place is all about location. It is a bit shabby and rundown. The balcony door was broken and so was the shower head. I booked a room with king size bed well in advance. At checkin, no such room available. They put us in a room with 2 doubles and promised they would switch us next morning. When I called front desk in morning, there was no recognition of my request and no room available. Never did let us change during 6 night stay. Still had to pay full high price. Now that I have been there, I realize there are many more attractive properties in French Quarter. Presumably, the others will honor a reservation. No need to stay here

Reviews.Title: “JAZZ FEST 2011-Girls Trip”
Reviews.Author: Harley04chick
Reviews.Content: If you need more details regarding this hotel, see my previous review.. I just wanted to say that we enjoyed our stay so much last time that we just had to take another friend there to enjoy the same things we enjoyed last time. As usual everybody was great. Concierge, check-in, Bellhop, Waiter in the Restaurant & Housekeeping. There were 3 of us girls this time, and we had alot of luggage as we had rented an apt to stay 5 days but stayed at the Ramada our first night, the poor Bellman had to deal with all of our luggage and was super friendly the whole time.. Once again, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lewesfoodie26
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! The location cannot be beat and fantastic, old school New Orleans charm! The staff was amazing and very attentive. Very cute courtyard with a pool, a nice lobby that features live music at night, and the rooms are very comfortable. The only warning with the rooms is unless you are heavy sleeper (or plan on going hard 24/7) ask for a courtyard or off bourbon room. The courtyard would be fantastic for a private function and it seemed like all of the meeting rooms were well appointed. We will absolute be going back to this hotel and I recommend it to anyone looking for an authentic New Orleans hotel in the middle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of it ALL”
Reviews.Author: NaplesRestaurants
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans so we wanted to stay on Bourbon Street and noticed this hotel was right in the middle of everything and boy was it. We didn't have to walk far to find something to do. The bars are steps away, the parks are right around the corner and the best restaurants are right around the corner. If you are planning on a peaceful evening then I would recommend going to another venue, but if you are in New Orleans for the Nightlife and atmosphere then The Inn on Bourbon is perfect for you. We recommend eating at Mothers for lunch, The Corner sports bar (gumbolya) for Lunch and also Acme Oyster for Dinner.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: JosieDayment
Reviews.Content: We had the absolute pleasure of staying at Inn on Bourban Street for five nights this past month. We've been to New Orleans numerous times, but will not stay anywhere else on our future trips to your wonderful city. The accommodations where perfect, but your staff are what makes your hotel stand out. The friendliness and genuine concern for our comfort and a pleasant stay was amazing. As for those who think staying on Bourban Street is too noisy, you can ask for a room facing the courtyard which we found to be very quite and such a pleasant oasis. Bravo to management and staff of this A one hotel. Josie & Dave, Aurora, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “we will be back! great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mizcass
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 17-20th. I emailed a few days before our trip to see what our options were since we didn't want to cart around our luggage all day, and we would be arriving 3 hours before check in. I received a response right away and was told just to come to the front desk maybe a room would be ready or we could leave our stuff with the bellhop. A room was ready for us when we arrived (not sure if this is normal, but greatly appreciated) Denise was at the front desk and just a pleasure to speak with. All the employees I came into contact with were helpful and pleasant. We booked through Expedia, and wanted a King bed, put in a room with 2 doubles. No big deal, since we got a room right away. Our room overlooked the pool and we were on the 4th floor. Room is very clean with comfy beds, bathroom a good size and lots of closet space to store your things. Hotel is literally in the heart of Bourbon St, we were able to wander around and go back to our to drop off souvenirs and keep going. In the evening, you were asked to show your room key for security reasons, it was a nice touch. Pool area was beautiful and quiet. Not too busy. Pool itself is not heated, but very refreshing as it was quite hot. It was very clean, and big towels were provided on each lounger. I ordered breakfast off the menu one day, it was good. The buffet was 16.95, and the menu items were about half that, with a lot of food. I found the service to be pretty quick. Really nice atmosphere. I really enjoyed this hotel and plan to be back to NOLA in the future. I will probably stay here, since I know what I'm getting. Bourbon St is one big party, loud noisy and crowded, this hotel is the opposite, very clean, quiet and a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ferris74
Reviews.Content: I had reserved my room for a quick, 24 hour birthday trip. I work in the airline industry so yes, while the free flying is a perk, we are still stand by passengers. I didn't make it to New Orleans because I was unable to get on any flight out of my hometown. Unfortunately, my dates were not flexible. I completely understood the cancellation policy, but I still called the Inn on Bourbon to not only cancel my reservation but to explain the uniqueness of my situation and to see if I could "possibly" get some type of a refund. Again, I understood that my window of time to cancel with refund had expired, but I have been in this situation before and have had luck getting a refund. I got a reservationist on the phone from the hotel who put me on hold to ask a manager, and within a minute or so I was told that "nothing could be done" and the cancellation policy stands. Even after describing the uniqueness of my situation, I was still told that I am basically out $158 for a room I never saw. I was even prepared to fax paperwork to reiterate my situation. Even though I wasn't expecting a full refund, a partial one would have been great. I was looking forward to this trip but because of circumstances beyond my control I did not make it. Being an airline employee I am completely aware of how great customer service builds business and great relationships with customers. I booked my room at the Inn on Bourbon based on the good reviews I read. I intend on visiting New Orleans at some point in the near future but unfortunately, I will not be staying at the Inn on Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for.”
Reviews.Author: mayflowermike
Reviews.Content: I have been to New Orleans several times but never stayed in the heart of things so I chose this hotel because it was in the middle of everything. I Had a great room with a balcony overlooking Bourbon St. It was wonderful for people watching. There is quite a lot of noise at night but who comes to NOLA to sleep? My firends had a room overlooking the pool and it was very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were spotless and well appointed. It was great to be able to walk out the front door and be right in the thick of it. I had some trouble in the restaurant getting anyone to wait on me but there is a big sign on the door stating that they are not part of the hotel. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Some good things, some not so good”
Reviews.Author: BobP53755
Reviews.Content: We just got back from here. The good things, the beds were the most comfortable as compared to any place we have stayed, The service was good, the location within walking distance to anywhere in the French Quarter. Some things not so good, the pool was closed because of private functions in the courtyard about half the time were were there. There was no HBO on the TV as was advertised. The internet service only works with Windows PC, not Android or ipads, we tapped into the service from a hotel across Toulouse St. The elevators broke down and only one was fixed the whole time we were there. If you are on the Bourbon St. side on on Toulouse St. side near Bourbon expect not to sleep from the noise until about 2:30 AM, especially on the weekend. Breakfast very expensive, much better outside such as the Oceanic Grill.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 stars, at the most”
Reviews.Author: GeeLiz
Reviews.Content: This was an extremely average to low budget hotel. Although the staff could not have been nicer, the facilities were mediocre, at best. The first room I was in was so moldy, that I changed to another room. The ammenities were minimal; there wasn't even a glass in the bathroom, no ice bucket, hardly any outlets, poor quality towels and bedding. If you need to get any sleep at all, be sure to request a room in the back of the hotel--if not, you'll be up from the noise of Bourbon Street till at least 4 AM. The location was great, however, if you're looking to be on Bourbon Street. But if you have to pay more than $100 a night, you're probably overpaying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Napali65
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay: October 28 - November 2, 2010. We have been staying at the Inn on Bourbon for over 10 years for Halloween. We wouldn't stay anywhere else. The rooms are spacious, the housekeeping staff is very friendly and the front desk staff is professional and courteous (especially Jonathan). We will be there again in 2011 for Halloween; can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Another Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: NegrilSalute
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time we've stayed at the Inn on Bourbon. Each time a different room and this time had us on the 4th floor at the corner of Bourbon and the other side street that I can't remember the name of right now. I was a little concerned about noise and had we been very light sleepers we may have had a problem. The sound of the bands and other activities was fairly loud however it did not seem to bother our sleep. I would suggest however that if you are concerned about noise at night to ask for an interior room. My favorite so far has been a balcony room overlooking the pool. The accomadations were very nice and everything was very clean. All of the hotel personnel were very friendly and helpful, something I think they've improved over the years. Did not eat at this hotel and never have so I cannot comment on the food. Of course the main advantage to this hotel is it's location. Easy to pop in and out of while enjoying Boubon street activities and easy to get to the rest of French Quarter attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Glad to Have Stayed at The Inn on Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: ElNYC
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at The Inn for a couple of nights from 2/7-2/9. The location is superb because Bourbon Street is right outside your door so you don't have to go far for partying. Everything else was in walking distance to The Inn. My room didn't have a balcony but I was okay with that because I got a great deal, and it overlooked the pool, so it was quiet. The beds were comfortable. I liked the convenience of the in-room safe. Love that I had free internet and had no problem using my computer. I went to eat at Cafe Du Monde for breakfast so I didn't have a chance to try their breakfast buffet. I left early in the morning around 7am and came back around 3PM but the room had not been made up. It didn't matter to me because I took a nap and had plenty of towels but I was surprised, I thought it would be done by then. I liked that in the evening there was someone near the door to check and see if you have a card key to make sure that you were a guest, it made me feel that someone was thinking about security.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location......Cheap Room Amenities”
Reviews.Author: doomus
Reviews.Content: The Inn on Bourbon was a great location and a fairly comfortable hotel. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean; however, for more than $200 per night on average I think they could spring for better toilet paper, real coffee mugs for the coffee makers and could put more than 2 towels in the room. Room Service was great and the front desk staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Nice Location, but Ill-mannered and tactless Front Desk Agent”
Reviews.Author: marknbham23
Reviews.Content: Check In/ 02-14-11 Check out/ 02-19-11 First off, lets get the good out of the way. Room was nice. Was upgraded to a very nice roomy suite upon check-in. Nice furnishings in the suite and was comfortable. Location is top notch at this hotel for Business or Leisure. Housekeeping was exceptionally friendly and well trained (I would have given this property a 4 out 5 star if it would not have been my check out process.) Now to the bad: Parking $28/night plus tax. There is a parking lot 3 blocks away for $10 bucks a night! Use it! ( While the parking charge is about what all hotels charge for parking in New Orleans, it is way over priced just like theirs!) Breakfast- Buffet was a joke. OVER PRICED and food was cold and honestly, I could have walked to Mcdonald's (which I did most days after that) and paid 14 bucks less for better food and treatment. Here is my one HUGE issue with this hotel Upon check out, I called the front desk from the site I was working at and spoke to a young lady, it was 12:18pm, I asked her if I could have an extra hour to get back and gather my things for check out. She said "sure, no problem.." I said " Thank You" Due to high volume of traffic I arrived back at the hotel and gathered my things and came down to check out 26 minutes past the time she said would be ok. The maid on the floor was telling me to take my time, that she was ok for me being a little behind. The front desk agent that was there when I came to check out, his name was Jonathan. I informed him of the error in my room charges and then he didn't even acknowledge that, he was rampant and mostly concerned at what time I was checking out. When he mentioned a penalty, i informed him the young lady said I could have extra time and I apologized for being a few minutes past that time.. but he slammed through the door behind the desk to try and verify if what I was saying was truthful. His attitude and demeanor was so unprofessional that I immediately became offended and asked him to retain a manager when he returns from the back. He roles his eyes and picks up the phone and calls someone to send a manager and stats the following : "can you send a manager out for this person at the front desk" This "person" just spent over 800 dollars for the company that employs you and pays your bills and you are going to be RUDE and disrespectful? A manager arrives but doesn't introduce himself. I explain to him what was happening and what had happened and was rudely interrupted by Jonathan stating "that is not true" He was now calling me a liar for telling the FACTS of what happened. I am a very easy going guy who is in hotels 10 months a year for work and I don't get mad easily, but when someone is blatantly rude, I become enraged. The manager that was on duty, around 1:45pm on Sat, Feb 19th never once apologize for the actions of his employee and told me he would take care of the late check out fee. I told him I had no problem paying for the additional 30 minutes, but no one ever disclosed how much it was... It was never about the FEE or the money, it was about the RUDE Behavior of a front desk agent that had no regard for someone who just spent a great deal of money with the company that employs him I will NEVER return here while in New Orleans, and I am in New Orleans A LOT along with 25 other representatives from our company and have already sent out an email alert and warning them not to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ambiance & Character”
Reviews.Author: jrcc1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while traveling with friends. The hotel lobby is really beautiful. The staff is top notch. The service is five star! The wireless signal was so low and slow that you couldn't use it. However, there was a computer with a printer in the lobby to print boarding passes. So, it wan't a problem. The beds were comfy. Our room faced Bourbon Street so we heard outside music 'til the bars closed. Actually, this is part of being in New Orleans -so enjoy it. Our room also had a patio/balcony. It was neat to go outside and watch the folks celebrating at night. The room could use a little upkeep though. The a/c vent was rusty, the bathroom drawers a little dirty, and some peeling paint in the corners. If you are looking for a quiet room at a chain hotel where everything is the same, then don't stay here. If you want a hotel where you can feel the charm and character of New Orleans, a hotel that has top notch staff, and a hotel that is very comfortable, then stay here. You fwill be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “it was amazing”
Reviews.Author: aly_schneider
Reviews.Content: My name is Alyssa and i am from baton rouge, lousiana so i go to new orleans alot, I recently went to the inn on January 15 for my 21st birthday, my dad reserved the room for me as a christmas present and he was under the impression that he had paid for it since he put his credit card info on it, well when me and my fiancee go to check in they said we had toi have his credit card and id, and i tried explaining the situation but they said rules are rules, so i had to call my dad so he could fax the information, but everytime that they tried to fax him it wouldnt go through, i sat in that waiting room for close to 3 hours, but everyone at the front desk were extremly nice and said "As soon as we get it you will be off to your room" i told the guy at the front desk that i shouldve known that something was going to go wrong, and he said"Well hunny, if there is one thing I've learned, it's that all plans are doomed to fail", finally the fax went through and they gave us the hotel room key (room 210) Once we got in the room i was so amazed, it was alot smaller than i thought but the beds were super comfortable, and the bathroom was super nice and i loved that we had our own personal balcony :) believe it or not we would go get drinks and come back to the hotel and just kinda lounge around untill we felt like going dancing or something,! i slept perfectly, the noise didn't bother me the slightest, in fact i kinda liked it, im sure i will be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great...restaurant was awful!”
Reviews.Author: Pacofun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Bourbon Street and was convenient since we had a party of 9 women. The noise didn't bother us too much. Nice hotel and great location. Our bad experience was for breakfast in the hotel restaurant. You could've gotten better food, service and lower prices at McDonald's. We ate the buffet which costs almost $19 and they ran out of food and it took forever to refill the buffet. It took at least 20 minutes just to get water and coffee when we sat down. The biscuits where out of a box. Do NOT rcommend this restaurant. Try Oceana Grill around the corner on Conti street.
