New Orleans is a great city and this restaurant will give tourist the wrong impression. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Food needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: harley2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location and the price is reasonable; however, we had breakfest the next morning and it was the HORRIBLE. The service was not good and we could have had better food at McDonalds and paid a lot less. We tried everything on the buffet with hopes that we would fine something decent, but failed. A couple of us even ordered pancakes and waffles and they were also horrible. Management definitely needs to make some changes on the food/service especially for the price you pay. Also, we had no garbage can in our bathroom. We had to move the one small one that was in our room to the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Errant charge when we returned home”
Reviews.Author: gogtinswc
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the center of Bourbon Street. Unfortunately we received an errant charge on our card when we returned home. I emailed both the hotel and corporate to have the matter resolved, only hearing back from corporate that they would forward to the hotel manager and fix the problem. Although the mistake was ultimately corrected, I despise when hotels do this. The hotel rooms are a little worn. We didn't receive any hand towels when we arrived the first day and just assumed that they didn't have any. The next day the maid service never left any new towels, until we tracked a maid down in the hall and waited an hour or so for them to arrive. The wifi was terribly slow. So slow I could have tethered my 3g phone to the computer and gotten a faster download rate. Our room was on the fifth floor and fronted on the cross street, so there wasn't too much noise in the room at night. There was a lot of people who were having parties in their room though, so we heard the neighbors from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price and location”
Reviews.Author: tkarmy31
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I and my mom spent a week over christmas at the inn on Bourbon. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. My girlfriend and I upgraded our room to a balcony facing the courtyard when we arrived. It was quiet and the room was decorated beautifully and our bed was VERY comfortable. You can't beat the location if you want to be in the heart of the quarter. My only complaints were: 1)we booked thru expedia and requested a queen/king sized bed but none was available which was fine we just snuggled up in the double. 2) Our room was quite musty smelling. We requested a new one but the new one was quite musty as well and the view was quite sub-par compared to the first room so we switched back. I asked a couple other patrons about their room and they said similar things but added "this is New Orleans everything is musty" which put things into perspective. My mom's room wasn't as bad but she did have allergies to the room.... so just something to think about. Overall I found the hotel staff and the hotel to be very good and would recommend it with the caveat about the mustiness.

Reviews.Title: “One Fun Night!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimdeb59
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night after leaving Biloxi. While small the room (311 & 511) was comfy. Room 311 had a balcony, which was great. while 511 did not. My brother-in-law was disappointed. Can't blame him, his room was the same price as ours. The hotel is a perfect location on Bourbon Street. We did hear some noise while trying to sleep but no big deal. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was nice. Bourbon street was hopping even for a Tuesday night. Big plus for the hotel is on site parking. Be advised: hotel parking was $29. But worth it. We didn't use the restaurants so I can't comment on them. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Sorely disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Tampasmurf
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Inn over Christmas for 4 nights. We had traveled to NO with another couple that also stayed at the Inn. When we got to our room we found 2 bath towels, not 4, which is the norm (I have long hair and always use 2, but that had never been an issue). There was no bathmat, so we had to use a hand towel as a substitute. There was no trash can in the bathroom, we had to take the one from the main room and put it in the bathroom. When we went to have drinks in the room with our friends, we discovered there were no glasses in the room, only paper cups. When I requested some at the bar, the person at the bar would not give us any, and said she could only give us plastic cups, which would have been fine had we been drinking ripple. Who wants to drink champagne from a plastic cup?! In fact, she acted as if it were a major imposition just to get up from the barstool. Christmas Day there was no maid service at all (which would have been fine, had we been told upfront), so we had to go to the desk to request toilet paper. The next day, our room was cleaned and the maid LEFT NO TOWELS at all. I called down for some and when my husband opened the door to get them, the man who brought them was rude, threw them at my him and they landed on the floor. Half the time, one of the two elevators was not working, the rest of the time they were miserably slow. We were on the 5th floor, which was supposed to be non-smoking-- but clearly all of the days we were there, someone was smoking in their room, which should have been apparent to any employee in the hall since you could smell it. We were also told that the 5th floor was nearly vacant, but we seemed to all be crowded together at the same end of the 5th floor. Unfortunately we happened to have an obnoxiously loud woman next door, which is not the Inn's fault, but for the fact that we should have been separated by at least a room or two give the occupancy, or lack thereof. The carpet appeared dirty, as though it had not been shampooed in some time. The fitness center was very marginal, we didn't use it, but our friends said it was not useable. Our friends changed rooms twice because they were unhappy with the cleanliness, or lack of it, of the rooms. Basically, the Inn lacked those simple amenities that should set it apart from a Motel 6. We were very disappointed in the quality of the Inn and wish we had stuck with the Royal Sonesta.

Reviews.Title: “WILL KEEP GOING BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dajumez
Reviews.Content: I visited New Orleans in early December '10. Prior to visiting, I looked online for a good hotel that would give me a good experience, as well as not break the bank. After a recommendation from a friend, I settled on the Ramada Plaza-Inn On Bourbon. As soon as I arrived at the hotel, I felt as if everyone had known me from a prior visit. Most notably, Larry, one of the bellman. He took care of me, my questions, my concerns and was very helpful. The front desk staff was also ALWAYS very helpful. The ONLY thing about the hotel that slightly bothered me was the view from my room. It was of the parking lot, and it seemed very easy for someone to peek into the room if they wanted to. I kept the curtains closed most of the time because of this. This was also one of the rooms that faced away from Bourbon, and it was definitely quiet and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are planning a visit. It's priced right and you WILL be comfortable. I will most certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Txjayhawk1
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel. Outside rooms (facing Bourbon) can be a little noisy until the early morning hours but hey..........you're in New Orleans. Very comfortable bed and good sized bathroom. If you want to be in the middle of the action this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Tearitup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn on Bourbon in November over the Thanksgiving weekend. It had been many years since my last visit and I had no idea what to expect. I was delighted to see that the place was as lovely and charming as I remembered. Actually better than I recalled as it appears that some updating has taken place. Bourbon Street is a hopping location and can be very noisy. That hadnâ€™t changed since my last visit. We had a very quiet inside room facing the courtyard and had no trouble sleeping. The beds were very comfortable and had some of the best hotel pillows Iâ€™ve slept on. The room was nice but could be made better with the addition of a small refrigerator. While there are lots of places to get a drink in the area I like to keep bottled water at hand and had no place to do so. The bathroom was nicely appointed and clean. Housekeeping promptly made up our room while were out every day and was very responsive to any requests. The best thing about the Inn on Bourbon is the location. We took a taxi in from the airport and had no need of a car for out entire visit. Everything we wanted to do, see, eat, drink or listen to was within short walking distance. What a treat that was. We ate breakfast at the hotel twice. Both times the food and the service were top notch. If youâ€™re looking to be close to the action and everything that makes the French Quarter unique you couldnâ€™t wish for a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Wildrose919
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in New Orleans so I was skeptical about the hotel after reading some of the reviews however our stay was positive. The location is wonderful, right in the middle of Bourbon Street. We did have a room facing Bourbon Street and a private balcony, on the 3rd floor. It was very neat to have, however it is very loud. On Saturday night the music didnâ€™t stop till 4am and then the street cleaners came through. If you arenâ€™t planning on staying up that late, I would highly suggest a room facing the courtyard. I tried using ear plugs and noise cancelling headsets which blocked out a little of the noise. If we would return again, Iâ€™m going with a courtyard view. The room itself was clean, it is small but very functional. An earlier post mention the lack of a hairdryer, check the bathroom counter drawer that is where it was located for me. The hotelâ€™s courtyard is very nice if you are looking to relax. I would stay here again and recommend it to others. As stated many times, Bourbon Street isnâ€™t a family friendly place so please use common sense in the evening when the crowds are large. Bourbon Street does have an odd smell to it, but every morning I saw several places washing down their sidewalks. We found wonderful restaurants in the French Quarter and shopping as well. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was close to everythig,clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: BrwTea
Reviews.Content: Great service price was right. When I go again, why look further. Staff was friendly, rooms clean and beds comfortable. Enjoy my stay, will do again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and almost perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Shelly18545
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to New Orleans bourbon street area and even though I will not be returning to this AWESOME city I highly recommend this hotel. We stayed from 10/28-11/2 Halloween weekend. The location of this hotel is perfect, we where located smack dab in the middle of the action. Checking in was fast and easy. Our room was small but decorated nicely. The availability that time of year had affordable rooms with two double beds for me and my two girlfriends, ( there was a bourbon street options but the past reviews noted they where loud and close to imposable to get sleep). We didn't have much of a view but once you shut the doors to the lobby and go up the elevator the noise was non existent. The hotel is very clean and pleasant. There is a quaint courtyard area with a pool and lounge chairs. If you pass through the lobby on the later shifts ask for G rose he is very knowledgeable of the cities history and tourist info. The water pressure in the shower is good but the drain in the shower didn't keep up. Bathrooms where small but cute. Check out was simple and fast. Our flight wasn't till later in the evening so the hotel held our bags for three hours wile we took one last look at the city. The outside of the hotel always smelt like horse poop and throw up but so did most of the bourbon street area. Vegas has nothing on New Orleans! This city is full of fun and fun people. This was a sweet find on line and not a single disappointment when I arrived. Totally affordable and clean. If I ever recover from my weekend and decide to return, my first choice will be the Inn on Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Bitsy822
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a long weekend trip. The location is wonderful if you want to be in the middle of the action on Bourbon Street. We had an interior courtyard view room with a small balcony, which was very quiet. No noise could be heard from the street. The room was ready when we arrived, even though we were early. It was a nice size, considering some of the rooms in the French Quarter can be small. The bathroom was very small however and hard to maneuver in. The room was clean, although in need of a little repair. Nothing major, but things like the bathroom doorknob falling off and the door getting stuck shut at one point. Housekeeping was very good, although had to ask for extra towels and not many were provided. Although we didn't swim, the pool looked very nice and inviting. I would not hesitate to stay there again on a future trip. Very enjoyable experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “In the quarter -no frills”
Reviews.Author: sillingworth
Reviews.Content: Check in at 23.00 was quick & straightforward. $50 deposit per night seemed a little high when no room service available. Staff were friendly, efficient, but seemed lacking in local knowledge. A good location, close to all the action, but absolutely no frills for a three star hotel. Would stay again, but only because of where it is.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully maintained property in the heart of the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MKUltra3340
Reviews.Content: New Orleans is a party city, and this lovely hotel is smack-dab in the middle of all the action. To choose to stay on Bourbon Street (or anywhere in the French Quarter for that matter) and then complain about people partying and being noisy is ridiculous. Of course there will be some fun and frivolity until very late at night (or, more like early in the morning!) that's part of the experience of being in this beautiful city! You must be aware that there will be noise if you choose a balcony room overlooking Bourbon St, it's party central! If you have an issue with that, ask for a room near the pool- we ended up going for drinks with another couple who said they didn't hear any noise from their poolside room. Or, pack some earplugs. In our Bourbon balcony room, the bedding was plush and the mattress was comfy and felt new. I did the "white sock test" and the carpet was clean. The water pressure and temperature were perfect and every employee we interacted with was professional, but also warm and fun-loving. The hotel felt safe and secure at all times. The pool area was very inviting, and there was ample furniture to relax and socialize with other guests. I consider myself to be fairly critical, and I was very happy here. I will stay here again- hopefully soon. Some of the reviews of this hotel seem to focus on the noise/partying/drinking in the neighborhood-- that's what the area is famous for! Let your hair down, smile, be social and lighten up- you will have a ball. Let the good times roll!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mmgoode
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in the Ramada Plaza Hotel this past weekend. It is in a great location - within walking distance to everything you would want to do. The check in was easy and they had a room available earlier than check in so they let us check in early. Asked us if we needed directions, reservations to any restaurants etc when we checked in. That was a very nice thing to ask because some times the hotels can get reservations when there are none available. Our room was on the backside of the hotel with a city view - that was just ok - but we were glad when we realized how quiet it was so we could get some sleep. If you are not worried about sleep ask for a room on the bourbon street side. The room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Place to be for Bourbon Street!”
Reviews.Author: kb0209
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn on Bourbon during the dates of Oct. 25th through Oct. 29th...we stayed there because my husband had four days of leave before leaving for Afghanistan and could only go two hours away from base and lucky for us that's exactly how far away NOLA was from there! We had an amazing time with all of our friends as well and when we got tired and needed to go we didn't have far to walk at all. The only down side is of course the noise...unfortunately we got a room right on Bourbon street, but that is to be expected. The building is old so I'm sure there is no much they can do about noise control. We had a blast though and wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. I was a little disappointed in the fact that they did not have late checkout for the Friday due to the Voodoo festival...it was tough on me because I wanted to spend as much time with my husband as I could and I got to, but we had to drag around our luggage everywhere :( all in all it was a wonderful place especially if you are there for the Bourbon Street experience! The staff was also very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but too noisy for me”
Reviews.Author: RalphLee
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, well maintained hotel. I stayed in a standard room with a balcony overlooking Toulouse St. I requested this room as there were no smoking rooms available. The room was cosy and very comfortable, and the balcony was beautiful to sit out on. However, I am a light sleeper and the noise from Bourbon was very apparent. Had I chosen a courtyard room this would not have been as much of an issue. This would definitely not deter me from recomminding this charming hotel with wonderful staff to other travellers, just bear in mind that noise could be an issue and you will have a thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Harley625
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the heart of the French Quarter. Location couldn't be better! Rooms spacious and clean, just make sure and ask for a room overlooking the pool. Very quiet at night. Party on the street goes on all night long, so a room on the Bourbon Street side will keep you awake! People at front desk very helpful in giving directions, suggestions as to what is going on in the area (we saw a Jazz Fest in the park as per their suggestion), and restaurants for both breakfast and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JP1975
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in New Orleans staying at the Inn on Bourbon. I last stayed here 6 years ago, and I was happy to see the service and quality of the hotel remained, if not improved over the years. It seemed as though they have remodeled some of the rooms, as ours looked brand new. Extremely nice, definitely a great value for the price. Service was top notch, have to give a special thanks to Anne the concierge, who was a great help with recommending restaurants and setting up tours for us. You just can't beat the location of this place, right in the middle of Bourbon Street in the Quarter. The hotel does do a great job of keeping the craziness out of the hotel though. I'm sure the rooms with street view balconies are a bit loud (we didn't have one) but it's New Orleans..not a quiet city!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Stellar at the Inn on Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: Sarah5357
Reviews.Content: We travelled to N.O. for a get-away following my knee surgery. We booked through a discount web site, and we requested a King bed if possible. When we got into our room, we found we'd gotten 2 double beds (which looked really small to me) with a balcony. We went downstairs and were told there were currently no Kings but sometimes people wanted to switch so they'd keep us posted. Sure enough, within 15 minutes or so, Dayanna at the front desk called (I hope I've spelled her name right) to say a King was available on the Courtyard. When we got to the room, we found it was actually on Bourbon, and even at 5 pm, it was loud. We were a little disappointed but decided to suck it up. Within about 15 minutes the front desk called again and asked if the room was OK. My husband said well, it wasn't on the courtyard, but for us the King was more important than a balcony or the courtyard. Nevertheless, Joseph called back within 5 minutes to say there was a King on the courtyard if we wanted it. Once we transferred there, we found a quiet, comfortable room overlooking the pool. Neither of these employees had to go to all this trouble, we didn't ask them to, and we didn't complain once we were given a room; we knew that booking through a discount site meant you didn't always get what you requested. Nonetheless, they went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable in a room we liked. I cannot say enough good things about the staff at this hotel. They are all friendly, courteous, professional, and determined that you enjoy your stay in New Orleans at their hotel. Gold stars to Joseph and Dayanna and to Sean, Ken, Brandon, and all the other employees there. Thanks for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: MarieCristina
Reviews.Content: This hotel has pluses and minuses. The location is ideal for someone who wants to have fun. If you travel with a group of people whom you need to babysit then this is the perfect choice. If you are looking for high standards you have to look elsewhere. Architecture is nice. The swimming pool does the trick. Sipping a cup coffee besides the pool can give you a bright start. However, rooms are outdated. Furniture is in a great need of replacement. No room service available. No mini bar. I wonder why they asked for my credit card. The rooms facing the Bourbon Street are extremely noisy but you can opt for those facing the pool. Staff is extremely friendly from the front desk to the concierge. I arranged a private breakfast for my group and the waiter (Mary) did an outstanding job. She really took care of us every morning. If it is for myself, I would not go back. If it is for business then yes, that's the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blueskies9999
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at the Inn on Bourbon. It was a great experience. The last time I stayed at this hotel was over 10 years ago and it was kind of run down. But now, it is simply beautiful. We had a balcony room overlooking the courtyard. Very quiet, no noise from Bourbon Street! The beds were extremely comfortable with pillow top mattresses and four fluffy pillows on each bed. A nice 32 inch LCD TV in the room, beautiful furnishings and updated bathroom. I agree with a previous poster regarding the bathroom door. It is really a french door with two doors coming together that really doesn't offer you enough privacy and it was hard to open and close. The bathroom is small and if you are a larger person (over 300 lbs), you would find it somewhat uncomfortable. There was also no refrigerator in the room, so I would recommend purchasing a styrofoam cooler from one of the grocery stores within walking distance of the hotel. A couple of things to be aware of: the bottled water in the room is not complimentary, it is $3.00 each. And they do ask that you reuse your towels. There was one small issue with the toilet paper not being replaced. Other than that, the stay was great and the bellhop was extremely helpful with booking tours and taxis and anything else you needed. I will be coming back to NOLA and staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back, but...”
Reviews.Author: sighwest
Reviews.Content: Great hotel overall. Just a few complaints. First, because of the terrible time we usually have checking in before actual check-in time (everywhere but Royal Sonesta), we decided to put off leaving on our 5 hour drive to the Quarter until we could arrive well after the 4 pm check-in. At 5:30 pm, I attempted to check in to the hotel, but the front desk woman said it would be 15 more minutes. She said the room was clean, but still needed to be inspected by a manager. She took my number and told me she would call as soon as it was ready. Because of our dinner reservations, we sat down in the table area, and waited on my cell phone to ring. After 40 minutes, I returned to the same woman, and asked about the room. She looked at me like she had never seen me before, asking my name again, etc. The room was ready, but she neglected to call. That just wasn't the right first impression returning to the IOB. We missed our dinner, and the night just didn't turn out as it should have. As for the room, I was impressed. The hotel seems to be in much better shape than it was back in 2007. Beds extremely comfortable, and cold ac. The hotel room had a Flushmate toilet installed, which was SO MUCH better in the bathroom! Toilets in the Quarter are usually very slow, and not dependable when it comes to carrying away the waste water. Not so here!! Wow! We didn't like the half doors leading to the bathroom, though. They leave a nice 1/4 inch gap in the middle that would allow anyone to view you as you use the restroom. One of the doors wouldn't stay shut (room 331) which made it worse. Pool area/courtyard was pretty, but not as big as I expected. Saw a little mouse scurrying about one evening. Pool was clean. 12 PM check-out was a breeze. We got to use the express checkout system so we didn't have to stop by the front desk on the way out. We'll be back as long as we can continue to get a fair price for a room, and the location is one of the best if you want to be in the middle of the action. Just hoping they work on their check-in methods. Many people were waiting with us and the same time the following day as well. That's a terrible way to start a mini-vacation.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the Ritz, if not better.”
Reviews.Author: MimiLouviereDill
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated and very clean. Bed and pillows make you feel like you have died and gone to heaven. Exceptional front desk clerks, bell hop and valet service. You cannot get service any better than this. I had a balcony view of the pool and terrace. Just simply beautiful. I would, and will stay here for anymore visits I make to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: BasilMcRae17
Reviews.Content: If you're going to New Orleans to enjoy Bourbon Street, this is the hotel for you. You can't get any closer to the action than this. Probably wouldn't recommend it for the 'road warrior' business traveler, but for a guys/girls weekend in the Big Easy, you couldn't ask for a better spot.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: jslafon1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 9/22-25 in a Bourbon St balcony room. This was our second stay in the same room category, although it had unfortunately been 2 years since our last visit. I'm happy to say that nothing had changed. Check-in was quick & painless- the staff from front desk to bell service was friendly, helpful & accommodating. We received a hand-written "welcome back" card from management, which we found to be a nice touch (especially because it was hand written rather than a standard issue form letter). Room was spotless & the bed was very comfortable. A/C worked perfectly, which was very important- temps were in the mid-90's every day. Balcony was shared with 2 other rooms, but was HUGE, so nobody stepping on anyone else's toes. We became friends with our "neighbors" & actually spent our last evening out together. Balconies have a large round table with 3 chairs (max occupancy is 3 in king bedrooms) in front of the French Doors and offer a great view of the activity on Bourbon. Yes, believe what your hear about the noise- Bourbon Street is loud, especially with the music that booms out of the storefront directly across the street. This lasts from morning until evening, when music from the nightclub across the street (Funky 54) takes over. It doesn't bother us at all, but if you are a light sleeper or plan to turn in early to get your beauty rest, it may not be for you. At no point during our stay did we order room service or visit the restaurant/bar, but had taken some snacks, adult beverages & a cooler that we purchased ahead of time. When we opened said snacks, we realized that we needed a knife. When my wife phoned the front desk to inquire, several sets of silverware from the restaurant arrived at our door within 10 minutes. We were very impressed with this. When we were ready to check out, I phoned the front desk to ask for bell service. Repeated calls over a 5 minute period went unanswered & I was resigned to the idea of humping all of our luggage downstairs ourselves. But before this occured, the front desk PHONED ME, asking if I'd been trying to contact them! Again, within 5 minutes a bellman was at our door to take our luggage. I was very impressed with the call back from the desk. I've stayed in countless hotels over the years & paid as much as $600 per night, but never have I received a return call when my calls to the front desk have gone unanswered. Again, very impressed. So the bottom line is this: don't be turned off if you read negative reviews about this property. It's comfortable, clean, well-staffed & right in the heart of the Frech Quarter action. We will continue to stay here as long as we visit & the ownership/management remains the same.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Will Return”
Reviews.Author: RandBTravel
Reviews.Content: We go to New Orleans regularlly. We have stayed at the Inn on Bourbon and will return again in March for St. Patricks Day. You certainly have to keep in mind what any hotel on Bourbon Street is all about, the party! Yes it can be loud, especially balcony rooms. However, the property is great and the one night manager, Amber, that we got to know was fabulous. She remembered us a year later when we called and made St. Pat's reservations. The location is perfect for restaurants, nightclubs, and tons of history in the French Quarter. It is more expensive then the hotels that are not in the quarter, but it's location is what we want. The rooms are nice and we have found them to always be clean.

Reviews.Title: “This place made our vacation GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: 85Harley
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that anyone writing a review on tripadvisor should have enough sense to research an area before they travel to that destination. That being said, Yes, you can hear noise, but the hotel is perfect in almost every other way. What do you expect for a hotel that must be close to 100 hundred years old. The staff was so friendly, it really felt like you were staying with friends. Shawn, one of the bellhops couldn't have been any nicer. I forget the very nice lady's name at the concierge desk, but she was also a pleasure to deal with. Her quote "When BP speaks, BP lies". The lady tending bar was also a lot of fun. Nice dry humor, just the way I like it. And she makes a very nice martini as well. But this makes it sound like we were in the hotel a lot. We weren't hardly ever there. Our days and nights were full of sightseeing, dining, and searching for the ultimate hangout. When we checked in, they were fully booked. We booked through expedia, so our request for a king smoking room was never passed on to reservations. We explained to the desk that it was our anniversary. Well, the next morning, we were upgraded to a king balcony room at no additional cost. It was fantastic. We're used to sleeping on a pillow top king, and the ones in the hotel are even nicer than ours. Talk about sleeping like a baby. Room darkening shades made it impossible to tell what time of day it was. Not that it mattered. The party is 24/7. As far as the noise? HELLO!, it is Bourbon Street. If this bothers you, drink more or stay somewhere else, far far away from here. As far as parking goes, we flew into town and spent less on taxis and street cars/buses than parking would have cost us. A much better way to see the city in my opinion. But a little research prior to your trip would have told you that parking is very much at a premium in the Quarter. Besides, you can easily spend a whole week just walking around the 85 square blocks of the Quarter and still not see or do everything. We got room service one morning and were satisfied with that experience as well. Yes, 6 cups of coffee is about $14.00. But things like english muffins and so forth were only $1-$2. Try getting breakfast anywhere in the quarter for that. The day before it cost $40 for an omelet and 3 bloody marys at a restaurant right down the street. They pressure wash the grounds around the pool every morning and place fresh towels on all of the chairs. The pool is also cleaned daily and the grounds are beautiful. Vacations really are what you make of them, but the entire staff right down to the maids did an excellent job of making you feel at home. A little research prior to your arrival also goes along way. The only surprise we had was that the place was nicer and friendlier than we could have imagined. As far as a comment by another reviewer that they make you show your room card late at night to get back in, well, trust me, if you see what goes on out on Bourbon Street, you'll be glad they do confirm that everyone entering is indeed a registered guest. One last observation as well as a response to another reviewer, yes it is 2010. The outlets are on the base of every lamp in the room. Right next to the switch. Reviewers have mentioned the smell on Bourbon Street. Comparing it to vomit and urine. Well, we figured it out the very first day. They do scrub and wash the entire French Quarter every day. There are very few alleys or places for dumpsters, so everyone uses the large cans on wheels. The smell is garbage. They pick up daily and once the cans are rolled away the smell is all but non existent. It reminds me of Philly back in the 60's. Every woman would wash and scrub their stoop on Saturday, or make the kids do it, lol. In the Quarter they do it daily! All in all, a 5 star vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A LOUD dump”
Reviews.Author: BE45789
Reviews.Content: If you have a hotel right on Bourbon Street the rooms have to be soundproofed, right? WRONG!! Prepare to hear every note of every song played in every bar on the strip, along with every yell, laugh and scream. Don't worry - it only goes on till about 3 AM! Rooms are dirty, smelly and not well kept. Ours had the mirror removed from the wall - odd. Hardly any outlets (yes its 2010; people have cellphones, computers...)

Reviews.Title: “this was a new experience”
Reviews.Author: joyjoy1318
Reviews.Content: The Inn on Bourbon was a really nice hotel. Our concierge Anne was very helpful. We went to the WWII museum, rode the Charles St. streetcar, went to Harrahs and tried our luck ,the french market, toured the city(highly recommend) and Katrina damages,walked to the riverwalk, browsed on Royal St.,shopped on Magazine St. and enjoyed the partying on Bourbon St. We dined at Emeril's and Irene"s,delicious,had muffaletto's and po'boys and my husband enjoyed oysters and gumbo at Bourbon House. What a trip! Our hotel was in a good location and our room overlooked the courtyard and was really clean. We had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “If you have problems here, just hope they happen during the day..”
Reviews.Author: pslandry
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel, my room was very warm---not what I was looking for with temps hitting daytime highs of 93. I called the front desk and spoke with a gentleman who said, "Well it's an old hotel, set your thermostat to 72 and the put the fan on medium and it should cool down." I did this and left my room for the party that is New Orleans. Upon returning to my room, it was still extremely warm. I went ahead and went to bed after a cool shower. The following day, it was still no cooler in my room. As I had left the thermostat and fan on as directed and this did no good at all, I went down to the front desk to speak with a manager on duty. I sat in the lobby for 3 hours waiting for the manager to check on my room. At 2am, I had not heard back from the manager and my room was no cooler, so I located the manager and she only would tell me that she "hadn't had time to get to it." Not sure what she was doing from 11 pm until 2 am, but it appears she was trying to conjure some free breakfast coupons for me. She told me that as a night manager, she had "no authority" to do anything but give me a free breakfast. She could not comp my room nor move me to another property that could accomodate me. After 3 hours, the front desk clerk told the manager that they had 2 rooms available that were "no shows." At this time, the manager said I could move to one of these rooms, but it was a smoking room. This room was much cooler with a working A/C, although it was a smoking room and smelled terrible. My travel companion has to take breathing treatments and smoke is highly irritating for him. Thus, the reason I specifically requested a NON-SMOKING room. I had no choice but to take this room as it was now after 2am and I had been waiting for 3 hours for some resolution. I specifically pre-paid for a NON-SMOKING room. If I hadn't pre-paid I would have left the property, as the hotel on the next block, Maison Dupuy, had rooms available at a lower daily rate. Ramada knew that I was in a SMOKING room and although I had 2 more nights stay , they made no attempt to try to move me to the room I paid for, a NON-SMOKING room. I stayed at the hotel for two nights with a non-working A/C and two nights which was much cooler, but in a room that reeked of smoke. The front office manager on the day shift advised me he would refund my room for one night, but I would not be further compensated. I have yet to receive my refund for any night. I sincerely got the feeling that since I had pre-paid before my arrival date----they had my money---so they really didn't care about my experience. I don't understand why the hotel would have a night manager on duty who stated she had no authority to do anything to accomodate my needs. Throughout my 3 hour stay in the lobby, the front desk staff as well as the security guard on duty repeatedly made comments about the incompetence of this particular manager (and now I know why). One of the front desk staff even wrote a letter of apology and slipped it under my door. Again, why the night manager would not do this herself remains a mystery to me. Per the night manager, this hotel only gives any kind of authority to the front office manager who is a day manager. And the hotel staff are not permitted to contact anyone after hours who has any type of authority. If you have any problems during your stay, you better hope they happen during the day as at night, the hotel becomes a property that becomes "managed" by people who have no authority to help you and refuse to contact anyone who has any "authority." I have stayed at this property over the past several years, but they will never get my business again and I certainly would not recommend this property to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but expensive parking. Bourbon Street is NOT for families!”
Reviews.Author: Tappy Feet
Reviews.Content: Seemed a high end hotel and therefore value for money. Pretty courtyard pool with towels available. The room was well appointed but it always smelled damp. Although we had prepaid for the room, parking was $25 a day. Valet parking only on the room of the hotel added considerably to the cost of the trip. We had no choice but to pay their exhorbitant parking rate. There is a computer in the lobby which we used. Breakfast is a la carte and no included in the rate. Bourbon Street is really weird. We had no idea it was so sleazy. Barely clad girls on the street outside the hotel at 5pm inviting you in. We expected jazz not sleaze. We went out early in the morning for breakfast and was very surprised to see the streets and pavements had been hosed down. The smell was awful. I don't know what people get up to on the street at night. We didn't sleep well as there were lots of people shouting aloud throught the night in the corridors and running up and down. Evening in the afternoon there were several men on our floor going in and out of rooms dressed in underwear only. Such a shame because the hotel itself is lovely and the staff are well trained. We would NOT return and if we did find ourself in New Orleans, we would stay in Canal street instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jackandjill4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a typical old New Orleans building right in the center of the French Quarter. It could not be located any better if that's where you want to be. Rooms were clean and efficient and really not much else to report. Rooms facing outside are loud so if you want some peace at night, ask for room which faces the pool and courtyard. The lasting memory is that at $60 a night the hotel was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In New Orleans!!”
Reviews.Author: robi1823
Reviews.Content: Arrived in New Orleans from New York on August 14 and stayed 2 nights at the Inn on Bourbon. This was our first visit to New Orleans. I am very picky when it comes to hotel accomodations. It does not have to be expensive but it needs to be clean and well run. Everything about the hotel was great, from the location which is right on Bourbon Street in the middle of everything, to the accomodations. The staff was wonderful and helpful. We got in early so our rooms were not ready when we arrived. I gave them my cell number and went off to explore. When the rooms were ready I received a phone call. The rooms were clean and roomy. Beds were very comfortable. Loved the courtyard with the pool. I honestly have no complaints and would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NO.

Reviews.Title: “Poor front desk service”
Reviews.Author: TransATL
Reviews.Content: I prepaid a room for my brother-in-law who is a traveling student with no credit card ... and knowing he would need a credit card on file for his room deposit and incidentals (such as phone calls) I took the time and effort to call the hotel early on the day of his arrival to arrange everything. First, the hotel had problems with a simple email and I had to call back twice to get them to send it (the authorization form) to me. So after finally receiving their email I sent the credit card authorization via email to the hotel and guess what: when my brother in law checked in the hotel made him pay a cash deposit. They obviously either had no record of my efforts or didn't bother to check. So the very problem I had diligently attempted to avoid in fact occurred. When I called this morning to straighten everything out, the front desk clerk's attitude was first to make sure that I hadn't screwed something up. Only after I insisted and explained my experience from the day before did the clerk start to realize maybe the hotel had not processed the paperwork as they should have. She apologized, but really, why did I bother to make the effort in the first instance? My impression: A disorganized front desk. And the default position when a problem is raised is that the guest is probably to blame and has to prove himself right before the hotel will start to provide service.

Reviews.Title: “Never, Never, Never again”
Reviews.Author: packitUsa
Reviews.Content: Poor Management- From the front desk clerk to the manager on duty. Attitude is take it or leave it, we donâ€™t care. Itâ€™s just another Bourbon street rip-off Exorbitant rates- talked to other guests who were paying from $65.00 to $110 per night, I was charged $170.00 for week days and $270 for Friday night. When I asked the manager why was charged so much he never gave me a direct answer or even offered to review my bill. I get the feeling that he gets complaints on a regular basis. His attitude is â€œif you donâ€™t like it leave!â€� Loud and Dirty- Rooms on the Bourbon and Toulous are very noisy. The balcony wraps around the building and the party goes until 4:00AM. Thinking of sleeping? Wonâ€™t happen here. You have to avoid the vomit on the sidewalks if you are an early AM walker/runner Prostitutes working out of the hotel- solicited in the elevator. They use this hotel as a base for their services. Oh, by the wayâ€¦the prostitute room rate charged by the hotel is $65.00 per night. I guess this is the type of class clients they would like to have as guests. Please refer to my comments on what I was charged. The true â€œcesspoolâ€� of Louisianaâ€™s French Market (and the tax payers of America spent how many billions to save this place?) Save your money and stay away from this circus. The dozen or so nice places in the warehouse district could have been relocated to a nicer city.

Reviews.Title: “"OMG" Inn On Bourbon the right fit BABY!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lspencer8
Reviews.Content: Staff EXCELLENT!! Guest Service. We were offered a map without asking for it, suggested Hot Spots without asking and were giving outstanding advice come with the right attitude,be open and pace yourself. We needed help with our luggage during check in and check out they gave it.. Inn On Bourbon is the BEST CHOICE!! why? you step outside and you're in the center of action. No Joke Center of Action. Shout Out to Fat Cats Awesome MC Jesse E. Shout out to Cats Meow awesome, Shout Out to Rythem and Blues. Can't close without mentioning Pier 424 SeaFood Market Restaurant food and Margaritas OMG,last but not least Oceana WOW

Reviews.Title: “It doesnt get better than this”
Reviews.Author: mshamiam
Reviews.Content: This is why they call the City of New Orleans The Big Easy. The Inn at Bourbon made our stay worry free. When we needed a map, they had it, when we needed suggestions on where to it, they offered it, when we needed assistance getting to our room, they guided us. Just prior to visiting New Orleans I had been in Jamaica and I have to say, my stay in The Crescent City was way more relaxing that Jamaica and a good part of that had to to with the attentive staff at the Inn. Let the good times roll. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: socialite47
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a girls wknd. Excellent budget hotel with a great location. Our room was very clean, beds comfortable w/ nice pillows. The shower had good water pressure w/ plenty of hot water. We had a room with a balcony that over looked the court yard/pool area. I would recommend a court yard balcony, if you want to avoid the late night noise on the streets. The hotel staff was extremely nice and helpful. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and shops with in walking distance. Our overall stay was a wonderful experience and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn on Bourbon Hotel Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: hial1211
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and our room was ready since I requested early check in. This hotel is a Wyndham by Request member, and the applied all that comes with being a member. The room was extra large, clean, cool. I requested a refrigerator for my meds and they brought one in with no problem. The housekeepers where exceptional with my needs, like lots of coffee every day. The desk staff where so accomodating to my needs. Our room faced Toulouise street, and yet the music did not bother us at night. We sat on the balcony, and you could see Bourbon's activities, and enjoyed the music. The police were extremely friendly with all the visitors, New Orleans is a place where they really appreciate their tourist. Street musicians were increditable. The Market Cafe on Decatur Street had great reasonable food and the musicians were awesome. There is Musician Park on Bourbon that is also great with excellent musicians. The paddle board Creole Queen was very entertaining, good food and musicians. We did the dinner jazz tour. For street musicians go on to Royal Street, there they have great art stores. We were there for 8 days and still did not get to see everything, therefore we will return, but not in the summer, just to much humidity and hot. Other than the weather New Orleans is an exceptional city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Girl "Friends" Weekend Getaway 2010!”
Reviews.Author: Harley04chick
Reviews.Content: Tip 1: Bourbon street is not for young kids....so if you stay at this hotel and your kids see things you don't want them to, don't blame the hotel....look in the mirror!! You are on Bourbon St, use some common sense!! Tip 2:This Hotel was an awesome place to stay for not only service, ammenities but also LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! You walk out the front door and you feel like you have fallen down "Alices' Rabbit Hole"!! It's is like another world, 3 for 1 drinks, every 3 stores is a daquiri store...just walk in and pick your favorite flavor from what I called "the wall of trouble". ...etc, etc.. Tip 3: If you don't want to be kept awake all night then will want to get a courtyard room. The pool is a good size and convenient to get to. Tip 4: Elevators are a little slow, so be prepared to wait a few minutes. Tip 5: Restaurant-Breakfast sandwhiches were reasonably priced and were yummy. Tip : No frig or microwave in the regular rooms, so bring an ice chest if you want to bring food back to your room for a midnight snack. (But you probably won't be in your room for a midnight snack!! This was my first time to NOLA and this hotel, and I was not disappointed. We had the greatest time, but then any trip is what you make of it...

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: MzG68
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this place. Security at night was great. Get your room key out because they are going to check to make sure you are a guest before they let you in at night. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was yummy. Rooms had everything you needed except a frig. If you want to sleep at night be sure to get a room on the back of the hotel, the front faces Bourbon St and it is loud (if you are on the front side they offer ear plugs for the noise at night). Balcony doors swell with the humidity but if you work at it hard enough you can get them open! Great location!

Reviews.Title: “One of my Favs”
Reviews.Author: BayouBeatdown
Reviews.Content: I go down to New Orleans about 4-5 times a year, and this is my goto place. It is in the perfect location for me. You have to understand that this is on Bourbon so if you are a light sleeper or want some quiet, ask for an Inside row room. The outside rows face Bourbon and Toulouse. The Inside row faces the courtyard. This time I was in an Inside row and I couldnt hear a thing. Beautiful balconies. Awesome weekend breakfast buffet. Cant wait till the next time Im down there, miss it all ready.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and price!”
Reviews.Author: nancy1965
Reviews.Content: My mom, nephew and I stayed here for 4 nights. The location was perfect walking distance to everything. What few problems we had the hotel staff was quick to fix immediately. Both gentlemen who helped us with our luggage were extremely friendly. The one who helped us on check-in told us places to see and eat. We got a great price on neworleansonline.com.

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect!”
Reviews.Author: klepto
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to New Orleans, but the first time we stayed in the Quarter. The staff was very friendly and spoke to us kindly and with respect. The rooms were comfortable, clean, and exactly as promised. We enjoyed the pool which was clean and provided wonderfully thick towels. We also enjoyed watching the "action" from our balcony room. I would not think of staying in a different location! Thanks again for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “So worth it”
Reviews.Author: ramomerc
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans to unwind with the wife and her best friend. I have always loved New Orleans and been a long time Saints fan so staying at a hotel on Bourbon Street was such a treat. My room was very nice. We had a room with a balcony over Bourbon Street and the view of the street was good. The staff was very nice and professional. I have read about the noise complaints on here but it really wasn't as bad as I had read. Sure there was some noise but not to the point you couldn't sleep unless you are a super light sleeper. My wife and her friend both got earplugs from the reception desk and slept fine. I used the gym while there also. even though small it did the trick. Couldn't find how to turn on the gym tv but didn't matter because I had my ipod. During our stay we did a Haunted Tour which was ok and a Swamp tour which was very good. Had a fun stay. The food was great as always except for Oceana. They just acquired a new cook and staff and the food wasn't even close to par. Regardless of this this hotel was in the prime location for everything there is in New Orleans. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “not returning to Ramada on Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: lrh4
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to NOLA with the same friends. We booked trough a travel agent in October 2009, requesting a 2nd floor Bourbon St balcony. As the time for the trip approached, both couples made several phone calls to the hotel to check on the balcony rooms possibility as well as to request our rooms next to each other. We knew that there was no way to guarantee our choice but felt that numerous requests (which were noted in our reservation file) would help. We arrived around 1 or 1:30 pm knowing an early check in might not happen. Upon arrival, our friends had a confirmed Bourbon St balcony room on the 2nd floor. My husband and I however, did not have a room. At all. There was a lot of confusion as to whether we even had a reservation although we had all the reservation documents. Finally they said we would have a room by 4 pm which is check in time. We left for some lunch and returned about 3:30 pm. Our friends got into their room right away but we had to wait in the lobby. Finally we spoke to the front desk manager Troy, again, and said we'd be in our friends room and to call us there. He told us they finally found us a great room that we would be happy with....on the 2nd floor, Bourbon balcony. But not near our friends. The room was finally ready he said so we went to it. The door was cracked open so we went in to a very dirty and messy room. The housekeeping staff had not been told to get the room ready. But it was a perfect room....on the corner of Toulouse and Bourbon with a wraparound balcony. So we went back to our friends room and after awhile, not hearing from the front desk, went on to the room. It was ready! It's 5 pm now. Although we were not next to our friends, we had a great time during the week. We were to be there from Sunday night to Friday morning. On Thursday afternoon, we came back to the hotel after a day out, ready for a last night happy hour on our balcony. But our keys wouldn't open the door to our room. We kept trying and finally we got a bellman to open it. There was a group of people on the balcony who when confronted by my husband, told him that this was their room that they booked every year and they wanted us out. Meanwhile, I had gone down to the front desk to get new keys and was called into the back room. Not looking good at this point. The manager tells me that they knew we wanted to be next to our friends and now they had a room right next door! He wanted us to move. I couldn't believe that this had happened and told him so. He said he'd comp us half the room rate if we'd move. Upstairs on the balcony, the "rightful" guest told my husband that if we didn't change rooms, he'd make our last night unpleasant. In the end, we demanded the night free and did move but it was a nightmare. It was our last night and we had to pack everything up and haul it down the hall because the promised bellman did not show up in time. Now I have to say that our first trip was wonderful back in 2005 and is the reason we chose to stay there again. However, the mistakes that were made on this trip were absolutely inexcusable and there was not ever an apology given. It was as if they were doing us a huge favor by switching our rooms. They knew when we checked in and were given the room that it was booked for Thursday on. I hate to be the bearer of a bad review but when you spend that amount of money and get mostly trouble and unprofessionalism in return, we WILL NOT RETURN and will advise any friends traveling to NOLA to avoid this hotel. I believe that the problem began with front desk manager Troy who let the ball drop on some other issues during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is well maintained and room was...”
Reviews.Author: swd5
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well maintained and room was very comfortable. The room was suprisingly quiet considering the Burbon Street location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: DenverShelly
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased by our stay at the Inn on Bourbon. We had a standard room which was lovely and quiet. The business center was perfect, and everything was easy. The location is simply the best, and we felt that we were in the heart of the French Quarter. When we return to NOLA, we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again! I would not if I were you!”
Reviews.Author: mopolk
Reviews.Content: I traveled to New Orleans with my cousin and asked for a two bed room. The piece of paper said that it was upon availability and I understood that. They could have called me or emailed me that I wasn't going to be able to get the amount of beds I asked for. The only thing was my cousin is a grown man and he didn't want to sleep with his grown cousin. So the hotel administration threw in a horrible roll away bed for me to sleep on. I paid alot of money to stay on a roll away bed. Then the other thing when we made our reservation we were told we would have a balcony and guess what we didn't. We were really looking forward to being able to sit on our balcony and watch the street. The administration told us that we needed to get a hold of getaroom.com and they would have to take care of it. So I called getaroom.com and they told me that the main office is closed and the only thing I could do is ask the hotel administration the next day if I could get the room I ordered. The getaroom.com people also told me that the only thing they could do is turn it in to the main office Monday, but that nothing would come of it. They did take it off their site that there is a balcony with the room I ordered, but a little too late for me. These people just try to pass the buck on problems and it isn't right. You pay alot of money to stay at these places and they don't care if they make your stay horrible. Two days on a roll away bed and you will feel like you have been in a car wreck. You could be in a big battle staying here! Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected for the Ramada chain”
Reviews.Author: beachgirlinmemphis
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Royal Sonesta on Bourbon street several times we decided to try the Inn on Bourbon this time since we had hopes of a private balcony. We booked a room with the Bourbon St. balcony. The room was outrageously expensive, obviously due to the location and that prime balcony - prices appeared to be similar when we checked on-line at the Sonesta. We'd requested a private balcony but there are apparently very few of those in the king bed rooms, so we did not get our request. The lobby is much nicer than the typical Ramada, but not as nice as the Sonesta. The room was small (about the same size as rooms we've had at the Sonesta) but much more nicely decorated than, again, the typical Ramada. Our only complaint about the room was that although it appeared to have been redecorated fairly recently (great bed, new looking furniture, nice linens, drapes, and carpet) the bathroom cabinetry looked old and needed repainted, our room door looked shabby (that hurt our first impression of the room), and in general all the interior door frames needed painted. Although the room was on Bourbon we didn't have a great deal of problem sleeping - the beds were very comfortable and the noise seemed to only wake us up when there was unusual yelling down on the street. The hotel staff were efficient and helpful. The maids in the hallways were always very friendly. The pool is small for the number of guestrooms and does not have a bar. So, overall, the hotel was pretty nice, but for the price we paid for our room we'll likely go back to the Sonesta next time since the chances of getting the private balcony appear to be slim anyway and Sonesta's attention to detail is just better (and no more expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sndspeed
Reviews.Content: Most of the nice hotels in the quarter are more than $200 per night-- from a discounter the Inn On Bourbon Ramada was a steal at $120! Beautifully appointed, super comfortable and with probably the most central location in the French Quarter... I patted myself on the back for finding it and am looking forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tleray
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn of Bourbon one night for a jewelry show at the convention center. I was pleasantly surprised after booking a standard room that we had a suite. Being as it was just girls on the trip we did not want to stay off any side streets. This hotel is wonderful and very nice, also there is security at the door late at nite checking key cards. The noise level is a little loud, but hey your in the Big Easy not at church:) With a few drinks the noise did not interrupt our sleeping. We loved the hotel so much that we have already booked it for the Nov jewelry show. Highly Recommended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted and expected”
Reviews.Author: rlc001
Reviews.Content: Our first time in NOLA. Wanted to experience the essence of the French Quarter. What better way than to stay right in the middle of it! Ignore all the bad reviews - this is a very nice hotel, well kept, clean, very friendly staff throughout, very helpful concierge service. We arrived several hours before check-in and were given our room right away. We had a balcony overlooking the pool which was great. Had requested a King, but got two queens, not a problem at all. Beds were very comfortable, room was very clean, bathroom more than adequate, housekeeping did their jobs well. We spoke to another couple that were changing their rooms (didn't like the noise on Bourbon Street side - HELLO ! ) If you want to go to bed early and sleep don't stay on Bourbon St. ! We went there with the expectations of having a lot of fun in a noisy environment and the heck with the sleep! We weren;t disappointed. As far as the complaints of having to show your room key EVERY time you entered, it just isn't so. After 10:00 pm they did have a doorman at the door. I don't know about anyone else, but my room card is always in my front pocket, and just a quick flash to the doorman was all it took - you do have to get it out to get into the room don;t you? Made for a more secure feeling, what with all the crap going on these days. Also checked out the Royal Sonesta down the street (Irvin Mayfield IS the real thing!). Also a very nice hotel. But for the price we paid, the location and the ambience, my wife and I both agree that the Inn on Bourbon was definitely the best value and the best place on the street, hands down. Will be going back to NOLA and will be at the INN on Bourbon. Date of stay: May 5 - May 8,2010

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Ashwednesday666
Reviews.Content: Valet parking, Very nice room w/balcony over looking pool. A bed to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Heart of The French Quarter, an Oasis”
Reviews.Author: CamilleNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The Inn on Bourbon has a quiet side, and it's the rooms facing the courtyard! Sleep like a baby in a beautiful refurbished room with a great bed and comfy pillows. The bathroom was shiny bright, even the grout was white, and the towels thick and new. We were there for a week, and took it slow, enjoying the best that the Quarter had to offer while staying in the middle of the action. But, if it's high speed internet you need, you won't find it on the fifth floor. Even in the lobby, the connection is slow and quirky. When a drunk came banging on our door early one morning, security was there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: onmycell
Reviews.Content: We were only there for one night - a Wednesday night. Wanted to stay in the Quarter with a balcony room - on the bucket list. Anyways, our room was on the 2nd floor with a balcony on Toulouse Street. There is a beer store right across the street. Beers are CHEAP. Three for about $4. I was thrilled. Anyways, the room is a tad small, but very charming. The location is seriously right in the middle of the French Quarters. Nice little courtyard and pool. French doors on the bathroom. Very clean. Had absolutely no trouble sleeping. Didn't notice the noise at all, but like mentioned about, room was on Toulouse, not Bourbon, and it was a Wednesday night. Would definitely return. Couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore bad reviews-Great Place to stay(even during Jazz Fest)”
Reviews.Author: AtlCarp
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at Jazz Fest. We hadn't been in our room for 10 minutes when we got a call asking if everything was ok or if we needed anything-all was perfect.. Welcomed on Thursday with free party-live music, food, drinks ect. Parking: simple and friendly. Loaction:Perfect We booked on Expedia and got a great rate so I expected the worst room- was happy even on Bourbon and near elevator- noise was fine, Surprisingly, Thursday night was the loudest- but ok. Super, Super Staff- and a lot of them. Never got in Hotel at night without showing Key. It's a solid, well renovated, hotel. Only weakness- gym. I'd say a Very strong 3.5/4 stars. and for the $$$ 5 plus!!! I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: maurbol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a wedding party and the Inn is just gorgeous. The staff at the front desk was friendly, efficient and professional. The room was lovely, we faced Bourban which can be a tad noisy but it was part of the fun. our room was cleaned very quickly the next morning when we went out for a little while which was a pleasant surprise. Pool area is just delightful and you can't hear a thing from Bourban St. when you are back there. The concierge Ann was a huge help to me. Next time in NO we will stay there and have told our friends here in MI what a great place to be for all the sights and sounds of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but it depends what you are looking for...”
Reviews.Author: TheVacationAdvisors
Reviews.Content: For the full review and photos, visit our website, TheVacationAdvisors: The hotel is located in the French Quarter of New Orleans, on the corner of Bourbon Street and Toulouse Street. If your coming to party or to enjoy the sites around the French Quarter then this location is ideal. The famous Mardi Gras party starts and ends on Bourbon Street, meaning that you are right in the middle of things at this location. If you prefer a more secluded or quiet location, we would suggest you book a hotel a little farther away from this area. This hotel is also about a 15-minute walk of the main shopping street located just outside the French Quarter. We stayed in a standard room and found the room quite comfortable. The room was small, but it did have a nice balcony to relax on. How much time are you going to spend in your room when in New Orleans anyway? The rooms are tastefully decorated and have comfortable bedding. The bathroom in our room was small but had everything that we needed during our stay. We stayed in a street-view room which was a bit noisy at night due to the loud music being played at the many nearby bars, but that was part of the appeal so it really didn't bother us. If you want something more quieter, you can always stay in a pool-view room instead of the street-view room. Overall, we really liked the location of this hotel and we really did enjoyed our stay. We recommend this hotel, just make sure you choose a room that's appropriate for you, i.e., a pool-view room if you prefer a quieter area or a street-view room if you prefer the noise and action from the street below.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Once Again - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dale_Shannon
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to this hotel within the last seven months.. It is a great place to stay. Right in the center of all the action on bourbon street.. Great restaurants within walking distance.. Very impressed with all of the New Orleans Police officers on every corner, never felt safer in my life. Only have one suggestion, If you stay in one of the rooms facing Bourbon or Toulouse street, you can expect loud music and noise into the morning hours. If you stay in one of the rooms overlooking the courtyard, things are very quite.. The staff here goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. The breakfast and lunch in the restaurant are great and the staff here also go out of their way to make you feel at home. One suggestion, order from the menu, It is more reasonable than the buffet. Rates at this location are more reasonable than the Royal Sonesta or other local hotels. Great place to hang your hat.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to book a room was very confusing”
Reviews.Author: triptakersNH
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, location! My husband and I stayed at this hotel about 10 years ago, and he stayed here with friends (boys weekend) 3 more times since then. It is PRIME location if you want to be right in the middle of the action. Had 2nd story balcony room overlooking Bourbon street every time. We are going back again in July 2010 and just booked the room last week. I just wanted to make people aware that the booking process was VERY confusing this time! First, I went to the hotel's website to check availability and price for the date I wanted. I wanted a mini suite since there would be 3 of us staying in the room. (Me, husband, friend) I read all of the details about the cost of having an extra person in the room as well as looked at the photo they showed of the suite. It had a king bed as well as a living room-type set up with a couch, chair, coffee table, and a small round dining table with 2 chairs. Since it was most important to us to have a room overlooking Bourbon street, and it wasn't clear on the website if the mini suite was in that location, I called the hotel directly (from number listed on the website) to verify the location. The person answering the phone stated "Inn on Bourbon, how can I direct your call"? When I said I had questions and would like to book a room for July, they transfered me to what turned out to be the nation wide Ramada Inn call center. I asked my questions and the women stated the mini suite could hold 3 people but it would cost an additional $35 per night. I asked if we could get a roll away cot and she said yes. She even suggested that the 3rd person could just sleep on the couch. That was perfect. I let her know that I would discuss this with my husband, then call back shortly to book the room. So I call back about 30 minutes later and got the same hello, then was transfered again to that call center, and got a different person. I told him I wanted to book the mini suite for 3 people, etc.....He said you can't have 3 people in the mini suite, it can't be more than 2. I told him I had just spoken to someone a short time ago, and they said it was fine, and that I had read on the website that an additional person in the room was ok as long as you paid the extra fee. The very condesending voice on the other end of the phone repeated that you can't have 3 people in the room, it's a safety thing, the rooms aren't big enough. I reminded him that I was booking the mini suite and it looks big in the picture on the website, and the 3rd person was going to sleep on the couch. He rudely told me that there wasn't a couch in the room. I said, I am looking at the website photo of the mini suite right now and there's a COUCH! I said is there some other room /suite that has a couch/ living-room area, he said NO. He said he could put me on hold and call the hotel directly himself and inquire. He came back and said no couch, no 3 people! At this point I was very confused...cause I saw the couch.....so I hung up and thought maybe if I call back and get someone else, they might be more helpful and hopefully polite. I waited about a half hour and called back, this time, I stopped the guy from transfering me to that Ramada call center. I asked if he was actually, physically at the hotel. He was. I asked if there was someone on-site who could help me book a room. He nicely transfered me to a very nice women at the hotel, who I told everything that had occurred up til now. She said they DID have rooms with couches, but you can't have more than 2 people in them due to some safety reason. ( knew I saw a couch). Ok, so I ended up booking the 2 double bed room with a Bourbon street balcony. I asked if it could be the 2nd floor instead of the 3rd to be closer to the action. The only way to get the 2nd floor balcony is if you want "smoking". We don't smoke, but requested smoking so we could have the 2nd floor. In summery, I would say, it's the best location if you want to be right in the thick of things. Request the "Bourbon" street balcony. "smoking", so you can get the 2nd floor (3rd is too far away from the action), and ask to speak to someone on site to book your room.

Reviews.Title: “i enjoyed it enough to write about it”
Reviews.Author: silkylady70
Reviews.Content: I researched over twenty hours on a hotel for my trip to New Orleans, and i was not disappointed. First let me say thanks to all traveler, who post and let me boo the one's that post and write things that are not true because, something happens to them that would have happen to them where ever they go because they cannot be pleased. Second, New Orleans is a old city, that is the beauty of it The inn on Bourbon was perfect, the rooms had been redone freshly painted new tiolets, and new bathtubs, all new granite , sinks etc. The beds were great have not slept that good in a long time. Called for extra towels within 5 min of getting in the room and they was there within 10 min, that is services. Everyone went out of there way to be friendly and helpful. I am 55, i had a 40, 28, 23 years old and everyone loved it. the hall were fine they had not been redone but they were just as grand i would stay here all the time. The location was great we was in the middle of everything. We did take a taxi to the theater but for 4 it was only 9.00 bucks,front door service. This is not the rizt, no robes, but next to it. Oh, and yes after 10.00 you have to show your room key to get in, that is a extra bonus,.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: JoahG
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent hotel with good service to a affordeble price, if you looking to find the spirit of Bourbon street this is the place to go. Had a courty yard room with balcony, itÂ´s nice with a little pice and quirt after a day of music. and a gain location, location, good rooms

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exploring the Quarter...”
Reviews.Author: Mark_M123Sydney
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed here mid January 2010. What can I say...a superb location, excellent, friendly & attentive staff and a lovely "New Orleans" feel to the hotel. Getting a street facing balcony is a must....ours was on Toulouse Street and wish I had booked a Bourbon balcony...but that is my fault....in any case Toulouse is interesting too. The hotel staff were very friendly, nothing was too much trouble right through our stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel. At the pricier end of the market, but not exorbitant, and definately worth every cent, particularly in terms of location.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME TIME”
Reviews.Author: IOTASUMMER
Reviews.Content: We are from south Louisiana. Hotel directions from I-10 were exact. Valet was professional and secure. Check in was quick. We had a corner suite on bourbon st side. Couldn't hear a thing. Bed was like a cloud to sleep on. Only downside was our room didn't have a safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Mardi Gras or French Quarter Exploration”
Reviews.Author: alexgav
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights at the beginning of the last week of Mardi Gras carnival (Tuesday-Thursday of the week before Mardi Gras Tuesday). I wanted a balcony facing Bourbond Street, and there are really just three hotels that provide that - this one, Royal Sonesta, and Bourbon Orleans. The only reason why I gave the hotel 4 stars instead of 5 is because booking a room was a nightmare. People at the actualy hotel wouldn't talk to you. They forward you to the Ramada Central Reservation System, which appears to be located outside of the country. They don't speak great English and try to get you to book a timeshare trip every time you call. However, the web site didn't show any Bourbon Balcony rooms available, while the reservation person on the phone said that she could see one, so we went with the reservation people. After several calls we books a Bourbon Balcony room, and had our fingers crossed that we would actually get one. We had no way of making a special request, such as "second floor", which is what we really wanted. So when we checked in, sure enough, we got a third floor balcony (although it was facing Bourbon St as advertised). They told us second floor was smoking only, which why we didn't get it (even though we specificed that was didn't care that much about smoking/non-smoking and would take the best room available). They asked us to keep checking, which we did, and finally they gave us a second-floor room, which was much better (easier to interact with people on the street, i.e. throw them beads, etc.). Our first room had a huge balcony shared between 3 or 4 rooms. Our second room had a private balcony, which was nicer. Besides that we were happy with the hotel. It was clean and plush, both the lobby and the rooms. The walls did have some nicks on them, but the furniture was in good repair, and all room accessories seemed new and in good repair as well. The beds were comfy. Hotel staff was (for the most part) friendly and helpful. The location is what makes this hotel so awesome. It is in the middle of Bourbon St, so it is a great location for Mardi Gras or to explore French Quarter. Of course, you won't get any sleep if your room faces Bourbon St. However, we knew that, so we brought one of the "soothing sounds' alam clock machines to block out some of the street noise, and we also had a set of ear plugs.
