Both of those combined allowed decent sleep even facing Bourbon St. The only other drawback is of course cost of the rooms during Mardi Gras. We paid $250/night, and it was during the slower Mardi Gras days.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel right in the center of everything!”
Reviews.Author: asaini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Inn 13-15 Feb and were very impressed with the property, location and the friendly staff. The location is unbeatable, right in the middle of French Quarter and walking distance from great attractions and restaurants. Will definitely recommend to others and return in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “A great surprise in the middle of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: SlyFoxx
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to give a glowing review because I don't want this great hotel to get so crowded that I can't get a reservation! But seriously, this was a nice surprise right on Bourbon Street. Very clean and casually elegant. Courtyard rooms were very quiet, and balcony rooms facing side street not too bad -- but the Bourbon-side rooms are infused with all the music, sirens, and partying in the streets. This is a perfect location if you're planning to shop, dine, and sample nightlife on Bourbon and don't feel like a long walk back to the hotel. (You know what I mean...it's not called Bourbon Street for nothing!) The central location will also keep you away from a few dubious side streets that sprinkle the area around the Quarter. I've stayed at a lot of hotels around the Quarter, and this one is easily my favorite. It's not a "cheap" stay, but this is a city where you get what you pay for on lodging. Splurge on the Inn and find cheap deals on food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: nicemom
Reviews.Content: JUST GOT BACK FROM A FUN VACATION WITH MY TWO DAUGHTERS AND EXTENDED FAMILY - WE HAD THREE ROOMS ALL TOGETHER. I was pretty hesitant about keeping my reservations with this this hotel after reading some of the bad reviews but decided to go with it and take the chance since the location was what we wanted and it had balconies. We stayed on the side street with a balcony - the room was roomy - the bathroom was very large - everything was clean and kept clean throughout our stay - the people who worked there from the front desk to the service were all polite and professional and friendly. The location is perfect and in spite of the location, the noise didn't bother us but that might have been because we were not on bourbon but on the side street. We were given all the help we needed finding restaurants and tours - the staff could not have been more helpful. The only suggestion I would have would be that the restaurant be open throughout the day or have room service throughout the day and not only at breakfast time. We did order breakfast service to our room and it arrived right on time each day!! The hotel arranged for a private van taxi for two of our rooms as the other room's occupants were driving. We left our bags in their holding room after checking out and walked around town for a couple of hours before leaving - On loading our suitcases - one of them was somehow left at the hotel but the hotel management when called from the airport immediately made arrangements to ship the bag out to me . I would suggest that everyone should check as the bags are loaded into the vans to be sure that all bags are there and not just inside the hotel - no matter where you are this can happen as it happened in a very very nice hotel in Europe too....better ck when putting into the van to be sure they are there. Don't pay attention to the bad reviews -- this is a keeper! and p.s. the beds are very very comfortable!! Darlene Dorsey

Reviews.Title: “Great location but stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: RABrooks1
Reviews.Content: Review of Recent Stay 12/31/09 - 1/2/10 My wife and I just returned from spending New Yearâ€™s Eve at The Inn on Bourbon. I stayed there several years ago and loved it. It was very clean and professional. Our recent stay, however, was pathetic. Theyâ€™ve got some problems down there. We made reservations and had a confirmation number. I reserved a balcony room on Toulouse Street. We were excited. We arrived on 12/31/09, or rather, we attempted to arrive. The address I was given was 541 Bourbon St. Unfortunately, the streets going to that address were closed as we arrived. We couldnâ€™t even get close. It was a nightmare. I called the hotel for assistance. The man I spoke with said, â€œJust tell the cops you have reservations; theyâ€™ll let you through.â€� We told an officer that. The officer laughed and said, â€œYou call them back and tell him it ainâ€™t happeninâ€™! No one goes down Bourbon St.â€� I called back and spoke to someone else at the hotel. This person told me I would have to come to the parking garage address on Toulouse St. I was able to get to that address after a great deal of frustration. Probably shouldâ€™ve been told that to start with. Upon arrival, the girl at the desk said she couldnâ€™t find our reservations. Once I gave her our confirmation number, she said, â€œWell, good news; youâ€™ve been upgraded!â€� Great, I thought. I was thinking we were bumped up to a full suite or a balcony on Bourbon. No, I was told, we were moved to a â€œmini suiteâ€�, room 537. We got the old bait and switch. It was the balcony room that got us down there but upon arrival, none were available. We were bumped to a mini suite, which is a room with some chairs and no refrigerator. I was also hoping for a better rate since we got switched. Nope; we got the same rate, $180 per night. This, we were told, did not include parking, which was $28 per day. In our room, I placed some items on the end tables, which caused them both to fall over. Upon closer inspection, I found these table balancing on one small screw. Obviously, these tables were merely for decoration. The remote was slow and tended to malfunction. The windows were painted shut. In the bathroom, we found the toilet leaking into the floor. We reported it, but no action was taken. We had to put towels down for our entire stay. Ready to party, we pushed on. As we headed out, we found two drunken males on the fifth floor attempting to pry one of the elevators open with their hands. We went downstairs and reported it as it was happening. The people at the desk didnâ€™t care and no action was taken. That elevator was out the next day. These elevators were the biggest complaint I heard from the other guests. Theyâ€™re ridiculously slow, working or not. Before we headed out, we went straight to the bar. The sign said the hotel bar was open â€œuntilâ€¦. â€œ. Unbelievably, we found the tiny bar closed before 10 p.m. on New Yearâ€™s Eve. Ridiculous. We ventured out, had a good time and returned. On New Yearâ€™s Day, we slept in, although it was very noisy. We went to the hotel cafÃ© at lunch. On our way down, we asked one of the maids on the floor to clean our room. She said she would take care of it. The cafÃ© looked closed but we found some workers seated. CafÃ© personnel said they were open so we took a seat. One of the women yelled to someone to come out and take our order. The food was fine but the service was horrible. We didnâ€™t return. When we returned to our room later that day, we found that it had not been touched. We had to request additional towels because ours were wet from the leaking toilet. The maid had my wife sign something before we could get the towels. Later that night, we went back to the bar. As on the night before, they were closed before 10 p.m. Seriously? We then tried to order room service. Nope; no room service available either. We hit the vending machine but it didnâ€™t work either. Took all our change. On Jan 3, we ordered breakfast before we headed out. The breakfast was delivered, minus the fruit I ordered. I noticed it and yelled to the lady as she walked down the hall but she never turned around. Iâ€™m sure she heard me. I then called downstairs. They said they would send it right back up. Twenty minutes went by and I called again. Eventually, they brought the fruit back up, which consisted of only melon. On our way out, we had our usual wait at the elevators. While we stood by for one of the elevators to arrive, a male housekeeper stood by the elevators and yelled down the hall for one of the female maids. He yelled for her approximately six times. I started to walk down the hall for him, as it was obviously too far for him to walk. Check out was slow and a nightmare. We got our car and sped away, vowing to tell others of our experience. A couple of days later, I found another charge on my credit card from the hotel in the amount of $3.83. I called them for an explanation. This, I was told, was for a bottled water taken from our room during our stay. Seriously? I sent this e-mail to the hotel and to Ramada on 1/3/10. In that e-mail, I told them I intended on posting this online as a review of the hotel after a short period of time, giving the General Manager a chance to contact me about the problems. As of this date, 1/12/10, I had not heard from the General Manager. So much for customer service! Pathetic. Although the hotel is in a great spot, do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. Richard Brooks

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: HUSKERTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we waited 15 - 20 minutes for a bellman to help us with our luggage. Apparently there is only one. Can you believe it? One bellman at an EXPENSIVE, Downtown hotel, on a holiday weekend!! We made our reservations several months in advance and requested a room close to Bourbon St., but were given a room as far from Bourbon St. as possible. All the way at the end of the hotel to be exact. The elevators were tiny. The room was tiny. In fact, the bathroom was almost as big as the room. There was no towel bar by the sink, no ref., no micro., and the coffeepot was hidden. The maid never left us enough towels. Upon check-in our room had no washcloths. We had to call down for more towels every day, sometimes waiting a VERY long time. There was no exhaust fan in the bathroom and the climate control took a long time to adjust. Once we called down to have our car brought out and when we went to the garage 10 minutes later the valet hadn't even gone after it yet. However, upon check-out the bellman and valet were very speedy. Breakfast from the hotel cafe was tasty and quickly prepared. You can order individual items which are filling and much less exensive than the buffet. The menu in the room, however, did not exactly match the menu in the restaurant. We had a Toulouse St. balcony and found the noise from Bourbon St. to be rather loud in the late evening, around 10 to 2 when the bands were playing. Each night was different as each band had their own sound level. After the bands quit it was generally quiet. We found it amuzing that the music from 2 blocks away could be heard quite clearly inside your room, but there were signs all over the hallways telling people to be quiet. I was a bit dismayed by the lack of security. No one was checked for a room key when entering the building or the elevators, even though the hotel had no open restaurant in the evening. The only thing the lobby staff seemed concerned about was making sure that you got your umbrella inside a bag within an inch of entering the building. Upon making a reservation you are told that you will be charged one nights rate to hold your room, however, they did not do this. You are also told that you must cancel your reservation 2 weeks in advance to keep your deposit. They even called us a few weeks prior to our arrival to verify our credit card to make sure they were going to be paid. ( I have never encountered that before. ) Apparently, this is just their scare tactics to keep you from canceling. The desk clerk told us that they tell that to everybody, but don't do it. ( I wish I had known this in advance, because as it turned out it really turned out to be an ordeal for us to keep this reservation. My life would have been much easier if I had known that I could have canceled. ) On our last visit to New Orleans we stayed at the Monteleone and found it to be a much nicer accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Inn on bourbon”
Reviews.Author: Tnewmark73
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel best location. wonderful staff. A+ Hotel .

Reviews.Title: “If this is what you want, it can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: squeenblue
Reviews.Content: I wanted the real experience - a hotel on Bourbon Street with a balcony. Definitely ground zero of Party Central, thankfully I'm a deep sleeper and not particularly bothered by the noise from the street; although you may not be able to hear the TV when you're trying to wind down after a full day's activity and night out on the town. The staff was patient, friendly, and accommodating; the rooms cleaner than I'd expected they'd be at this location (I expected beer swill in the stairwells and a frat party atmosphere similar to a college dorm) but was pleasantly surprised by the quiet elegance. If you want to be where the action is, it can't be beat. I suggest a courtyard room if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Worst best located hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: epole
Reviews.Content: You could actually have Bourbon St just next door to your room as this location makes college and young guys to bring their late night "parties" next to your room. Great dont you think! You dont even need to go to Bourbon St to get a sense of the partying! We stayed there (with wife and kids) on Thanksgiving weekend and had a great time in the city, but had the worst of times inside the hotel. First upon arrival, went into the hotel parking and got my vehicle in valet parking. Good, after the second day, when I didnt want to pay the $35 dollars for parking, decided to pull my car out to a public parking (half the price, by the way). Of course at the end of my trip, I got my bill and they charged 3 full days of parking, which I didnt use. Just in front of our room, we had a constant party of a group of around 5 male and female young people staying in the same room. For one night we didnt complain. But after two nights of the same issues, we contacted the Main Office and told the Manager, Alex, the problems we have encountered and his answer was, " You should get used to this in this hotel and during this long weekends, its pretty normal to get this parties inside the hotel, so theres nothing I can do", turning away from me and standing by the window looking out to Bourbon St, following the party. So next time you try and book this hotel for location, be aware, that's the only thing they have, location.... and much better that you can have the French Quarter partying just outside your room, litteraly. Thanks, Jose E Polendo

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bjm1271
Reviews.Content: It was my 4th stay at this hotel. 2 pre & 2 post Katrina. The hotel and staff are wonderful and a great location. Had an issue checking in - none of the rooms (3) were in the system but was handled quickly and professionally by the young lady at the front desk (always carry your confirmation pages). Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Housekeeping did a nice job. Rooms were on the 5th floor on Bourbon Street - yes you can hear the noise from the street at night but its not unbearable. 2 small issues we had with our stay was 1 of the 2 elevators was our of order for a couple of days and the room keys had be reset several times. FYI - doesn't matter where you kept the key - front or back pocket or even your wallet the keys just didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Halloween Trip”
Reviews.Author: Napali65
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed with this hotel. The front desk staff is friendly and accommodating; the rooms are lovely and the location can't be beat. We have been to NOLA for Halloween for 10 years and always stay at the Inn on Bourbon; will not stay anywhere else. Kudos to Jonathan, front desk staff...he's terrific This hotel has recently had an upgrade; nicely done. The cleaning crew is friendly and very accommodating to your wishes.

Reviews.Title: “Halloween on Bourbon St”
Reviews.Author: hobee
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day trip in New Orleans. We stayed at the Ramada Inn on Bourbon. We normally get a balcony room with a king bed overlooking Bourbon. This time we got the mini suite with a balcony overlooking Bourbon. The room is about 2 1/2 times larger than a regular room. Nice and roomy. Well furnished. Check out pictures that I have attached. We were there for Halloween weekend which is so much fun. Normally we go for St. Patrick's Day which is also fun. The hotel is in the heart of the French Qtr. If you want things a little less noisy you may want a courtyard room. There is a restaurant onsite which serves breakfast on the weekend and breakfast and lunch during the week. The food is fresh and good selection. Buffet style. We also went to Nola, one of Emerils restaurants. Enjoyed the dining experience. We did brunch at Begues which is in the Royal Sonesta. Unbelieveable selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: surfgirl4ever
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in the center of all the action in New Orleans. It is right on Bourbon Street near Pat Oâ€™Brienâ€™s. The room was clean and the service was good. I have stayed there in the past and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in the heart of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: rglasgow
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with this hotel. It was gorgeous, the beds were comfortable and convenient to everything! We had a balcony over the pool. I am glad we chose the balcony over the pool instead of over Bourbon St because I think it would have been too loud. Great restaurants and night life within a block of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but remember, it IS on Bourbon Street.”
Reviews.Author: hourglass8
Reviews.Content: I used the Inn on Bourbon for my out of town wedding guests, for my bridal preparations and for the wedding night. I DID get a special rate, but I think it was still higher than it could have been because the wedding was the weekend after Mardi Gras. However, the rate was still good for a Bourbon Street hotel. I often had a hard time getting someone to answer the phone at the front desk, but my wedding guests didn't report any problems. Maybe it was a fluke. The crowds were less rowdy since Mardi Gras was over, but still somewhat loud. Our suite had a balcony that overlooked Bourbon Street. We heard some late night/early morning noise, but it was not intolerable. There are rooms with balconies overlooking the courtyard as well as interior rooms, both of which are probably quieter. Of note, I also very safe while in the hotel, as well as upon entering and exiting. The hotel had just been renovated. The lobby is very pretty. The rooms were clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. The bathrooms were not as luxurious as some of the more expensive Bourbon Street hotels, but I guess that's to be expected. They were really just nice normal bathrooms. All of the staff I encountered were very pleasant and helpful. There are no microwaves in the rooms or easily accessible in the lobby/restaurant. The in-room refrigerators are not compimentary; they were $10/night. The hotel does not offer dinner in its restaurant, which is okay considering the plethora of good restaurants in the Quarter -- just something to be aware of. There is also no hotel shuttle, which made transportation from the airport a little more difficult. Hotel parking is extremely expensive, but the rate is typical for hotels in the Quarter. If you want to walk out of your hotel and experience Bourbon Street, this is a pretty nice place to stay. I would probably try some different hotels for next time for comparison, but I would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Again a wonderful stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccolor
Reviews.Content: Pros and cons of this hotel and I should say that we have stayed here for many years and have considered it our hotel-of-choice through good and bad. First for the cons - itâ€™s noisy. Suck it up - youâ€™re staying ON Bourbon Street, what do you expect? The rooms facing the courtyard are much quieter, but if Iâ€™m in New Orleans, I donâ€™t want to miss anything so a Bourbon Street balcony room it is. The best bet is to get a shared balcony - the single balconies donâ€™t have a roof over them and are small. Also the rooms used to have mini bars but were removed after Katrina - coolers are allowed in the bathrooms if you want to store perishables. Now for the good stuff. The hotel is centrally located in the Quarter so a rental car may not be needed. We had very fast check in and the front office/bell staff/housekeeping personnel were fantastic. The rooms have new furniture with very comfortable beds and pillows - balconies are clean(!). Internet access is in each room and there is a business center in the lobby for any printing that may be needed. 2-1 drink coupons for the hotel bar are also given at check in (I do miss the old coupons for one free breakfast, though) and it looks like there is fresh, cold water with mint (?) in the lobby for the taking. Ladies - the bathrooms are for us! A magnifying mirror, wonderfully thick towels, heavenly smelling shampoo/lotion, etc., great shower heads, room to lay out our â€œstuffâ€� beside the bathroom sink. I could go on and on! Will be back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mancation”
Reviews.Author: ARUBAWEDD
Reviews.Content: Our wives sprung for a "Mancation" for me and my buddy for three days in Orleans. We stayed at the Inn on Bourbon and had an all around great experiance. Room's we're clean, Staff was polite and accomodating. Only complaint was the guy at the pool that constantly gave a "WOOOOOOooooooooooo", every two seconds. But we understood where we were at, and should expect it. He was having a good time. We requested a Bourbone Street side room, after reading the reviews, thought we might want to change as the reviews said street side can be loud (lol, loud doesn't describe it). Was able to make the switch to pool side with no problems actually before we arrived. Would I stay here again, "YES".

Reviews.Title: “Get a balcony”
Reviews.Author: bedmondson
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in New Orleans and had a blast. This hotel is was in arguably the best location possible in the French Quarter (always easy to find). The rooms are clean, hotel overall is very nice with decent staff. One thing though that bothered me was that there was no complementary breakfast offered. For 2 people to eat a buffet breakfast that you serve yourself costs $40 which is kinda insane. And we never saw anybody ever actually eat the breakfast there. Also, something as simple as coffee is hard to come by in this hotel. We had to pay $6 for 2 cups of coffee each morning with no free refill. I have never stayed in a hotel before that charged their guests for something as simple as coffee. I would also recommend that you get a balcony room (either balcony) because we did not and all we had a view of was the parking lot. Great hotel but I would probably stay somewhere else close by that has a little more convince when it comes to breakfast/coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Inn on Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: ksp93
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through Hotels.com requestng King, non-smoking room from 8/7-8/11. Friends had arrived 2 days prior to us and had requested we were located relatively close to them. We arrived at the hotel around 5:30 p.m. and were immediately checked into room 428, friends were just down the hall. You could immediately tell the room had recently been renovated - fresh paint, new bedding, drapes, etc. There were 2 large windows that faced the inside courtyard with a nice view of the pool. Room was decent size, bath was nicely organized - a bit on the small size. Good lighting and good shower head! Everyone at the hotel was very friendly, from the desk to the lady in the gift shop. If you needed anything, all you had to do was ask. Beds were very comfy as were the pillows. Room was always made up in a timely manner. There was a very small, but adequate business center where you could check e-mails, print boarding passess, etc. along with an ATM machine. There was a nice restaurant (we did not eat there) and a very small lobby bar. We would stop in the evening and meet our freinds. Bartender was a bit whiney - think she was bored! Overall we really enjoyed our stay here. The location was ideal. We could not hear any outside noise, just an occasional partier returning in the early morning hours! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and decieved”
Reviews.Author: kms430
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter & I recently visited New Orleans to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. It was my 24 year old daughter's first trip to New Orleans. I booked one of the more expensive Bourbon Street Balcony rooms back in May after staying there for 2 nights at the end of April with several other couples leaving on a cruise. Let me add that we have stayed at this hotel many times in the past, usually with a group booking 3-4 rooms. One of the main things we have enjoyed at this hotel in the past is spending time on the large balconies and watching the action on Bourbon Street. At the time I booked, I requested 2 Beds with a large (shared) Bourbon balcony. At that time, there were plenty of balcony rooms available. We arrived around 1 and they sent us to a room with 1 King Bed (for 3 adults) and a small balcony. Next, after waiting about 3 hours, they sent us to the 4th floor and another room with a small balcony. We contacted the manager and waited on him for half an hour. He suggested that I had made a mistake in my request when booking, but agreed to move us to the 3rd floor to what he said was a room on one of the large balconies. I told him the large balcony was my priority. I even told him we would take a King Bed if they would provide a rollaway bed as long as it was on a large balcony. We had to move our luggage ourselves as they were too busy. It turned out to be another room with a small balcony. By that time, it was around 5:30 and we had wasted half the day waiting on rooms, waiting on the manager, and moving, so we gave up and stayed. The room had 2 bath towels for 3 people. We requested more the next day, so they gave us 3, but no bathmat. When we checked out, we called for a bell captain to get our luggage and waited for 45 minutes. Finally, we carried our own bags down. I suppose all this was punishment for complaining about our room. One good thing...the bartenders in the lobby bar were great; we spent a lot of time there waiting on our room and they were very helpful and nice. I had planned a very special family weekend and feel that The Inn on Bourbon let me down by not honoring my request. On my next trip to New Orleans, I plan to try to find a hotel where they care about what their guests want.

Reviews.Title: “Location plus renovation make for nice stay”
Reviews.Author: NegrilSalute
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in late June. My wife was there for a convention, me for fun and relaxation. The location is perfect for leisure and the convention had shuttle buses with a stop a couple short blocks away so the location worked well for her also. We booked a room with a view of the courtyard which was ready upon check in. Check in was easy as well as leaving the truck at the attached parking garage. The room being recently renovated was nice, nothing too special but a cut above an average hotel. No noise issues coming from the pool. The balcony was shared which wasn't an issue but it just seemed a little odd. Maybe would have left the door open more often if it hadn't been shared. The pool water could use better care, having a slight green tinge to it. The pool area was kept up nicely though. Maid service was very good, something very important to me. Front desk personnel were competent though not overly friendly. Most all of the other personnel were very nice. Based on previous reviews we did not eat at all at this hotel, just too many choices within walking distance. I had considered some of the older hotels with more character to them but this being mid summer I did not want to risk having a room with bad air conditioning. This hotel had a very good air conditioning system. All in all a very pleasant stay at this hotel. I would recommend it as an excellent location for partying on Bourbon St. but as mentioned it also worked very well for the convention.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant if you want to be on Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: iwficon
Reviews.Content: If you're going to New Orleans and want to be in the thick of the action on Bourbon Street, this is the best place to be. We were warned about the noise levels before we went, but we had a room that overlook the rear of the hotel rather than Bourbon Street itself and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, fun, fun!”
Reviews.Author: bluebird_j
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel right smack in the middle of the French Quarter on Bourbon Street. The rooms are kind of small, but if you're spending that much time in your room, you're doing New Orleans wrong! Get out there, stroll the French Quarter. You can walk to Canal Street from this hotel and catch the St. Charles Streetcar for $1.25, from there you can travel to the Garden District and stroll around the beautiful homes and neighborhoods. You can also walk to Jackson Square from this hotel. The location is so amazing, and New Orleans is such a fun city with so many great historic sites, you can't go wrong with this hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful, the hotel lobby is beautiful, and you literally walk right outside straight into the party. For those who complain about the noise, what in the world are you doing staying in the French Quarter if you're worried about noise? Go stay somewhere remote and quiet and then waste all your money on taxis to get you to all these great places. For the record, our room was quiet and comfortable. The bed was extremely comfortable with large pillows. The shower was a little old and moldy (just a little, some others might not notice, but I'm picky about such things), but nothing too gross. The hotel offers valet parking as well. Beautiful, classy, you can walk everywhere you want to go! Lots of great food within walking distance as well.

Reviews.Title: “They saved our weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Love-It-or-Leave-It
Reviews.Content: First of all, we had reservations at another place in the French Quarter, but it ended up being horrible (see Hotel St. Pierre review). I called the Ramada Inn on Bourbon and got an empathetic yet professional lady on the line. She held a corner suite for us. We got there, and even the parking attendant knew we were coming. The whole place was spotless, elegantly decorated, and our room was clean and quiet. Our fun weekend in the Crescent City was saved! On top of that, the rate was $30 a night cheaper than the roach motel. I cannot say enough good things about this place! Thank you, Joyce at Ramada Inn on Bourbon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Bad Food - Call For Directions After 5:00 p.m.”
Reviews.Author: bcs2008
Reviews.Content: We stopped over for one night decided to stay on Bourbon street for fun, great location and nice hotel for being 200 years old. Rooms are small so if you need to move around in your room find a bigger hotel. This hotel gives you the spirit of New Orleans even though Bourbon Street has turned into a Red Light District. Everything was great except the food. DO NOT EAT AT THE HOTEL!!! The food is really expensive and really bad...you can get better food at a truck stop. Also if you get there after 7:00 p.m. call ahead to get directions to the parking garage, they block off Bourbon street and there really is no direct way to the hotel and a GPS gets you more lost because of all the one way streets. But overall we had a great time and it was a fun night and we really enjoyed Bourbon Street - without Mardi Gras crowds but with that Mardi Gras feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: summerlover30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn on Bourbon for three nights and we were satisfied with this choice. We thought about staying in one of the five star luxurious hotels but we wanted to be in the middle of the action to get the feel of the real deal. We were so happy that we did! The location can't be beat. Everything is close including the areas off Bourbon. We did not rent a car and that was one of the smartest choices we made as everything is walking distance and parking is impossible. The hotel itself was very nice. The lobby had the southern charm and was charming. I was pleasantly surprised by the room since I read the negative Trip Advisor's reviews. Everything was clean and satisfactory. Upon checking in, we asked for a free upgrade to a balcony room. The front desk gave us exactly what we asked for....a balcony overlooking the pool on a higher level. We slept fine at night...no noise at all. The pool courtyard was small and was under construction for the days we were there. We could still use the pool but it was bothersome since they were using jackhammers. We really didn't run into too many drunk party animals in this hotel which was surprising since we were right on Bourbon. Security at the entrance checks your key at night before entering. (I was very happy with that.) My main concern was staying safe and I felt safe the entire trip. All in all, we had a great trip and I would recommend this hotel. The one thing I wouldn't recommend is the room service. Our first night we got po-boys and they were basically turkey sandwiches on white bread. The room service menu was very average. Great time and plan on returning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: pcbtmmgr
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in August and was alone. This was my first trip to New Orleans and I really didn't know what to expect. I loved where it was located if I wanted to party, but I just needed one night of sleep and I didn't get that. I would love to go back with my husband and stay there to go out to Bourbon St., but I wouldn't go by myself. The hotel was very charming and fit the Bourbon St. image. It is built into a square with the center open. There is a pool right in the center with a beautiful garden built around it with tables. There were a couple of shops and a bar/restaurant on site, but I didn't have time to enjoy either one. I had a King room with a window that faced Bourbon St. It was a very small room, but comfy. Everything was nice in the room, however you could tell that it was well worn. But for a one night stay, it was fine. There is one major complaint, but it was handled properly by the staff. There was a door for adjoining rooms with a lock on my side. About 5am, I was awakened by the sound of the door trying to be opened. Me being by myself, I just yelled for them to stop, but they didn't. I called down to the front desk and they sent someone up to that room. I didn't hear it anymore, so I figured they just warned them and that was it. When I checked out later that morning, the front desk clerk informed me that they had taken care of the problem and made them leave. She told me that the security of their guests were priority and that made me feel good. My only other complaint is how expensive the parking is, but that is at just about every hotel in New Orleans. Once I got parked, I just took a taxi where I needed to go. But don't expect if you take a taxi late in the evening, for them to let you out at the front of the hotel. Bourbon St. is basically closed off except for the side streets that cross over. Once I got back that night, I had to walk about a block through the streets with people partying. I didn't mind, but I wished I had someone with me. I would go back as long as I had my hubby with me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndianaEnglish
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first vacation in New Orleans. We chose the Inn on Bourbon because of its location and the good reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel has just undergone an extensive and complete renovation so everything was brand new. That makes the comment in another person's review that the carpet and bedding were worn and shabby very odd. I guess they must have missed the room he stayed in. He also mentioned that Big Daddy's (a strip club) was right below his balcony. This is a very deceiving comment because Bid Daddy's is actually across the street, right beneath his balcony is the first floor of the hotel. We also had a balcony room, but ours was on the inside by the courtyard as we did not want to take a chance on noise from the street bothering us once we turned in for the night. In truth we actually did not use the balcony very much but would pay extra for the balcony room again as these are the only rooms that are smoking. So unless you smoke or think you might actually spend time sitting on a balcony save the extra money and get an inside room. The rooms were very nice. As far as size goes they were standard and the bathroom was a little small but very nice and very clean. We never heard any noise from the adjoining rooms but did hear some from guests yelling the hallways. That of course is the fault of the guests, not the hotel. We did not eat in the restaurant or drink in the bar so I cannot comment on those things, but I can say that the bar was almost always empty. But why would you drink in a hotel bar when right outside the door are many bars to chose from all with live entertainment. I felt that the hotel was very pretty and did not look old at all. We walked from the lobby all the way to the gift shop at the end and everything was pretty and brand new. The service was for the most part very good. The only complaint we had was that the pool deck was still being worked on and maintenance refused to clean the pool after the workman left for the day. Shouldn't a pool be cleaned daily anyway? Understandably there was dirt and concrete in the pool from the workmen, so as they refused to clean it you could not use it, unless you wanted to swim in a dirty pool and take the chance of stepping on concrete. We requested everyday that they clean it so it could be used but it was never done. That is until Friday when the guests for a weekend wedding arrived and the pool was cleaned so they could use it. I guess their satisfaction was more important than ours. That was the day we were leaving so out of five days we only were able to use the pool once. When we made our reservations we were not told that the pool would not be able to be used. We were actually told that by the time we arrived the renovations at the hotel would be complete. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The problem with the pool was the only complaint and will not be an issue the next time we go as the work should be done in about a week. If you plan to party on Bourbon Street this is the perfect location to stay. It is just about in the middle of all the action and you don't have to figure out how to get back to your hotel after a night of partying as it is right there. Also at night when you return to the hotel you have to present you room key to the security guard at the door to be allowed in, so there are no strange people rooming around the hotel. We hope to return to New Orleans in a couple of years and will be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: Okay, the main attraction of this hotel is the location. Right on Bourbon so you can go outside the front door and be at a bar in minutes. I wanted to experience what it was like to have a balcony right on Bourbon and I'm glad I did get to try it. I can tell you it's over-rated. Low-quality strip club, Big Daddy's was right below my balcony and you get to hear the old man in front yelling all night long. The room itself was dated. Very worn carpeting, bedspreads, etc. The bathroom was small but not bad. I could hear every conversation from my neighbor's bathroom though. The TV was decent along with the decor. I wouldn't pay more than $100/night to stay here though.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: WCS1961
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough. Very convenient. Room faced Toulouse and could hear a lot of the noise from Bourbon; but, once you closed the insulated drapes it blocked a lot of the noise - that along with the air conditioner running helped a lot. TV worked but remote didn't - that was annoying but luckily wasn't spending too much time watching tv. Beds were just okay but i also had a problem with housekeeping leaving towels. I hung my towels up to be "green" which meant i would re-use them but they took them and didn't leave any new?? Pool area seemed really nice - wish i could have spent a little time out there. I did have a balcony off my room which was nice but mine was shared with the room next door so they can see in your room or come to your door which is a little uncomfortable for a girl traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “6th Visit”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann B
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th time at this hotel. We are well aware of the noise level so we bring ear plugs when finally do decide to retire for the evening. We always reserve a Bourbon Balcony room and never had any regrets. Just be advised that you do share the balcony with the rooms in your sector and some guests just have no balcony ettiquette. IE..they try to take over the table right in front of your room or leave lots of uneccessay TRASH laying around instead of using the trash cans. As for the staff, they have always been very polite. The rooms always very clean. This is the Heart of NOLA and we LOVE it and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: mcd63
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel. We had a balcony on Bourbon Street. This is not for everyone, but we enjoyed it a lot. I noticed someone else commenting about not having access to the balcony. That is because some people pay a premium for this amenity. They are open so that everyone else who has a balcony can walk past your room, but it is good that anyone staying at the hotel can't do that. You are right in the middle of things, which I really like. I had breakfast at the buffet. I thought it was way overpriced and not all that good and the variety wasn't very extensive. You can get way better food in New Orleans. I walked out by the pool which seemed nice, but did not get the chance to relax out there. The room was decent sized and very clean, although the bathroom was a little small. The bed was comfortable, although the pillows were too big for my taste. My only real comments/complaints: Housekeeping was not very consistent. Sometimes they would give you soap and towels, sometimes, not. Also, we had to get our keys reprogrammed several times which got kind of annoying. There was only one computer in the Business Center. There was a sign that said the printer was out of ink, but it actually worked fine. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best French Quarter Location Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: malycat
Reviews.Content: What can I say but a perfect stay at a perfect hotel? This Ramada Plaza sits right on the world famous Bourbon Street. It is perfect to just walk out of the lobby of the hotel right in the middle of all the sites and action of the French Quarter. I was able to park my car at the hotel with in and out privileges at no extra charge. The hotel has a great breakfast with Starbucks Coffee and a quiet private outdoor pool in a courtyard. Sweet!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYBronxbabe
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to the French Quarter and once I entered the hotel, I never regretted my decision. The hotel is in the perfect location, as far as being in the thick of everything. The rooms are overlooking Bourbon Street and/or Toulouse. You couldn't ask for a more perfect location. Don't stay at this hotel if you want peace and quiet. There is a live music bar and two clubs directly across from it that plays music all day and night until 3 a.m. and if you're on a lower floor, it sounds as if they are in your room. But, this is what I wanted -- to get the full effect of Bourbon Street all day and night. The only complaint is that they were doing construction during the day when we were trying to nap. Otherwise, it's GRRREAT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the thick of the action but damn noisy”
Reviews.Author: yazzman13
Reviews.Content: I cannot criticise the hotel in terms of layout and cleanliness at all. It is a nice hotel. The location is both a blessing and a curse. It is slap bang in the middle of Bourbon Street so its a drunken stumble back to your room. However if you get a room with a balcony you are guaranteed LOUD noise until the very early hours. This is fine if you are too hammered to notice. Not so good when you are hung over. In hindsight I would pick a hotel a few blocks from the action. Perfectly safe to walk around the French Quarter so don't worry about that, and then you dont have to worry about the infernal racket..

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat once the renovation is complete.”
Reviews.Author: thug_buster245
Reviews.Content: Please don't be discouraged by my title from booking your reservation right now at this wonderful hotel; the place is absolutely fabulous! The location in the French Quarter can't be beat. They have they most pleasurable and attentive housekeeping staff, front desk personel, valet staff, and Ryan the bartender "ROCKS"!! You take care of Ryan, and he'll have you feeling "right" before you even leave the comfort of the hotel on your journey down Bourbon. I was impressed at how well the staff watched at night to see who was coming and going that way unregistered drunk stragglers couldn't just walk in. My only gripe was that I swear the construction crew doesn't even take a lunch break! Oh, and they have everything from drills to jack-hammers that they love to use. This usually started daily around 9:00AM and would end around 6:00PM (precious sleeping time if your recouperating from a hangover or simply trying to take a nap so that you can go out that night). I read the reviews prior to booking and knew that the hotel was renovating, so I can't complain and didn't. I feel that the very reasonable rate I paid for my room along with the great service I received from everybody well made up for the noise. Just be warned: GREAT HOTEL / OUTSTANDING SERVICE (would stay there again in a minute) / RATHER NOISEY (at least until the renovating is complete). *THEY WILL GO OUT OF THEIR WAY TO MAKE YOU HAPPY AND MINIMIZE THE NOISE PROBLEM AS MUCH AS THEY CAN*

Reviews.Title: “Great location to party”
Reviews.Author: Figarella
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights as part of my 50th B-day celebrations. Hotel is in the center of things. Easy walking distance to Cafe Du Monde and Canal St. You ARE in the middle of things, and that means you'll hear the band (we were on a Suite overlooking Bourbon St.) until they stop playing. Ces't La vie, ces't le Boun temps. Staff was excellent, rooms were fine, especially for the rates. Security was excellent, and staff only allows you in at night after showing your room key. In short, staying here allows you to maximize your NOLA experience. And as the Concierge suggested, if you want to help the people of NOLA, come here, spend some money. If we did not have NOLA, we'd have to invent it!

Reviews.Title: “ok, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: academic81
Reviews.Content: Got a 50% deal on expedia, stayed 2 nights, Room 335 . Room was quite large, reasonably clean, staff was friendly but a bit pretentious. No complimentary breakfast. Had some trouble hooking up to the wifi, but after half an hour on the phone with the hotline, and setting fixed IP etc, it worked like a charm. There was some construction work going on, i.e. noise in the morning and the room looked over a parking lot. Almost no water pressure in the bathroom. Also (minor detail) no place to hang towels or trash bin in the bathroom. So generally a nice hotel, but not too well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: brarenee
Reviews.Content: The room was great with a great balcony view.Room was very clean. We had a smoking room, and I was suprised that the room did not smell "smokey" when we walked in. Staff was friendly and knowlegeable about New Orleans area. There were only two things that were a little, and I do mean, a little aggrivating, was the hot water takes forever to get hot, and the water pressure was very very slow. #2 I called and asked for some sugar for my husbands morning tea, and it took a pretty long while, so I had to go downstairs and get it mysef ,but I did meet roomservice in the elevator with my sugar. But like I said... those two things are not anything to stress over, and we would definately stay there again. It was a great experience...

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: junbuhg
Reviews.Content: My two best friends (who had never been to New Orleans) and I went for my 30th birthday. We wanted to spend most of our time in and around the French Quarter, but didn't want anything super extravagant. We found a wonderful package deal for a double room @ the Inn. We got there before the 4pm check in, but our room was ready and we were able to store our bags in our room before heading out to explore. Our reservation promised a balcony, and we got one, but it was smaller than we expected. Still, we didn't go to New Orleans to hang out in the hotel room all day and the small-ish balcony didn't stop us from having fun. The Inn is in a perfect location. You can easily walk up and down Bourbon Street and the neighboring streets without getting lost. All the folks we met were very friendly and we always felt very safe. When we returned late at night, we were required to show our room keys for entry back into the hotel. When we wanted to sleep, we simply closed the doors to the balcony and knocked out...I don't remember hearing anything from the streets below (we were on the 4th floor). We were pleasantly surprised by a call from the front desk one evening, asking us how we were enjoying our stay. My friend happened to mention my birthday and, shortly thereafter, there was a knock on the door. The front desk had sent up a complimentary bottle of red wine to celebrate! It was a nice surprise. Check in/check out was probably one of the easiest I've ever experienced. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms, while a little dated and probably smaller than some would expect, were extremely clean. I plan on staying here again next time we visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Each stay has been great!”
Reviews.Author: Cram0120
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel approximately 10 times over the past 6-7 years. I find it to be a great hotel, although it has gotten a bit pricey over the years. The rooms are clean, the staff helpful, and the location is amazing. That being said. This hotel is definitely worth the money as long as you understand what you are in for in terms of the location. It is right on the corner of Bourbon and Toulouse, which is literally in the center of the french quarter. You will be right across from numerous bars, clubs, and strip joints, it will be loud outside, and you may get a little noise in your room depending where it is in the hotel. If you are a family with young children, then you might pay some heed to those who would choose not to stay here. However, if you are with an adult group and need a clean, safe, and higher class place to stay with many conveniences, then I would recommend no other place. Your vehicle will be safe in their lot (28 bucks a day, but you won't have any worries, and probably won't use the car at all while you are there). You can walk everywhere, and the stumble home (if that is your thing) is easy. Great hotel overall for people who want a full time Bourbon St experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly noisy”
Reviews.Author: KarLLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Inn on Bourbon for 4 nights. For everyone who has not been in New Orleans before, Bourbon st is full of bars with incredibly loud music and numerous drunk tourists walking along the street holding beers. It is almost impossible to sleep between 5 in the afternoon and 5 in the morning. The hotel itself is ok (although definitely not unique), but if we were aware of the surroundings we 'd definitely avoided it.

Reviews.Title: “Want to party on Bourbon Street?”
Reviews.Author: kris504
Reviews.Content: Location location location. If you are looking to party on Bourbon Street, this is the place to stay. The lobby is beautifully decorated with antique furniture. Friendly staff and prompt service to any requests.(We needed maintenance to our toilet once and more towels) They serve a breakfast buffet for $12. The rooms are the smallest I have ever seen but very clean. They have rooms with a balcony that I didnt see but would like to next time. We were on the other side which was probably a lot quieter. This hotel is definetly an extention of Bourbon with loud hallways at night and we even went to the room when we had to use the restroom, how convenient! I am from the area but would love to stay there again so there are no worries about driving after drinking. The pool was located in a courtyard and looked simple but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: nawtycf
Reviews.Content: We arrive and had reserved a bourbon balcony room on the 3rd floor.We were charged an additional 500 dollars for 4 nights for our room(which was on the 4th floor).Front desk employees very rude and told us that all we can do.We will move you in the morning.After waiting untill 5pm,we were in our new room,that had a girl in the shower in it(very uncomfortable for all!).The front desk and the manager acted like we were inconveniecing them!They never apologized!They kicked her out of the room in front of us,(uncomforable for all of us)and said they would send housekeeping...we waited for an additional hour.They never came untill morning!We also kept getiing locked out of our room.We must have had to go to the front desk at least 5 times in our 4 night stay.Abolutely the worst hotel stay and customer service I have ever experienced!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and in the heart of Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: twinzmomie
Reviews.Content: Actually found the hotel on this site and based on recommendations and pictures booked it through their rewards site.. went for our anniversary, and had a wonderful time. the booking agent suggested a balcony on toulouse due to wanting a romantic weekend (good advice) would love to get the balcony on bourbon next time if we went with others. the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. there were 3 bachelor parties going on the weekend we stayed and they handled them with ease. the noise is definitely a factor being so close to bourbon street but we didnt mind. i highly recommend this hotel, and the rate was fabulous ($169) but if you are looking for peace and quiet you might want to look elsewhere. Room was clean and the housekeeping staff kept us laughing!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: AlexBalham
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very centrally located. Immediate access to all the bars and nightlife on Bourbon St. We had a courtyard room and I was disturbed my noise from the street or other late night guests coming back. The pool is a good size. We didn't have the breakfast, preferring to head out to Cafe du Monde and Brennans (both v nearby). I'd recommend it if you want somewhere central to stay. Bourbon Street (especially on Saturday night) is more raucous than jazz in parts and some of the nearby bars offer topless or nude dancing, which may offend some, but then don't stay on Bourbon St at all....

Reviews.Title: “Not for Everyone.”
Reviews.Author: BPC73
Reviews.Content: If you have visions of lounging out on your Bourbon St. balcony and soaking up that sweet New Orleans jazz, don't stay at the Ramada Inn on Bourbon! Go at least a couple of blocks south. On the other hand, if you like catching-up on the latest rap & hip-hop karoke performed by very intoxicated patrons, blaring out of a so called rythm & blues bar (@ Club 544), then you will absolutely love this place. I also had several problems with the rooms interior, as the carpet was filthy (complete with several spilled drink stains), the non-smoking room sure didn't smell that way (no doubt caused by people constantly smoking on the balcony with the door wide open) and I had problems getting the A/C to sufficiently cool. After paying $257 dollars (parking included) for one night in a room I couldn't stand to be in, I just thought I would add this review. I realize that this has to be a challenging room to keep clean and I really don't blame Ramada. I'm not sure how one would steam clean carpets every other day and have the room dry for the next patrons in a matter of hours. If you kept the standards too high you would more than likely have to constantly cancel reservations due to room issues. These conditions just go with the territory I'm afraid. Just want others to know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!! Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melis_26
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay! We loved every minute! We were within a few blocks of Decatur street, the market and Cafe Du Mode, we liked the bars on Decatur better than Boubon St. They were quieter and more our speed. Still easy walk from our hotel. Straight down Talouse was a great seafood place Kokoos, try it. Right around the corner from a ton of bars on Talouse, Yo mamas, Pat O'Briens, lots of little places with great food, good drink prices, and great staff. We ate at the Cajun cabin right next door, very good chicken pasta, on the balcony. We did spend a little time at the pool getting drinks from the hotel, it was very nice. My only Complaint would be that we stayed right on Bourbon and altough we knew it would be loud we had no idea!!! Saturday night it was like sleeping in the bar.. boom, boom, boom.. and we did our best to pass out! But.. Sunday and on things were much better. The hotel was clean, nice, great location, staff friendly, Bath and Body soap shampoo and lotion, rooms cleaned every day, nice lobby to sit in and wait to go to the airport and the bed was comfy. For the location and price this hotel can not be beat... I would say you have to be very picky to not like this hotel. We came to enjoy the French Quarter and we did. The hotel was great, location was great, it was in the middle of the bars on Bourbon street. Either way we went we had a ton of action to choose from and a ton of places to eat and drink and a short walk home.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: JPinOH
Reviews.Content: With this hotel you are paying for location. Right in the heart of the quarter on Rue Bourbon at Tooluse. Literally the exact center of the bars on Bourbon (541 Bourbon, the bars run from 100 thru 900). I have stayed here everytime I go to NOLA for Mardi Gras or Southern Decadence. The only problem I ever had was when I booked a package through priceline and they didn't inform the hotel that I had already paid, front desk took care of this in a matter of minutes. Security is tight. The rooms a little small but, if you are going to NOLA to be on Bourbon St you won't spend much time in your room except to sleep. Housekeeping staff is very friendly and non-intrusive. The rooms can be loud if on the exterior if this is a problem book a courtyard room it cuts the noise in half. A great thing they offered during Mardi Gras was that you could have guests. You have to sign them in and they get a wristband so they can get in the hotel. This is GREAT if like me you have friends around the area that you want to meet up with while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel right in the heart of Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: Ocnsunsets
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel on the inside and out. The staff was wonderful, the location was great, the price for the room was right on par - I would highly recommend this hotel for first timers or repeat visitors. We had an inside room and were not bothered at all by the Bourbon Street noise. It is a party town and I am sure if we had a balcony room, we wouldve been up all night (or atleast until the party died) - we're beyond the party scene (ages 39, 64 and 67) and because of others suggestions on this site, I knew to request an interior room. We also did not run into any of the other problems mentioned (rude employees etc) by previous posters on this site. Stay here - you wont be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great for night owls”
Reviews.Author: wendigo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with 2 other couples, booked rooms at The Inn on Bourbon the weekend of July 18 for a special birthday weekend celebration. My husband and I were able to use some credit card reward points for the room, which is how we selected the property, while our friends booked through the hotel directly. They reported they got very reasonable rates. One of the couples got a balcony room, overlooking Toulouse. The other couple had a standard room with window over Toulouse, and my husband and I were on the front of the hotel, directly over Bourbon Street. Basically, if you look at the picture of the hotel on the web site, we had the tiny windows right over the flags. :-) I was pleased on check-in to find we had a non-smoking room. I had requested this, but because we were using points it was not guaranteed. I was slightly surprised that we had a room overlooking Bourbon Street, which seems a premium spot, but guess it isn't as popular because of the noise factor. And it was LOUD. But we expected this, so no worries there. The staff was very pleasant on check-in and even allowed us to unload our cars at curbside where we pulled up on Bourbon, even though they aren't really supposed to ... shhh! and directed us how to pull around to the parking deck. The bellman was great - wonderful personality! The balcony room wasn't ready yet, so he brought our friends' bags to our room and then came back to switch them over later when their room was ready. Our room was on the third floor. The elevators had a persistent odor of natural gas throughout the weekend that led us to fear they would blow up, but no problems. The room was pretty small and looked worn. The bed was a bit saggy. There were 2 small windows with 2 wing chairs and a little table between them. Everything was clean. The bathroom was fine, with a marble vanity and nice toiletries from Bath & Body Works. The shower had good water pressure and temperature. Again, everything seems well-worn, not just because of the historic location, but more likely because it's a popular party hotel. But again, very clean, no complaints. The rooms are LOUD. Especially ours that overlooked Bourbon directly. The party started at 1 p.m. and continued literally all night, until 4 or 5 a.m. At that point, the trash department came around and started dumping the dumpsters. We stayed out pretty late most nights, so it wasn't that big a deal to us. You definitely should request a courtyard room if this is going to be a problem. However, in addition to the street noise, we found the noise inside the hotel to be loud as well. The walls were paper thin. Our first morning, around 5 a.m. after listening to the revelry all night and adjusting, our neighbors came home to find one had suffered a house fire. We were treated to the resulting screaming, crying, and hysterical phone calls for the next two hours. It was like they were in our room. We understood, but even normal conversation is practically full volume. Also, the crack under the main door to the room was at least an inch high. No barrier there. Very odd. We did not eat at the restaurant, but sat at the bar in the lobby a couple times. Unremarkable and tucked behind a wall so you'd never know it's there unless you looked. We didn't use the pool but it looked nice and there were always people out there during this hot season in New Orleans. Overall, we had a nice stay here. It's definitely not an upscale property, but everything seems to be reasonably well maintained. I think the beds could use an upgrade, if the one in our room was any indication. The staff was friendly. As other posters have mentioned, they had good security, requiring us to show our room keys to enter the lobby at night. Nice decor in the lobby. I would recommend this hotel for its central location if you'd like to be in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned charm and service”
Reviews.Author: NJMommy0218
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Inn on Bourbon while we attended a friend's wedding. We had a wonderful experience. I was a little worried at first because we already had this trip booked when we stayed at another Ramada hotel (Hazleton, PA) which was not so great, but the Inn on Bourbon is not your typical Ramada. The building is converted from an old French opera house. The lobby is beautiful and luxurious. Our room was an average sized room with 2 double beds (the hotel was full and there were no king rooms left). The room was clean, the beds were comfy, the bathroom was not huge, but bigger than most hotel bathrooms I've experienced. On the first day, we noticed the tub was draining slowly. We notified the front desk on our way out to breakfast and it was fixed by the time we returned. Our room faced Toulouse St., so we could hear the band at the bar next door starting at 1PM and going non-stop through the night every night, but we didn't mind much because we were out on Bourbon St. partying until about 4AM every night. If you want to sleep, the interior rooms have balconies over the courtyard area with the pool, but the hotel fills up fast and there is no guarantee you'll get one of those rooms. The priciest rooms have balconies over Bourbon St. The courtyard and pool are very nice and well maintained. A waiter will bring cocktails and food poolside. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is on one of the busiest corners on Bourbon Street. Security is pretty tight in the evening. There is a security guard at the door, and you must show a room key to enter. This hotel is for people that want to party and be in the center of the action. There is a topless bar directly across the street. If that sort of thing bothers you, stay elsewhere. But if you want great service and a thrilling Bourbon St experience, I definitely recommend the Inn on Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “We probably wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Fyre
Reviews.Content: This was not the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, but it certainly is not a hotel I'd stay in again. The good: Some of the staff were quite wonderful and went out of their way to be helpful, friendly and make our stay wonderful. They have a great bell captain, and bell staff, nice parking attendants, and a kind, gracious and charming concierge. That said, this is a hotel that seems to have housekeeping issues. We changed rooms because our room's air conditioning did not work. Yet my sisters room was freezing. The room we changed into was not that cool, either, but it was bearable. We were there for our wedding. It took my husband asking the desk 3 times before they changed our room. We asked the first time on Thursday, and they didn't address it til Friday evening, just when I had to change to get pictures taken. They didn't offer to move us, or even make any suggestions to help. The reservation staff was not helpful at all. The pool was nice. The location was nice. We didn't hear much noise, but you can hear a little even from the back of the hotel when people are partying on Bourbon. However, it didn't trouble us. We were there from Thursday til Monday. Our room wasn't made up one day at all-the girl came up on our wedding night when we were changing for dinner and asked us if we wanted our room made up. She looked so tired and we had seen her there that morning. We told her to forget it, as it was already late. She looked grateful. While some of the staff were nice, to be honest, I wouldn't really consider this place again. There are nicer properties, and I doubt they will hurt for my business. The place was busy when we were there. However, I would give the Prince Conti, the Iberville Suites, the Monteleone, or the Royal Sonesta...all we've either stayed at or had friends and family stay at and had good stays a shake before returning to the Inn on Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Inn On The Bourbon-Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kookookajoob
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at The Ramada Inn on Bourbon for only two nights. Iâ€™m wishing we could have stayed longer, this was my first trip to New Orleans, The French Quarter. I want to go back and when I do, I will be staying at this hotel. The rooms were wonderful and comfortable, the staff was very helpful and courteous. Expedia.com messed up our room and didnâ€™t book us the smoking room we had thought was reserved for us. Though that room was not available for us on the day we arrived, Jonathon, the Desk Clerk at the time, reserved us a room for the following day, without charging us the additional costs involved. Now thatâ€™s what I call going the distance for customer satisfaction! People who actually complain about noise are quite silly actually. What did you expect? You ARE on Bourbon Street, after all. Did you really think drunk and goofy people would be quiet as church mice? lol And, as many suggest, just turn up the fan on the A/C, easily done. One thing that I truly appreciated was the extra security late at night. Hotel staff ask that all people entering the hotel produce their room keys before entering the hotel. This certainly made me feel safe. I have no complaints about The Ramada Inn on Bourbon Street at all and would highly recommend this Hotel to everyone and anyone planning a stay on Bourbon Street. Jackie-Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Elllie_Mae
Reviews.Content: I loved the Inn on Bourbon! The location was right in the middle of everything- short walk to tours, shopping, and great food. We had a courtyard view balcony room (perfect for smokers) and had no problems. The pool was amazing. I travel extensively for work and have stayed in a lot of hotels and would definitely recommend this hotel. With that said, I am by no means a "picky" traveler- we didn't have housekeeping in our room once, we just traded out our towels, trash and sheets daily. I personally would rather take the 2 minutes and do it myself rather than have strangers raiding through my stuff while I'm gone. Also, the only contact I had with the front desk was check- in and that was my only problem- the front desk guy was very standoffish and it was like we were a "bother" to him. I highly suggest booking on the company website, it was the cheapest I'd found. All in all a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Heart”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgent12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the best hotel ever, but it is for Bourbon Street location. I brought my fiancÃ©e for his 30th birthday from 28may08 - 02jul08. It is right in the middle of all of the night clubs. It is loud if you are staying on Bourbon. We had a room on the side street Toulouse. We could hear the noise on the street but with the balcony doors shut we had no problem sleeping. If you're here to sleep, stay in the Garden District. There is a convenience store around the corner on Toulouse that is the cheapest bet for the area. Get drinks there to start and walk up and down the strip. The hotel is also perfect for discovering the sites/museums of the French Quarter. I paid cash when I arrived and received no extra charges on my credit card. The front desk staff was friendly enough. They didn't go out of their way with warmth but if you needed help they would help. Don't forget to tip. You will learn that tips are accepted everywhere. We didn't use the maid service so we can't comment on that. When we arrived, our room was clean. We didnâ€™t see bugs anywhere around the hotel. We also didn't eat there because New Orleans has way better restaurants. Enjoy the location, and the clean environment. New Orleans is wonderful. Iâ€™ve been three times and canâ€™t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Smack dab in the middle of the action!”
Reviews.Author: tattooedbears
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn on Bourbon from June 12-16. It is a perfect location and very central to everything. I must agree if your interested in sleeping it is not for you. I didn't plan on sleeping so it was perfect. Housekeeping could use a better system. We seemed to get "missed" and had to ask that paper and towels be brought up to us. Not a big deal, we just did a quick tidy. The air conditioning wasn't all that great, but they were quick to come check it out for us. The hotel was booked solid and we could not be moved but we werereinbursed some of our bill due to the problems. The staff were nice and accomidating, overall it was a great stay. I am looking forward to staying at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Night Owls!!”
Reviews.Author: MississippiSpirit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple each stayed in a standard king room for the weekend. The location of the hotel was wonderful - right on Bourbon Street in the middle of the French Quarter. Our rooms were on the 4th floor just above the balcony rooms that look out Bourbon street. Do NOT expect peace and quiet all night. There are lots of people coming and going all night long and since we also got in late every night the hotel was great. A trick our friends discovered for a little more quiet (the bar across the street is not quiet until around 3 or 4 in the morning) is turn the a/c fan on high. It really muffled the street noise. The a/c wasn't as cool as we had hoped, but it was really hot already for June. Since we are from South MS we are a little more tolerant of this situation. The staff was friendly, accommodating our request to be on the same floor as our friends. The room was clean overall and the bed was very comfortable even for my husband who is a big guy. The lobby is really nice and is a comfortable place to sit and drink a Hurricane from Pat O'Brien's. One disappointment- no 'fridge or microwave.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bradford72
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay in the French Quarter! The location...if you want to stay in the middle of all the action...can't be beat. The staff, especially Larry the concierge, was beyond excellent. Larry was as genuine as can be, and really helped us settle in for our stay. The front desk staff was also very pleasant. I had booked the cheapest room available, figuring we weren't going to be staying indoors much anyway. When the girl at the front desk saw which room I had booked, she insisted on upgrading us to a larger room for free. She stated the room I had booked was very small, and she knew we would not be comfortable in it. She didn't have to do that, but she went out of her way and it made our stay that much better. As for the room, it was perfect for a three-night visit. We had plenty of room to move around, it was clean and in good repair, and the bed was probably one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. We didn't dine in the hotel (except for a bagel in the morning), but we did take advantage of the pool area one afternoon. So relaxing! There were only a couple other people out there, and we were able to truly relax and enjoy the facilities. If you stay here, you must spend a little time relaxing by the pool! I would highly recomment the Inn on Bourbon to anyone staying in New Orleans. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “charged me for someone else's mess!”
Reviews.Author: bjhayden
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine until the charge cleared my banking account. They charged me an additional $75 for deep cleaning. There was an obnoxiously large, bright red stain at the foot of the bed, and my friend noticed it upon arrival. He even commented on the mess. We dismissed it, and continued our vacation. We spent a minimal amount of time in the room, and absolutely had nothing to do with a stain. I spoke to multiple clerks and they told me that I made the mess. I did nothing to mess up that hotel room, and I refuse to have someone tell me that I did...WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: YDoUSmell
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights, and I'd have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. If you want to be in the middle of all the action of the French Quarter, then this is it. Since it is located right on Bourbon Street, it can get a bit noisy- so if you want to go to bed anytime before 4 a.m., I'd suggest that you request a courtyard room. The rooms facing the street, however, have a balcony, which would have been nice. We didn't spend much time in the room, so we didn't really care. The hotel itself is beautiful, and the staff were accomodating. We got there before the room was ready, and they offered to hold our luggage there so we could walk around and explore until our room was ready. The only negative things I could say were that we requested a king bed and were given two doubles instead. Also, even though we couldn't hear any noise from the street, we could hear housekeeping every single morning, as well as any other noises in the hallways outside of the rooms. Other than that, the overal stay was excellent. Great location, clean rooms, good service. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Inn on Bourbon!”
Reviews.Author: okcmenace
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay in the French Quarter. We have family in New Orleans, but decided to experience the ambience of the French Quarter on this trip. The hotel was first class. They had a beautiful lobby and a breathtaking inner courtyard which included the pool area. We stayed on the fifth floor and while we did hear the music from Bourbon Street in the evenings, that's part of the ambience and it wasn't so overwhelming that we couldn't sleep. The beds were very comfortable and we had four pillows on each bed that were bigger and fluffier than the ones I have on my own bed! The towels were soft and housekeeping was extremely efficient. I agree with other reviews and skip the hotel breakfast buffet and go to the Cafe Pontalba, just a few blocks away and opens right on to Jackson Square! You can't beat the location and the accomodations were outstanding and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “So much more than expected”
Reviews.Author: mrsrothtravels
Reviews.Content: The Inn on Bourbon is a fantastic value for the New Orleans visitor. Located directly on Bourbon Street, almost in the middle of the Quarter the location is really excellent. We planned this trip for my 40th birthday and my friend suggested the Inn on Bourbon as she has stayed there before.
