My first choice was the Royal Sonesta (the best in the Quarter if you ask me) however their rates were almost double that of the Inn. I have had some really unpleasant experiences with Ramada and so I was reticent but..after all, a bad day in New Orleans is still better than a good day anywhere else so I decided to book it. First off, this property is no ordinary Ramada, it's a Ramada Plaza, the brand's high end. It was a lovely old building, well maintained with every amenity you could ask for in a reasonably priced hotel. There is a breakfast restaurant (skip it and go either to Brennan's for a blowout or try Petunia's around the corner, fantastic food for breakfast lunch and dinner with great prices all day long. Go early, the lines get crazy). There is a little bar in the lobby which is often closed but you're on Bourbon so who cares?! The staff could not have been more outgoing, attentive or professional. They couldn't do enough for us and even upgraded us to a balcony room in honor of my birthday. The most shocking thing is the tranquility within the hotel itself. The doors must be made of magic because once they close you can barely hear any Bourbon street noise in the lobby. Our room had a balcony facing the interior courtyard which houses the pool. Really beautiful and tranquil. The rooms were large and well appointed and very, very clean. The perfect place to rest after a long hard day of boozing, dancing and eating to excess or as they say in New Orleans-an average Monday.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: msu311girl
Reviews.Content: We got this room way cheaper than it should have been because we ordered so early in advance. The location was ideal. The hotel was beautiful and had a parking lot on set. There's an outdoor pool that's within the pool and very cute. The staff was helpful and nice. Well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “20 time customer and local; look no further and ask for balcony...”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripper504
Reviews.Content: because the 43rd ranking that Trip advisor is so far off it's ridiculous. Grew up in the city and have stayed at just about all the hotels & B&Bs in both the Quarter and the Warehouse District over the past 10 years on trips back and can tell you if you're looking to party in the city then this is the place you want to stay. Hotel staff is great (ex. stayed here for the LSU game in Jan. and left my best pair of boots somewhere in the hotel but didn't recall where, called to check if they had been found a MONTH later and the lady said she knew exactly where they were; picked them up when I stayed there again for Mardi Gras) and the hotel/balconies are in the perfect place on Bourbon-the Royal Sonesta is too close to Canal St.. Rooms may be smaller and not quite as nice as some other hotels' but if you're in N.O. and in your room you must be in bed and their's are quite comfy. Lookin' for a Ritzesque room, go to the Ritz; looking for a clean, comfortable, perfectly located hotel with some of the friendliest staff nationwide-Inn on Bourbon, hands down best place in N.O.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...Good Location for Partying!”
Reviews.Author: canucks4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel intentionally to stay on Bourbon Street. The hotel itself is reasonable, not overly classy, but not a dump either. The rooms are quite small and have been well-used, but the staff kept them well-manicured and tidy. The front desk staff were pleasant, however, the rate they wanted to charge and the rate that I had booked with them (via the internet) was considerably different. I had with me my paper confirmation, hence I was charged at the rate I should have been, however, it left me thinking that if someone wasn't prepared or too shy to voice concern about the varying rates, they may have been stuck with a higher rate. What prompted the difference? Kind of makes you wonder..... The breakfast buffet was a little pricey for a small, mostly cold (including the hot) breakfast items. Tried it once, that was enough. The bar hours were varying as well, but we put that down to "off-season" hours, visited a liquor store, and had a stash in the room! No big deal. The location is perfect for clubs, loud music, walking around the French Quarter over to Canal, Jackson Square, Harrah's, etc. Be aware however, the noise of the music is loud, very loud, until about 3:00 in the morning and then the revellers leave very loudly from most places as well. To be honest, the music lulled us to sleep. The balcony was great fun for watching people (drunk and sober) experiencing New Orleans. We wanted the French Quarter experience and were very pleased with our choice. Would I stay here again? Unlikely, simply because we've done it and don't need to again. Next time, I'd stay at a quieter, newer facility with more amenities, but only because that is our taste, and does not reflect our satisfaction with Inn on Bourbon. If you want to be in the thick of things, I'd highly recommend this hotel, just be aware of what you are getting into and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: vogpr
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to stay a few days in New Orleans and decided to stay in this hotel based on the location (in the middle of Rue Bourbon!). And let me say that it was quite surprisingly good. The room faced the courtyard and pool so it was really quiet (which was my biggest fear of staying in Bourbon Street) so we where able to sleep well when exhausted of partying, watching the parades (though a few got cancelled due to the weather), eating Muffuletas and PoBoys, and drinking Abita Ambers and Sazeracs. It was like a little oasis of calm in the middle of the fun and sightseeing, which was the purpose of the trip. The room was like a normal hotel room with hints of New Orleans decor. So was the lobby which we found beautiful and adequate. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't give an opinion on that (but we recommend Napoleon House, it has awesome local food and drinks, and quite inexpensive). I don't give this hotel the full 5 stars because we requested with a month and a half in advance a king bed and they gave us a double but we really didn't mind but I can see other people being bothered by this. Stay in this hotel if you want to be in the middle of what makes New Orleans famous, the French Quarter and go there with an open, Laissez-faire attitude. For uptightedness go to Cape Cod or Palm Beach. Me: 32 gf: 28 Stay: Jan 23-28 2008

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ybrick
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. It was clean, updated and has good security. We booked a Bourbon Blacony room. We sat for hours... just watching people. I have to admit, there is a strip club across the street (the hotel is in "that section" of Bourbon Street). However, watching people's reactions to the "club" was a lot of fun. Someone mentioned bedbugs... our room was spotless. In fact, they were putting down new carpet in a room down the hall. The staff could not have been nicer! Everyone from the valet to housekeeping gave us great service. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: randris
Reviews.Content: The Inn on Bourbon was GREAT!! We stayed there Sept. 27-29,2007. The service was excellent,the rooms were spotless,the breakfast buffet was very good and you are right in the middle of Bourbon Street action. Two great bars, one across the street,Funky 544, and one next door, Razoo, were a geat time. This is our 4th visit to New Orleans and our 1st since Katrina and the French Quarter seemed to be doing great. Would recommend The Inn on Bourbon to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience in a hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: moonboy74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is less than they claim online but the service was the kicker! Reservations that were made thru Hotels.com were not honored at the whim of a rude night manager, Edwin Moore. He refused to even contact hotels.com to resolve this issue and demanded that my guest and my self pay extra to even stay. This was even after verifying our reservations the day before with the actual hotel desk staff. When we resigned to check in, paying in addition to the price that hotels.com charged us and resolve with the general manger in the morning, he kicked us out with no refund or a place to stay. I can say that the service was unacceptable. To add to the dissapointment, Ramada Inn corporate could have cared less either. Even after repeted complaints there has been nothing done to resolve this issue to this date. Beware of where you stay! You may know the name of the Chain the hotel operates under but Ramada does not care about customer service, customer satisfaction or repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jaina2002
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an optimal location to experience the nightlife in New Orleans- this hotel can't be beat. It's located right in the middle of Bourbon street and is just a short stumble from just about any hotspot. The check-in experience was a little frustrating. We got charged more than we were quoted when we made the reservation by phone. We had 4 people and they only marked us down for 2 when we got the quote for them, so they tried to charge us $35/person per night. After arguing that we told them we had 4 people and they quoted us the base price, the manager only charged us for one extra person. The valet parking experience isn't for the faint of heart. It's highly frustrating and very inefficient, however, it's still worth it to know that while you're out and about your car is safe. Plus, the prices are surprisingly low for this area. The rooms are very small though most visitors aren't coming here to stay in their rooms very long. We had four people in a room with 2 double beds and it was pretty cramped but it served its purpose. The rooms could be updated but were surprisingly very clean including the bathroom which I'm always wary about. This hotel is pretty noisy but you do have to realize you're on Bourbon street so that's to be expected. The lobby is very neat though their "Business Center" is more like a small closet with an ATM shoved in it. This hotel does have a security guard who checks for room keys to make sure that all people entering from the street are guests. This isn't a family hotel but it's a great place to take a short vacation without breaking the bank and it's an absolutely amazing and convenient way to get a glimpse of the New Orleans night life.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay. Nothing Special.”
Reviews.Author: safety86
Reviews.Content: First, I have stayed in this hotel many times prior to Katrina. This was my first post-Katrina stay at the Ramada. I love the location. I've never had a problem here. It has always been clean, but could stand some room renovations (scuffed wall paint, etc). Rooms are not the largest either. The information in the guest book in the room said wireless internet was available for a fee, however, it allowed me free access. Rooms facing Bourbon Street can be noisy, especially lower level rooms and balcony rooms. So if noise is an issue, get a courtyard/pool facing room. I have never had a bad experience with the hotel staff, but the front desk personnel can be a little stuffy acting. The Concierge is an awesome lady that can recommend some great trips and good food, too.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: junebug55
Reviews.Content: Worst experience in my many years of travel. We tryed to check in and called before going to dinner to confirm our reservation for two rooms with balconies on Bourbon Street. Upon arrival we were told our rooms were not on Bourbon Street and if we wanted those rooms it would be an additional $100 a night. We asked to see a manager and he did not appear for about ten minutes and when he did WOW! My friend tried to explain our dilema to the night manager . He interrupted her and she asked that she not be interrupted. He exploded and told us to leave his hotel and told us he would call the cops. I have been in public service work for many years and I have never seen a dog treated with the lack of respect that manager showed us that awful night. Happy ending however we went right down the bock to the Iberville Suites and were treated like royalty and ended up having our magical time in New Orleans. If New Orleans is trying to rebuild it's image and restore itself....this man needs to go By the way, I never said a word during this entire encounter and my advice is to spend your money elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nellie5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrific. We got there at noon and they were happy to store our luggage and take it to our room so that we could leave. The room was freshly painted and everything was new and nice. I forgot to ask for a room in the back so our first night was noisy..but they were very happy to face us over the pool and it was completely silent... We were set up with tours of the swamp and a city tour right away. We got map locations and places to eat. This location is unbeatable..you can walk up and down Bourboun...eat in the best restaurants and listen to jazz without ever driving..or feeling unsafe. There is a breakfast buffet, however, you can also just choose what you want...breakfast for 2 people came to just $12.00! I would never stay anyplace else. It was a really great place to stay and I am NOT a partier. Donna

Reviews.Title: “Bachelor party haven”
Reviews.Author: cmmonaco78
Reviews.Content: Went with 14 other guys for my bachelor party weekend. I fully expected to get thrown out of the hotel the first night. But surprisingly we did not. The rooms were excellent. We had a few balcony rooms on bourbon, and some looking at the pool. The staff was extremely accommodating , and the pool is very nice for a hotel on bourbon. The best part of this place though is the location. Right on bourbon in the middle of it all. If you are going to the big easy to party like a rockstar then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for my next trip ... next year!”
Reviews.Author: betsyIndiana
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel every year for 25 years. Made the mistake of staying somewhere else once and will never do that again. The hospitality at the Inn on Bourbon is fantastic. Last month when we stayed there, we got in a few hours before check in. They checked us in early with no additional charge ... very friendly and willing to go the extra mile. Can't wait til next year!

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than expected”
Reviews.Author: Tigerfan1979
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. I wanted to be close to the action, and I wasn't terribly concerned aoubt how nice the room was. We were very pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It is not just a party destination, but a very classy place. Yes, the rooms are a bit rundown, but it is much nicer than any other Ramada I've ever stayed at and the location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Roadhard”
Reviews.Author: abaer51
Reviews.Content: this hotel is roadhard to put it best. It's a nice hotel with old charm but it's worn down and you can tell the rooms have been partied in and seen quite a bit for many years. They're also a bit small but kept tidy considering the wear and tear they've gotten. service was good and it is a great location if you're looking to party.

Reviews.Title: “For A Good Time Call...The Inn On Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: jrandtim
Reviews.Content: I recently visited New Orleans for Easter weekend and had the time of my life! I visited with my partner, my sister and her boyfriend. We are from Texas City and drove to New Orleans Friday. We arrived around noon and since check in wasn't till 4pm the hotel held our luggage for us while we ventured out on Bourbon Street. We listened to some live music and grabbed some World Famous Hand Grenades and checked back about 2:30pm and we're happy to find that our rooms were ready. We had two adjoining rooms sharing a balcony right on the corner of Bourbon and Toulouse. The rooms were nice, clean and very comfortable. We took advantage of our balcony and threw beads to people on the street every night. If you are going to New Orleans for a quiet weekend....then get a room on the backside overlooking the pool area or stay somewhere else because this is the place to stay if you want to party! I plan on visiting again soon and I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but this is the problem!”
Reviews.Author: bennettclan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I was a bit naive about New Orleans and it was on the only street I'd heard of. It would have been perfect, except we were travelling with a 3 year old. I'm sure I don't need to say any more. We didn't know to ask for a quiet room, so it was like trying to sleep at a rock concert. The next night we were moved to a quieter room facing the inner courtyard. It was so quiet we slept like logs. Fantastic place in a brilliant location, but perhaps not for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure you have a detailed confirmation of your rates!”
Reviews.Author: happyadventurer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Inn on Bourbon. Overall, it was very nice. The lobby was elegant & the rooms were clean & nice. Everything was fine with our stay & went as I expected until we checked out. I had booked 2 rooms at the AAA rate. When we checked out we received the rate I had reserved for one room but not for the other (which was over a $100 error). When i questioned why, the front desk person just said that was what his computer showed. I explained that I had made the reservation for the 2 rooms together, that I had confirmed by reservations with the hotel & everything was in order. The only thing that wasn't was when I had requested a confirmation, they sent it simply stating the dates & the price for the first night. Not what type of rooms I had reserved nor the rates for the other 2 nights (which were less). I called back & requested a confirmation that gave all details, I was assured that my reservations were with the AAA rate, everything was in order, & they would forward a detailed confirmation. I never received the detailed confirmation before I left. Since I didn't have a detailed confirmation, the front desk person would not give me the AAA rate nor would he bring the manager (Cynthia) out for me to talk to. Since I was in a hurry tocatch a plane, I said I would contact them after I got home. On my way to the airport, I called the national reservation line for Ramada who had the correct information. They e-mailed the complete reservation to my office. The following day, I called the Inn on Bourbon & talked with the accountant (Kris) who said she didn't know anything about my situation but would check into it. I called her back later that afternoon & she told me my credit card had been refunded the overcharged amount. Thanks Kris. To the young man who was at the front desk on Tuesday morning......you have poor customer satisfaction skills!! You should have brought out the manager when I had asked & at the very least, you should have contacted your national reservation line. How is it that they had the correct reservations but you did not & why didn't you bother checking with them? Long story short.......Have a detailed confirmation with your rates & room description before you check in here!

Reviews.Title: “Best in" The Big Easy"”
Reviews.Author: CancunCajun
Reviews.Content: Having been to The French Quarter many times, and having stayed everywhere from The Monteleone, Cotton Exchange, Omni Queen & Crescent, Holiday Inn (both) among others, I can't recall at the moment, plus some further down & much seedier, past Checkpoint Charlies' for those of you who know how far down the road I'm talking about, we've always wanted to stay at The Ramada Inn On Bourbon, because it's a lovely hotel & it's right smack in the middle of all the action. If your planning on doing alot of paryting on Bourbon St & in the heart of the quarter, (especially at night) this is THE BEST place to stay. It's quite a hike from Canal street to Bourbon st. My husband & I, wanted a balcony room overlooking Bourbon, but we didn't want to pay the extra money, because it was this past January that we went, and we knew it would be cold, so we opted for a Toulouse Balcony room instead. We could see the crowds on Bourbon, and one of the hottest bars in the quarter is right there on the corner, so you see ALOT. =D . Let me say that the Staff at the Ramada Inn On Bourbon are THE NICEST, MOST ACCOMIDATING people, we have ever had the pleasure of dealing with... from the valet, to check in, to bell hop, to room, took a total of 15 minutes! ( and we got there early) Honestly, we've stayed at alot of hotels, motels & resorts, and these polished, friendly professionals were some of THE BEST!!! Way to go guys! We had booked our rooms using a AAA discount. When we got there, the lady at the front desk noticed that we were actually paying MORE than what she could offer it to us for! She saved us about $100 just starting with the room. Valet charges roughly $20 a day, it's charged to your room so you don't have the hassle of dealing with that seperately, and believe me your car is pulled around, with your baggage already loaded, waiting on YOU when you check out. It took us all of 7 minutes, from check out, to driving off! ( and it was Sugar Bowl Weekend) The valet made sure, by asking us if we had our cameras along with anything else we might need when we checked in. The rooms are very nice. Coffee maker, in room safe, free highspeed internet access, luxury bedding. The pillows & bedding were absolutely awesome. Bed, Bath & Beyond toiletries. Wrought Iron Balconies, with Bistro table & chairs, cable T.V. They had movies that you could purchase that were still in Theaters. So, we watched movies from our room. (That was a plus for us) We didn't feel like going out one night ( hung over), so we watched movies & watched the crowds from the balcony. The security is the best I've ever seen. I believe we were in the safest hotel in the quarter. Police ride horseback in the quarter. We went during the SugarBowl, so their were alot of rowdy college kids, just out to party and have fun, the horses were tied right along side the alley portion of our hotel. So, we thought that was a plus. The only negative, ( which it really isn't a negative) is the restraunt was undergoing renovations and room service was unavailable at the time that we went. We went to NO about 4 weeks before Katrina hit, and this was our first time to go back since then. There are very few buildings that actually were boarded up . The Quarter really wasn't damaged as bad, as say the '9th Ward'. Most of the images you see on the news, internet etc, is from the 9th Ward & not the Quarter. The Quarter is still kicking & going strong. We noticed alot of help wanted signs. That was so positive to see! We're going back to our home away from home, and this is our new Hotel of choice. If you're wanting absolute solitude & quiet, stay in the Garden District or closer to Canal & take a cab if you don't feel like walking. ( $5-$10) Once we closed the french doors to the balcony, & pulled the double black out curtains we were sleeping like babies, and the music from the street was nothing more than a muted sound lulling us to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get any closer to Bourbon Street action”
Reviews.Author: RAINKIR
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you want to stay in the middle of all the Bourbon Street excitement. There is non-stop action here - endless bars and clubs and a great place to people watch. With that comes a lot of noise, at all hours of the night. If you are going to party New Orleans style, this hotel is for you. And if you want to "kick it up a notch" get a balcony room overlooking Bourbon Street and have fun throwing beads to the crowds below. If you're planning on spending most of your time in the French Quarter this is a great location, as you won't have to worry about transportation around the city. If you want to stay somewhere with a more personal touch and in a more quiet location, I can highly recommend the 1896 O'Malley House B&B (#1 rated in New Orleans). Either way, you will have a great time in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: xpnsve
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of September, 2006. The room was small, but beautiful. We had a balcony the overlooked Toulouse Street on the 3rd floor. The room was kept neat and clean. We found it to be quiet at night and we were able to sleep comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: argonaut
Reviews.Content: This month, my boyfriend and I visited New Orleans for the first time. We weren't sure what to expect after Katrina's damage, but we knew we'd be in for an experience. When we arrived and drove down Bourbon Street, I was somewhat surprised to hear how loud it was. I was a little nervous that the inside of the hotel would reflect the insanity of the street below. As soon as we got inside, I realized I didn't have to worry. The inside of the hotel was clean, quiet, and very welcoming. The front desk and concierge were friendly and ready to answer any questions we had. Our room had a balcony which overlooked the courtyard and pool, which was really nice. From our balcony and the pool, the noise from Bourbon Street was completely blocked out, but the great thing was, we were in walking distance of all the bars, and could party whenever we wanted to, but then retreat to our room when we were done. Unfortunately, Katrina made a big mess of a good deal of New Orleans. The French Quarter (where this hotel is) didn't get hit as bad, but many other parts of the city are still in terrible shape, even 9 months later. If you get the chance, get down there for a visit to give New Orleans' economy a little boost. If you're looking to party, get a room with a Bourbon Street view, if you want a little peace and quiet, give the courtyard view a try.

Reviews.Title: “Inn on Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: asmolen
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews before settling on this property. I had concerns, but the rate was too good to pass up. The plus side of this hotel is the location. You can't beat it. In previous years, I have stayed on Canal and Tchopitoulas, but the walk takes everythink out of you. I felt that Canal is showing a lot of wear and tear since Katrina and was glad that I switched my reservations from the Marriott to this Ramada. I think the staff is doing it's best to meet the needs of the guests. I only got wash cloths in my bathroom one day, but it wasn't the end of the world. I usually let things like that bother me, but when you think of all that this area has been through, a washcloth really doens't matter much. My family and I enjoyed ever minute that we spent in NOLA in April. The people are as friendly as ever, and grateful for tourism. Don't stay at this hotel if you are looking for a restful night's sleep. My room was completely vulnerable to any sounds produced in the adjacent rooms. But it only lasted one night, all the drunks checked out Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Hope you can take the Smell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New Orleans and probably the last. We drove from Michigan to FL then to New Orleans for a two night stay. We saw a lot damage to homes and businesses from the highway and wondered where is all the monies that everyone donated from Hurricane Katrina going too? We thought it would be nice and convienant to stay on Bourbon Street, so we could stumble back to our room if need be. They closed the street the two nights we were there so it was easy to walk around. We woke up early the next morning to walk around and visit some shops and buy some souveniors. This was a mistake all the shops were still mostly closed. The businesses that are open are out sweeping and cleaning the sidewalks. The smell was terrible in the morning with all the garbage, urine and vomit smells. We had to walk a few blocks over to avoid the smell. The hotel was nice overall, they were doing some outside remodling work. The breakfest was expensive about $12 each for the buffet. We asked for a king size non smoking room when we booked it, but was given two double beds and the room did have a smoke smell to it. I knew there would be a parking fee for staying, they charge $20 a day plus taxes. I was not overly impressed with this trip to New Orleans, hopefully one day they can rebuild after Katrina.

Reviews.Title: “Guest Beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from staying at the Inn on Bourbon April 21-24, 2006. I have to start by saying that we are never usually complainers and understand that things go wrong and no place is perfect. Upon check in, we asked the front desk clerk if she was giving us a good room and she says Oh, yes it is a nice room right on Bourbon Street. Ya-hoo for us! Our excitement was very short lived once we saw this great room on Bourbon. You could barely see a thing because we were right over an awning of the Balcony room below us. We had to crane our necks and press our cheeks against the window panes to get a glimpse down the street. The room overall was nicely appointed with a pleasing color scheme. We are generally early risers and hit the streets before 9:00am each morning. We always hang the sign that says "refresh our room". This was of no use - each day we came back to the room at about 2:00 to rest before dinner and the room was still not done. We figured that the room finally was cleaned at about 3:00 each day. One day, we only received 1 bath towel, and no toilet paper - I was finally able to track someone down to get what we would need. No other rooms had their signs out, but they all managed to get their rooms cleaned before ours - go figure.... I suppose the general excuse is because of Katrina. I am sorry, but this excuse does not cut it on this issue. On the morning of our departure, Monday, I called down to the front desk to see about a late check out. Their normal check out time is 12:00noon. I asked to stay until 2 or 3, and was told that they could only extend until 1:00. What a joke since our maid does not even bother to clean the room until 3:00! We tried to use the business center to print out our boarding passes only to find that their internet connection was not working. They called an employee to fix the problem. In the mean time, a nice lady who works in their sales department was walking by and offered her office to print them out. Alas, an employee who knows about guest service. We were very greatful to her.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price and Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and three friends stayed here for the Essence Festival. We were worried after some reviews, but we are all in our mid-twenties (broke) so we picked where the price and the action seemed to be. Our check-in was smooth and the room was nice. Sorta small, but that was the only thing. Our room looked out over the pool and though the shared balcony (it runs the length of the rooms overlooking the pool) was different, we met some new friends this way. The hotel is smack dab in the middle of the French Quarter, so stepping outside the doors is a little chaotic, so hope you like that ( we did.) I heard the security policy was strict here (you have to show a room key to re-enter the hotel, but the guards were not Nazis about this and we had no problems at all.) This may seem like a nuisance to some, but when you have people drunk and being loud only steps from your hotel door, you are grateful for it. Only complaint is that the breakfast seems pricey, but that's minor and it is all you can eat. Hopefully, this hotel and the Big Easy will bounce back from everything. :)

Reviews.Title: “A visit that made history”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to have the chance to stay at the Inn on Bourbon during the last few days of its normalcy. MY fiance and I were guest on the friday and saturday before Hurricane Katrina hit and destroyed what we know as the big easy. Our experience at the Inn was excellent and it added to our unforgettable time in New Orleans. I will always remember the Inn on Bourbon because it is where I became engaged. Hopefully many more people will be able to stay at the Inn and share the same great experience that I did in 2005.

Reviews.Title: “An idea location on the heart of Bourbon St.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family was very pleased with the location. I rated the property a 3 because it seemed to have somewhat like a damp smell to it but we soon got use to it. The staff was nice but most of them seemed to be new and kind of clueless in how to provide great guest service. But if you want to be on the heart of Bourbon St this is truly the idea location. The price was excellent and it was worth that and then some.

Reviews.Title: “The Ramada was great!”
Reviews.Author: briehl01
Reviews.Content: Me and four friends went to New Orleans for a girls weekend and chose the Ramada based on the location and online reviews. The hotel did not disappoint. The location is great - right on Bourbon - next to Razu. The rooms are clean, spacious, and comfortable. I would recommend upgrading to a balcony room - the rooms are larger and the balconies are great. Balcony rooms look over Bourbon, Toulouse Street, or the pool - it all depends what you want to see - we had two rooms - one overlooking Toulouse and one over the pool. Both had their perks! The staff was great and very accomodating to any and all requests. There is a doorman at night who is there for security purposes - that is a nice touch since I wouldn't want people in and out of my hotel at 4am! There is also a nice breakfast buffet every morning. It's perfect if you'd rather sleep in after a late night. The food is ok but the convenience is great. The pool was very nice - beautiful and well maintained setting. There was a sufficient amount of tables, chairs, and umbrellas. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel, in the Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: NJhunny
Reviews.Content: Myself, and a long time friend spent this years Essence Music Festival at The Inn on Bourbon, and it was wonderful. This is a beautifully appointed hotel, with an excellent staff. We had an inner courtyard room with french doors opening onto the wrought iron balcony, overlooking the courtyard. While the party was in full swing on Bourbon St., we never heard a thing either in our room, or when sitting out on the balcony. This hotel is in the perfect location for enjoying all that NOLA has to offer. A short walk down Bourbon will take you to the street cars, the party is right outside your door, and a short walk in another direction will take you to the French Market area. I am VERY particular about my hotel stays, and this one passed the test. However, I would caution against more than 2 people sharing a room, as they are on the small size. Other than that small item, we had NO complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Having fun in New Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: grandmacc
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Inn known as the Inn on Burbon Streeet in the French Quarter was the perfect location to have fun in the French Quarter. The hotel staff is very friendly, helpful and attentive to the guests needs. Everything from this hotel was handy and very close to all the fun activities, restaurants, and the casino in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bgff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in march 2005 (Eastern). It was our first time in NO and it was wonderful. We didn't have a balcony room, so our room (4th floor) was quiet, no noises from the streets. Room and bath: clean and spacious. Staff: friendly.The pool area is very nice with its courtyard, too. The hotel is right in the middle of the French District. You step out the door right into Bourbon Street where it all happens! Very comfortable hotel with everything you need to see in NO right on the doorstep or within a very short walking distance. We would stay here again. We also recommand the NOAIRPORTSHUTTLE it worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: early1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from "nawlins".4/28 and had a wonderful experience. We stayed at the Ramada Plaza Inn on Bourbon. I read some bad reviews on this hotel and none of them were true. We had a great room with a balcony overlooking the pool. It was clean and did not stink. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We will stay here again. We were within walking distance to everything. I'm telling all my friends to go, it's a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: gwtwdebbi
Reviews.Content: Booked the Balcony on Bourbon Celebration package from the Inn on Bourbon web site...very pricy but worth it for a great surprise birthday trip. The hotel was extremely accomodating in assisting me with a birthday surprise which my husband did not know about other couples joining us at the hotel. Thank you to the hotel! As others have written, you will not get a good night sleep in the room early in the evening, but, hey, why did you go to New Orleans anyway! Great location....Great time!

Reviews.Title: “loved the beat - great loaction”
Reviews.Author: VINEYBOY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in january 2005. The hotel is superbly placed on the Bourbon, however, the downside to that could be the noise. Our room was on the top floor, but on the corner of Bourbon street and Toulouse..........therefore the beat from the clubs could be felt. However, the room was so comfortbale, an dthe bed such a joy, indeed i had the nicest sleeps here in 10 days touring the deep south.......

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Ccowden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel the night before we left for our honeymoon on a cruise. Great customer service and very helpful. The room was very clean. The lobby was very nice. We enjoyed the experience very much. If you are looking for a hotel on Bourbon Street this is a great one to stay at. We did not have a balcony room so can't tell you how that was. But this hotel was located right in the French Quarter and easy access to all the excitement. I give it an A.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGoddest
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans. This hotel made our trip more enjoyable. You couldn't ask for a better location. Right in the center of Bourbon Street. Since New Orleans has such high crime this location was key. The hotel was beautiful and the staff couldn't have been more friendly and nicer. We stayed for 5 nights and then took a cruise and returned for another 2 nights. The bell service was nice enough to hold some of our luggage during our cruise. The breakfast was good, the staff there was the friendliest, a little over priced, but well worth it. The only complaint is if you are a light sleeper, this hotel is located where the bars and clubs can be nosey, but who goes to New Orleans to sleep. If I ever return to New Orleans I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Derohn
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying at the Ramada 12/1-12/5/04. The hotel is a nice hotel despite some of the reviews. My room was clean and the location was excellent. I didnt mind the noise at all. I mean I have heard that the French Quarters was a live place for starters so I didnt go there expecting anything less. Only problem I had with my room was the tv remote, and when I called they came within 5 mins with a brand new remote. I would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in staying in the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Ramada Plaza Hotel in November 2004 and had a wonderful trip. I scanned all of the reviews for a hotel in NO and was pleased with the reviews I read for this hotel and decided to give it a try and was not disappointed at all. The staff was helpful and courteous and the room was clean and the location was the best. When there was a problem with the fire alarm and I complained, within 5 minutes maintenance came knocking at my door. In some places I read the hotel was a 3 star but I definitely give it a 4 1/2 star!!! I made my reservation through Expedia and got an excellent price and had no problem when checking in. Bourbon Street is very very noisy and at the corner across the street from the hotel is a pub going until at least 2 am but it did not bother me in the least, they played great music! I would definitely go there again and highly recommend this hotel and hope my review helps someone like others helped me!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've returned to this hotel many times, despite the reviews. My room has always been as promised and very clean. The staff has always been great too. I guess they remember me from previous stays, but they do seem to go out of their way to be nice to me. The location is GREAT!!! I don't recommend a balcony room on Bourbon Street unless you want to party all night.... trust me! I like it because it is centered on Bourbon near the places I like to visit and near Jackson Sq. too. The breakfast buffet is ok, but limited.

Reviews.Title: “DONT LISTEN TO NEGATIVE REVIEWS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be given a bad rating. In my opinion, this is NOT TRUE. The hotel is in one of the best locations in the french quarter. Yes, it is noisy and people do not sleep much and come in and out at all hours, BUT THIS IS WHAT BOURBON STREET IS ALL ABOUT!!!! The hotel has recently been renovated with brand new amentities in the rooms, including brand new carpet. The rooms are average in size, but have very nice furnishings, and have large barhtrooms. The balconies are outstanding and roomy, with easy french door access. The rest of the hotel is kept up very nicely, especially the lobby and courtyard. Parking was easy and convenient, a rare thing at french quarter hotels. If you are ready for the REAL french quarter challenge, this is the place to stay. You will have lots of fun, and when you stumble back into your room at 4 am, you will be very glad that you are steps away. Truly worth the money!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: GaryColeman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn on Bourbon for four nights in mid September, I asked for a quiet room and got a very nice room on the top floor. Internet access was free, location was excellent and the staff were very nice. The only problems was the breakfast was a little expensive (approx $12) and during one night the was a lot of noise from other guests arguing for hours but you cannot blame the hotel for that. On the whole very good.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for three nights at the Ramada (The Inn on Bourbon) right in the middle of the French District. You step out the door right into Bourbon Street where it all happens! Very comfortable hotel with everything you need to see in new Orleans right on the doorstep or within a very short walking distance. An added bonus is a free internet access service which allows you to keep up to date with your e-mails, and to book hotels at your next place(s) of visit. We would certainly head for The Inn on Bourbon on any future visit to New Orleans. David & Ishbel Nairne

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret on Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, in walking distance to great restaurants, local attractions, and lots of great jazz clubs. The staff were friendly and helpful and there is even a concierge to help with tours and good advice. Rooms were lovely with French doors leading to wonderful balcony overlooking the street. What is there not to like!! It has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “neutral”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a good location, rooms smell because bourbon street smells like drink/vomit. Staff quasi rude/maid service good. This hotel has good security and doormen. Rooms are well appointed. Would recommend for the first time visitor, who is not big on sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun First Trip to the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: Amy413
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove to New Orleans for a wedding in late June, and we stayed at the Inn on Bourbon. Cons, I can't give it five stars because: 1) We could have hung meat in the room, the A/C kept it so cold. 2) Parking at the hotel is extremely expensive - $20/day for guests, and we never took our car out of the garage - we didn't need to! The hotel is in the heart of the French Quarter, and everything was accessible on foot or via the trolley. 3) We were on the fourth floor, so there was no balcony, and the windows were painted shut. 4) Some drunk guy was running up and down the hall at 4:30 am yelling, "Fire!" (but that's hardly the hotel's fault). 5) The door between our room and the one next door was secure, but we were able to hear every detail of the conversation in the next room. Pros: 1) Location, location, location! It was a very convenient stumble from the bars back to our room. 2) Courteous staff - I can't imagine what the other reviewers are talking about. Everyone we met was extremely pleasant and accommodating. The bellhop gave us excellent (i.e. better than Mapquest) directions for getting out of town when we left. 3) Clean room - we had no issues with the cleanliness of the room, or with the housekeeping staff, supplies, etc. We had everything we needed. 4) Lovely public areas - the lobby/bar area was pleasant to relax in while waiting for our friends. If you are driving, be aware that you'll have to overshoot Bourbon Street, then make a U-turn if you're trying to turn left down Bourbon. You will want to turn left at the street past the hotel (the hotel is on the corner) to get into the parking area. Parking is valet only. Don't bother unloading your bags on Bourbon street, as we did. They'll take care of them for you when you park your car.

Reviews.Title: “It was 'OK'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit over-priced, however our room was clean. The employees were helpful. My major complaint was the fact that the police had all of the French Quarter roads blocked off for vehicles, and we couldn't get back to the room after the Essence Festival. We didn't want to party all night! One night it was 3am when we finally figured out how to get back to the room around all the police/security barricades. I do not recommend anyone on getting a room in the French quarter!

Reviews.Title: “It don't get more convenient than this”
Reviews.Author: dunc28480
Reviews.Content: I visited NO for the first time last year with a group of friends and had possible the best week of my life. The hotel itself is in the best location possible right in the middle of Bourbon street. It's clean and the staff are friendly. If you're looking for somewhere quiet then maybe look elsewhere but we found it to be ideal and we've booked to return without even considering another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Coming from a big city like ny, it was a pleasure to meet such laid back, courteous people as i've met in new orleans. My family and I stayed at the Ramada Plaza Inn On Bourbon and this hotel hightened our stay in New Orleans. The staff was all smiles and very pleasant. Even before we enter the room there was a message waiting for us, welcoming us to the hotel and the hotel staff extended the courtesy, that if we needed anything to feel free to ask. We had a problem with our bathroom tub and within minutes of us reporting it there was an engineer there to fix it. The manager even called to make sure that everything else was ok with our rm. Although my parents didn't want to spring for a balcony room, the room we stayed in had everything we needed. It was comfortable and the housekeepers made sure it was clean every morning. The conceirge and bell staff was helpful in aiding us with tours and resteraunts. I especially liked hanging out in the courtyard, it was beautiful and very peaceful, and that was cool since the hotel is right on Bourbon St. it was nice to sit in the yard and not hear a peep from the party going on on Bourbon. My family and I are already making plans for a return trip and we're definitely staying at the Inn on Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Inn on Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Inn last August. We enjoyed it so much we are headed back this August. This will be my 6th trip to NOLA & I have stayed in all manner of room, from a suite in a time share to a small room at the St. Anne Marie Antoinette. I loved the Ramada as much for its location as for its personality. You do not go to New Orleans to stay in a "typical" hotel, at least I don't. I want the narrow rooms that feel like "old times", I can stay at a Holiday Inn anywhere. We found the staff to be extremely friendly & helpful; we requested a frig for the room & had one within an hour of check-in. The concierge gave us several great restaurant suggestions, for restaurants "off the beaten path". All of the complaints about security make no sense to me. I want to feel safe in my person & my belongings while on vacation. I would think others would also! Who wants strangers roaming the hallways? I expect that at Mardi Gras or other holiday/festival times, the staff must be meaner and more strict, because those are the times when such measures are warranted. This is a typical New Orleans hotel, not the Ritz, but if you want the Ritz, go to New York! I love the Inn and recommend it to all who can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “A Ruined Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have used the reccommendations of tripadvisor.com's visitors many times and have never been disappointed, until now. Why? Because I did not read the reviews before I booked (and I prepaid and could not cancel). I agree with the others that say that the staff is extremely rude and stuck up. They think just because they have one of the few properties actually on Bourbon Street that they are the bomb! I am not going to go into as much detail as others have, but I would not reccommend this hotel to anyone in my circle of friends or family. To summarize... we had a small, smelly, musty room with green mold growing out of control in our tub area. Not only is this not a good choice for a hotel while visiting New Orleans it is potentially a health hazard. Oh, and I never saw one staff member smile or look happy to be there. The restaurant leaves alot to be desired too. I am off my soap box, do what you want to do. Outside of the hotel issues, out 3rd anniversary went off without a hitch! We did tour a hotel while we were there, called Iberville Suites by Ritz-Carlton, FABULOUS hotel with a free full-american breakfast buffet they said! That's where we are staying next time. And their rates are better than Ramada. Go figure!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Meredith159
Reviews.Content: We will never stay at this hotel again. The staff was rude and accomodations just so-so. Not worth the price of the room we stayed in.
